reviews.text: I just love the new place and even I always just order take out it&#39;s still as pleasant as staying in.<br>The staff are always friendly.<br>I love the shielas avocado  chicken salad in particular and the honey wheat bead that they give you initially is to die for with butter of course

I enjoyed this location! I went for dinner on a Monday night and it was very quick to get in. Within 4-5 minutes, my party of five was seated. They didn&#39;t use the beepers most locations use, as they were turning tables over very quickly and didn&#39;t need them.<br><br>Our food was DELICIOUS! Fresh tasting, and the portions were larger than usual for Cheesecake Factory (which is saying a lot).<br><br>You&#39;re gonna have to wait for your food, though. It took a second for them to get us our bread and butter. The specialty drinks also took a while longer than the water/fountain drinks. Then, the food took about 35-40 minutes. Since it wasn&#39;t that busy, the wait was weird. <br><br>Our server was good, but she seemed to be confused a lot. When we ordered drinks and our food, she always looked at us funny and had us repeat it a few times. Nothing too crazy, but a little frustrating when you&#39;re ordering drinks, then appetizers, then entrees lol.

This food is terrible it doesnt taste right and theres nothing on either plate! DO NOT COME HERE! Im done giving this place chances I used to come here every other day 5 years ago. Seriously this is redicoulous. Im not asking for a refuund bc i would be told i ate it when there was nothing on my plate to begin with.... see for yourself!

My sister loves Cheesecake Factory and I always make fun of her for it. I recently tried the food again for the first time in a while and it is not bad at all. Their lunch specials (at least for this location) run until 5 pm. We made it just in time to order from that menu. I had the Louisiana pasta (Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce). This is similar to their Cajun pasta. Both very flavorful, with a kick. My only complaint would be that the chicken was a bit too crispy/dry for my taste. The portions are huge here, even the lunch portions - do you really get a bang for your buck. I wouldn&#39;t mind eating lunch here again. Guess I won&#39;t be laughing at my sister anymore.

I took some teens here for a birthday celebration. Our waiter Koriey was super nice and made sure we had what we needed. For the service I would rate this a 5 star CF.<br>For food, I just ordered a small plate of taquitos because I was saving my appetite for cheesecake. These were quite tasty and actually had 6 on the plate...would be a good appetizer to share and was pretty filling as a main. The girls had tune poke (gigantic!) and avocado toast.<br>For dessert I had the cinnabon cheesecake...my gave and is not offered in every CF location. We also had a cookie dough cheesecake which was good, but not as awesome as the cinnabon.<br>Even though this is a chain, I give the food here a solid 4. <br>What knocked my review down a star or two is the sorry state of the ladies room. Filthy and no tp in any of the 4 stalls and there were two waitresses standing by the sink gabbing and brushing their hair, oblivious to the distress of the customers trying to find some tp. Had to leave and use a restroom in the mall.

I love Cheesecake Factory... for the cheesecake. I will say most items on the menu are delicious. I typically order the avocado chicken club, and Reese&#39;s cheesecake for dessert. I&#39;ve also enjoyed the fried cheese, nachos, loaded tator tots and others. The only think I&#39;ve tried and was disappointed with was the cheesesteak. I love the Georgia peach drink. Expensive frozen drink, but tasty. <br><br>I will say I don&#39;t not like the way the seating is set up. The tables are way too close. I also think the lighting is way too dark.<br><br>Service is usually great. The brown bread is amazing

Normally cheesecake is fine besides them forgetting cake or items on pick up which has been an issue but today is different. I placed an order online for curbside pickup, when you go onto the site it says something along the lines of &#34;all orders will be curbside pick up and you will be texted when your order is ready&#34; So I place my order and the message on my order as well as in email form says come inside to bakery counter, upon several calls to clarify during the pandemic no one answered as per their usual unprofessionalism/poor customer service, after a while I got a fax machine sound so I hung up. Upon arriving to a load of cars I go inside to way too many people probably also confused to what to do. I wait in a long line to get to the front and after 20 minutes they tell me they can&#39;t find the order, I tell them what it is and they have no recollection and tell me to tell them what the order is and have to remake it. By now I&#39;m furious and after a while they finally tell me to wait in my car and they will bring it to me. During all of this one of the runners had no mask on and kept taking it off. This is piss poor service on a regular day but on take out only during a PANDEMIC not only did the staff, management and corporate all fail but they failed miserably to protect the lives of their patrons during this terribly hard time. <br><br>I am an essential worker on the frontlines fighting corona so before you say it&#39;s hard on everyone blah blah I am there and way deeper into this than sitting in. Restaurant making mistakes that CAN and SHOULD be avoided to protect lives. This is not joke, not a game and these things can not happen while hundreds are losing their lives a day in this area, fix it or close down until after this is over so you can go back to screwing up orders, not now. <br><br>Avoid this place like the plague AT LEAST until this is over, they have lost my business forever. Anyone familiar w me or my reviews knows i typically never leave a 1 Star or write something like this. Awful.
Great choice of cheesecakes but they have healthier options on the menu too. Had the veggie burger and it was great. Go early or the wait will be very long.

Great for a drink and quick bite before a movie at Riverside Square in Paramus. Always busy and very loud but convenient. The staff here was spot on tonight, shout out to Kakeena !<br><br>Not always a fan of The Cheesecake Factory due to it being so commercial and WAY too many choices on the menu but it does serve a purpose.

One of the most unorganized Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to. Curbside pick up is a joke. Customers are made to wait in the outside patio while it&#39;s insanely cold. Curbside pickup host has NO CLUE as to when the order is ready or not, is not helpful at all and brushes off any inquiries. Simply told to wait in the car or outside to hear the name of order. After patiently waiting for 45 mins, in the cold mind you, still didn&#39;t know where my order was. Every time I order from this location, they get something wrong. But this time around, was chaotic and immensely inconvenient to the customers. Each menu item is an average of $20, but the customers are treated like they are waiting for free food. Finally when the food did come out, I was told that they misplaced it and when I checked it was cold. I was so over the situation that I just took my food and went home after waiting almost an hour for food that was ordered IN ADVANCE ONLINE! I get better service when ordering $5 fried rice from my local Chinese restaurant. Waste of money and time.

The Cheesecake Factory is located in Riverside Square mall near the Sephora. It&#39;s a great spot to grab dinner and drinks pre-movie night.<br><br>They have indoor seating and &#34;outdoor&#34; seating - the &#34;outdoor&#34; seating means you&#39;re literally sitting outside of the Cheesecake Factory INSIDE of the mall. Either way, this location is always busy and do not take reservations.<br><br>There are so many options on the menu to choose from but my go to meal is the buffalo chicken blasts with a side of fries. They&#39;re DELICIOUS and fried to perfection. The portions are hefty so be prepared - it&#39;s totally okay to share, I won&#39;t judge.<br><br>All drinks are poured strong so enjoy it!

Sat by the bar this time around and ordered dinner and dessert as well. Great service here as well. Quesadillas were awesome. Couldn&#39;t leave without getting my favorite cheesecake, the celebration cheesecake

I frequent here often since I don&#39;t live too far, but recently I haven&#39;t been feeling the quality from them that I am used to.<br><br>Normally, I&#39;ll select the Steak Diane, but my goal is to stay away from red meat unless I&#39;m at a steak house. I also really love the Chicken Madera (they have a combo with the Steak Diane). <br><br>Recently, I tried the Parmesan-Herb Crusted Chicken that comes with green beans and mash; I was disappointed to say the least. It comes with three pieces of chicken and one of them was burnt and over cooked; i requested no greens and they put asparagus on my plate. I also asked for mash potatoes and they literally gave me the scrappings of the leftover mash in the pan, there were dried out clumps of the mash that had changed color (indicating they had been there all day and/or were just scraps that were left). My waiter came over and literally told me &#34;this is the last bit of mash we have, I was upset, but I ate the two edible pieces of chicken. I was told my request for potatoes could not be accommodated because they were closing soon.<br><br>I asked for another drink, but couldn&#39;t get it, since the waiter did not let me know when it was last call.<br><br>I only live 7 mins away so I would love to give them another chance, but I think I prefer the Jersey City location.

This place was great. I went here for my anniversary and the staff was really accommodating. Our server was really friendly and handled all of our orders with care and in a timely fashion. The food was great, I ordered a New York Strip with the bone in, medium, it was great. Nothing else to say. My girlfriend ordered a cake and the staff even wrote &#34;Happy Anniversary&#34; on the plate. I love it. I would definitely recommend this location <br><br>Btw I also ordered a Passion Fruit Mojito and it was amazing!!!! We also ordered El Diablo and that picked quite a punch, we loved it

Absolute best mushroom glam burger. Thicc (with 2 c&#39;s) &amp; cooked to perfection. The meatloaf specialty dish was delicious and the Baja tacos were hot &amp; tasty. I inhaled the strawberry cheesecake. 10 out of 10 stars on this quarantine order. I cannot wait to order again.

Went a couple months ago with friends and ordered the pepperoni flatbread, mac and cheese, and a couple cheesecakes. Flatbread was very good and a good size! Mac and cheese was hot and cheesy, definitely will be ordering again. Prices are pretty reasonable, and so many different kinds of cheesecake to try. Cheesecake itself is pretty filling and will be coming back just to get dessert!
So packed we had to stalk tables to get a seat In the bar or wait 2 hours to sit. Food was good but service was alright

Since I&#39;ve been vegan I haven&#39;t ate at the Cheesecake Factory until recently. I ordered the Vegan Cobb Salad and the Veggie burger without mayo. The salad was huge and very good made with fresh veggies. The veggie burger was pretty good too.

The complementary bread is really good. I got the ahi tartare which was really good. A bit small for its price. My friend got the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic. The chicken and mushrooms in the pasta were amazing. We also got a hot chocolate and a vanilla bean cheesecake. The hot chocolate was subpar but a decent size. The cheesecake was to die for. Main complaint is the high calories but the food is good.

To be honest, I&#39;ve never been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s not even because of the food, I just never have been interested in this chain restaurant. However, upon receiving a gift card I decided to give them a shot.<br><br>This establishment is incredibly busy on a Friday night, so be ready to wait about a half hour to be seated. We were able to grab a spot at the bar and enjoyed a cocktail before being seated.<br><br>This establishment has indoor and &#34;outdoor&#34; seating which is a great way to maximize the space. Our server was with us quickly and got our order placed as soon as we were ready.<br><br>One thing that was hard for me to ignore was the calorie count on everything. I&#39;m super calorie conscious so this was a real deterrent from even some of the salads on the main menu. Therefore, I was drawn to the options on the Skinnylicious menu. I ordered the Tuscan Chicken and substituted the farro for mashed potatoes (GF) and my meal was really delicious. <br><br>My fiancé and friends also enjoyed ordering some cheesecake for dessert. I was not able to partake since I&#39;m GF but I also noticed there were hardly any options for the GF crowd besides sliced strawberries for like $7 which seemed a bit steep for what you&#39;d get. <br><br>Some of our silverware was not the cleanest, so they may definitely want to inspect it more closely before wrapping it in the napkin.<br><br>Good experience for not coming often.

Walked in and waited 30+ minutes for two slices of cheese cake. Had at least 5 people come in and order after me and got these sooner. I asked multiple times what the delay was and they told me it was &#34;being prepared&#34;. How long does it take to cut two pieces of cheesecake?

Ate here twice last week. I was very impressed by the service from waitress Chelsea P. I came in by myself because I was driving home to New York and stopped for dinner. Chelsea was great and I ordered a lot more because of her service and I really enjoyed my time here. <br><br>Gave four instead of five stars because I think the food is iffy, dinner was good, but the cheesecake was not very good, especially since it&#39;s a cheesecake specific brand. I had the 30th anniversary cheesecake and some coffee and I thought that the restaurant should have better tasting dessert and coffee, since the prices for the desserts are as high as steakhouse dessert prices. I would go again just for the service and order just ice cream for dessert next time.

Came here for brunch and was pleasantly surprised to be immediately seated, especially since we came during prime brunch hours. I ordered the chicken with waffles which I found to be actually really good. I thought the waffles were a good texture, while the chicken on top had a nice crunchiness and airiness to it.  It was a good balance between savory and sweet, which I feel like is hard to achieve in a dish where it&#39;s easy for one item to overpower the other. I left satisfied with my meal and with the service--so no complaints here really :)

If I could give this place zero stars I would. Ordered through door dash just to have a whole meal missing from my order. Spoke to a manger and there response, &#34;want to come get it&#34;, clearly not if I ordered for delivery. Did not help at all, as a manager you should think of customer service and clients first. Plus this hasn&#39;t been the first time something like this happened. This location has been trash for the pass couple of years. Manager here needs better training.

One of my favorite go-to places because the service is always good and there are a ton of things to choose from.   <br><br>I make a point of going off hours so there&#39;s never a waiting/seating issue.  I know it&#39;s a super busy place during certain times.<br><br>The servings always allow for take home!

The 2 stars are not for the food, which is typically pretty good.  The menu is very large, as are the portions.<br><br>The 2 stars are for the consistantly poor service. Slow, uncoordinated and lacking basic skills like:<br><br>-Checking on customers (i.e. not dissapearing into thin air for 25 minutes at a clip)<br>-Not forgetting to bring someone&#39;s drink/food out and promising to get it multiple times (and never actually doing it)<br>-Serving entrees to people next to you first (who showed up 20 minutes after you did)<br>-Never apologizing for multiple issues and slowness<br>-Not having basic skills to open a wine bottle<br><br>Get the picture?<br><br>Apparently all of that is normalcy for these servers, who appear to be partaking in on the job training, during busy dinner hours.  These are observations over more than a dozen visits.  Sure, we have had some good servers, but more times than not, the service flat out sucks.  If the kids didn&#39;t love this place, I would never return.<br><br>Grand Lux Cafe is light years better and apparently owned by the same people.  Go there if you don&#39;t want to spend your entire evening pissed off.

Evey time I order from door dash they are missing my items when it gets delivered!!! Happened three times in a row!!!! Not a good look. Takes forever to get your money back if they do decide to give it back.

This place is located in the shopping mall, easy to find parking, so many varieties. Definitely more than average for sure. Spacious and newly renovated as well. The portion are always huge and it&#39;s not that pricey

I ordered the food online and went to the nearby park. My experience was great overall.  I was worried bc people were saying that they were not satisfied after the pandemic. My server who brought my food to my car, he was really nice. However, he didn&#39;t give an another bag with other foods I&#39;ve ordered. I was heading to the park and he called me that he forgot to give me my other bag.. He was so sorry about that. I could feel it haha. Everyone make mistakes :) It&#39;s okay! I went back to the restaurant and he was apologizing again. Anyway, the food was great and people were nice :) I hope the employers had a great day during this awful pandemic.

This review is all about their curbside delivery. They have had since April to get their act together and they have not. No one cares. That is really the bottom line. They will not take credit card information when your phone in your order which would illuminate some of the long wait in the parking lot. When I say they do not care, we ordered two full dinners and were given to stale pieces of bread...Which of course were placed under the dinner so they were flattened as well as stale.  I am so sorry that we ordered food from there and we never will again. With so many small restaurant struggling appreciate your business and will go the extra mile for you, why bother with cheesecake factory? It seems like all the employees are unhappy and they are taking it out on the customers! Spend your hard earned money elsewhere

There&#39;s always a wait when I come, which I expect and is fine. But it&#39;s extremely frustrating when you&#39;re told it will be a 30 minute wait, and then 45 minutes later you&#39;re told it&#39;s going to be another 30 minutes. And then when I&#39;m having a conversation with the hostess about why the wait was extended so much - the manager runs up and interrupts us without even acknowledging that the hostess was having a conversation with me, the customer. Completely unprofessional, and honestly just plain rude and strange. Do better, Cheesecake of Hackensack.

Ordered here for Mother&#39;s Day.  One of the orders was chicken broccoli pasta for my son who is allergic to peanuts and tree nuts.  Ten minutes in to eating he complained his lips were feeling funny and he picked up something from his plate and asked me what was it.  To my shock it was a cashew nut!  Thankfully he didn&#39;t have a severe reaction (Benadryl still needed) because we don&#39;t think he ingested the nut but he did suffer from cramps the rest of the night due to cross-contamination.  We made sure to check the ingredients before ordering and that dish was not supposed to have any nuts so it only leads me to <br>believe they do not do a good job in avoiding cross-contamination while preparing/cooking.  That&#39;ll be  <br>the last time we are ordering/ eating from there.
This spot never disappoints me. I love the pasta selections. Spaghetti and homemade meatballs or chicken parm.

Cheesecake Factory hmmm . It was alright nothing to be crazy about. I could go to a regular diner and get same food at lower price. Yes cheesecake is nice inside but is the food really worth that price? I had the steak tacos. The tacos were good but that rice was sooo bland. The bread was hard. Maybe I&#39;ll try something else next time

I was picking up my order for 5:18PM and I ended up waiting until 5:50PM. I reached out numerous times and got no response. I was waiting in my car and after about 15 min I went inside and asked for my order and they still weren&#39;t able to provide me with it. Nothing was done to compensate for the time I wasted sitting in the car other than &#34;sorry&#34;. When I finally got my order I noticed that the size proportions have changed from dinner size to lunch size. I&#39;ve been eating with Cheesecake for a while so I&#39;ve noticed the size of the container has changed quite a bit, a large square to the lunch size rectangle. I was not given any napkins or utensils, and the food was cold. I am extremely displeased with the service I received and the product that was given. There needs to be some sort of compensation or rectification for this poor service. Cheesecake factory has definitely lowered their standards and frankly, their sizes.

Stopped in early this past Friday evening for drinks and apps. The bartenders were great and super efficient and friendly.  The drinks were very good. We ordered the peach Bellini and a pineapple ginger martini, which were both delicious. Unfortunately there was a strange object in the sauce that came with the calamari. When we asked the bartender he said he had no idea what it was and shortly thereafter a manager appeared. He apologized, said it was a French fry that &#34;fell in the sauce&#34; and said he&#39;d &#34;take care of it&#34;  by sending a replacement order out.  He then disappeared for such a long time (during which no order ever came out) that we just decided to leave. Paid the full bill for something we could not finish eating and left. Not a good experience and the manager truly dropped the ball. What a change from my previous  experience here.

Just received my order via DoorDash, I am fuming. The food is disgusting. Ordered Nachos with Spicy Chicken minus the chicken, forgotten. I don&#39;t remember requesting for hardened and congealed cheese with my nachos. The Crispy chicken sandwich with french fries came soggy and cold, but still tasty (thank god). The french fries tasted like cold, day old McDonald&#39;s fries-stale and sandy. Yuck! The best of the worst was the Chicken Costolotta. Chicken salty and dried like a shoe sole and &#34;creamy&#34; mashed potatoes were like a gluey hockey puck. I really do love Cheesecake Factory, not because of their culinary expertise, because of nostalgia and childhood memories. They are a comfort food. But damn they really screwed me over today, like they purposely gave me yesterday&#39;s food, reheated in a microwave, and said it&#39;s good to go. This food was so bad, it felt like a personal insult. Please step up your to-go delivery game Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s horrendous.
Extremely rude staff. Their poor attitude (specifically from the staff at the cheesecake stand section) is demeaning and disrespectful.

They just redesigned and relocated this location to the opposite side of the Riverside Square Mall, and they did a great job thus far. The food is the same and consistent. The new venue is layer out completely different and works much better. Congrats.

Perfect for date night! I came here on a early Saturday night and there was not a wait. We asked to sit outside and it was very cozy where we sat. <br><br>There menu was very extensive and overwhelmed me with all of their food options. But that&#39;s a good thing because they have something for everyone. Everything from the food and service was excellent. It is pricey but this place is great if you want to celebrate something. <br><br>Recommendations: steak tacos and Reese&#39;s cheesecake!

Before the damn virus, when you dined in at this Cheesecake the atmosphere and the service was usually very good and even if the food wasn&#39;t great the ambience made up for it.<br>Now covid requires take out or delivery as the viable safe option and you would assume they would try to instill some level of quality and preparation for the food to travel.  NOT!<br>The food are carelessly packed in containers not suited for the specific food I.e flat bread pizzas placed in sealed plastic containers half the size therefore folded over to make it fit, kids cup not made at least dust proof i.e the kids meal that was ordered with milk comes with the opening for the straw completely open and dust floating on top and orders not made as requested i.e the jambalaya ordered with BROWN RICE comes with a mountain of WHITE rice plopped in the middle and basically sponging up ALL the liquid in the jambalaya and turning it to wet fried rice.<br>How about packing the food in a bag that completely covers the content for SAFETY?!?!?!?<br>It comes in that grossly inadequate cheesecake bag wide open and so loosely packed that our soup is laying  sideways leaking most of its content all over the bottom making the generous complementary bread into some gross bread pudding.  Thank you for that BREAD!<br>Mind you, this is not the only time I&#39;ve encountered a delivery nightmare from this specific Cheesecake  factory but this past delivery will be the last.<br>Don&#39;t believe me...?  Give delivery a try...<br><br>Cheesecake... you just made this damn pandemic that much worse!

Came here for a late dinner. And surprisingly it was a short 15 minute wait, which for this place is fairly good. We were seated and ordered the pork belly sliders for an appetizer. They were bomb!!! The slider is in a Hawaiian style bun with sweet Cole slaw sitting atop of the pork belly. The pork belly was perfectly cooked and very tender. Definitely a great new addition to their menu. I had ordered the crusted chicken romano. The food was served hot. The chicken was breaded and crisp and served with a good helping of pasta in a red sauce. It was delicious. Of course had to order cheesecake and got the seasonal pumpkin pecan cheesecake. It was okay. It had a pastry type crust but would have preferred a graham crust. Overall it was a good visit. Service was okay, same as to what to expect for a busy chain restaurant. Also they ran out of brown bread that night....

I met a friend at this Cheesecake Factory location for brunch on a Saturday morning. The weather was nice so we grabbed a table outdoors- while this is a mall restaurant and you&#39;re facing the parking lot- it had a pretty nice atmosphere.<br><br>The staff was friendly and attentive- sitting near the door to inside gave us a nice little breeze as well. The menu at CF is so large and it&#39;s usually hard to choose. Brunch was still available so my friend went with an omelet while I had the Vegan Cobb Salad. It was great! So many fresh toppings and it was HUGE! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves a good salad. <br><br>Oh, and the Mimosa&#39;s weren&#39;t half bad either!

So disappointing because I love Cheesecake Factory! The 1 star is really due to the waiter. He was THE ONLY good part of our experience. They messed up our table when seating us and 3 out of the 5 meals came out cold. 1 of them didnt even make it out! Really ridiculous... and it wasnt even busy!

I would give this place 3.5 stars.  There&#39;s not many good options at malls but Cheesecake Factory is usually a safe choice since there&#39;s such a big menu.  Their menu is so big that it&#39;s hard to choose.  I usually order the Louisiana Pasta (crispy chicken with Cajun sauce over bowtie pasta) but decided to try the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta (honey glazed chicken over penne pasta).  My mom got the steak tacos.  The lunch portion is good since I find the regular portion very large here.  The complimentary bread is the best, especially the pumpernickel bread.  The bread is warm and fresh.  The Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta was okay, still think the Louisiana Pasta is better.  The steak tacos were delicious.  Service is a hit or miss here, I understand it&#39;s very busy at lunch time.  However, service can be rather slow.  Also, the host always says 5 minute wait to everyone for a table.  You end up waiting more like 15-20 minutes.  In the end, I still come here since there&#39;s more food choices and my mom really likes the bread.

Food is always good here.  Came here on a Monday afternoon &amp; the place was pretty empty - compared to most days. We ordered drinks, apps, kids meals &amp; entrees. We asked that the apps &amp; kids meals all come out at the same time. Somehow we received apps &amp; entrees at the same time.. no biggie, but it would have been nice to have a starter.

Love this place. <br><br>Favorite Appetizer: Crab and Artichoke dip. Huge appetizer. Share with someone <br><br>Favorite Entree: Chicken Madeira. This is their most popular and for good reason <br><br>Favorite Dessert: can&#39;t pick. Love most of their cheesecakes. Maybe the Nutella one or the celebration one?

Horrible experience.  Management is very arrogant and dishonest. Me my wife and my son went there for dinner and while we waited for table at the bar we ordered food that arrived at same time when my table was ready so I paid the tab and moved to table. We waited 20 mins at table and when food did not arrive i asked to speak to floor manager who was very rude and arrogant i demanded to speak to GM to give me my money back so that we could leave. <br>They refused to give me my money back so and then when I threatened to call Corporate the floor manager threatened to call the police on me my wife and my 5 year old son. <br>These people feel that you need them and they dont owe you any service or hospitality. And if you demand service they will insult and threaten you and your family.

Came in for a business lunch with four people.  The waiter was really nice but our food took forever to come out.  I know lunch is busy but I wasn&#39;t expecting to be out of my nearby office for over two hours.  The dishes we had didn&#39;t seem that complicated to me.  Two of us had salads and the other two had tacos.  My salad was the almond crusted salmon salad.  I would definitely recommend it however the piece of salmon was really small (the picture doesn&#39;t do it justice). I&#39;d come back but be mindful of how long it takes.
We love the Cheesecake Factory because their portion sizes are HUGE but also because their cheesecake is amazing!!!! Very smooth and nicely done.

Barely making 4 stars, but nevertheless, I find myself coming here from time to time with family and friends. Though their food can be a hit or a miss, or many times, a long shot from satisfactory, there are a few dishes from here that I crave once in a while: their Santa Fe Salad, Baja Chicken Nachos, and even sometimes their Louisiana Chicken Pasta.<br><br>Pictured:<br>- Pork Belly Sliders ($11.95): enjoyable; the pork, topped with coleslaw and fried pickles, was tasty, but each had its special flavor on its own. Combined, it was even better.<br><br>- Eggroll Sampler ($12.95): surprisingly good! It was nice having the four different kinds of egg rolls to try in one plate, each with a special sauce of its own. All of them were good, but I appreciated being able to enjoy a change in flavor after every few bites. (My sister and my personal favorite was the Avocado Eggroll.) Filled me up quickly!<br><br>- Smokehouse BBQ Burger ($14.50): disappointing and worse than I remember it to be. Buns and parts of the (medium) patty were burnt, the bun was rock-hard for the most part, and those factors got in the way from being able to enjoy the burger. I&#39;m usually a sucker for burgers, but this burger got my mouth all dried up.<br><br>- Louisiana Chicken Pasta ($17.95): decent; this is the first meal I&#39;ve ever tried at Cheesecake Factory, and it&#39;s still one of my and many people&#39;s favorites. Spices and flavorings of the pasta are strong, but much needed with and compliments well with the chicken.<br>------------------------------------<br>Unpictured are a couple of my favorites listed above, and a few other dishes, but I will definitely be back for more next time.

Seriously don&#39;t know how you can ever go bad with Cheesecake Factory. We are regulars and everything is great and fresh. I think we&#39;ve tried everything on their menu and there&#39;s not one thing we don&#39;t like and yes we go to Capital Grill and really fancy restaurants but Cheesecake is still our go to. We love the chicken Belagio, chicken Luisiana pasta, the stuffed mushrooms, buffalo blasts.. I mean the list goes on and on.

Food is good, it&#39;s the service that seems to be getting worst here. Ordered two simple things, spinach dip &amp; pizza. The pizza took over 45 minutes to come out &amp; when I asked the waitress she said &#34;the kitchen is slow &amp; I realize it&#39;s been more than 30 minutes but my manager apologizes as well.&#34; Which she probably just forgot to put the order in &amp; it&#39;s fine but then didn&#39;t own up to her mistake because after the food came out she sent another waiter to ask us if everything was ok. I assume she was worried we&#39;d complain to the manager, even though at one point there were several waitresses standing around &#34;hiding out&#34; for a good ten minutes just socializing until they decided to go back to work. I probably won&#39;t be coming back to this location.

Such a beautiful restaurant but the service and food is so mediocre.  My boyfriend and I have been twice within the past year and each time I have had undercooked steaks and watered down drinks. My desserts are always fabulous but not worth the trip for me.

Awesome bronzino from the skinny menu.  Chicken lettuce wraps also delicious as were the skinny LIT&#39;s.  Service is robotic and the place is chaotic on very busy weekend dinner times.  Make sure you reserve on Yelp!

The worst service ever. The manager is beyond rude &amp; me and my girlfriend waited an hour for takeout. Ridiculous! They were sooo unorganized &amp; then when I spoke with the manager about waiting long for my order he didn&#39;t even apologize for the inconvenience. He was rude &amp; obnoxious. Waste of time &amp; money. However, when I asked for my refund, ironically my food was ready. The manager had the nerve to ask me if I still wanted the food, I told him no because I&#39;m sure it was cold &amp; nasty. Very disappointed and you guys lost two valuable customers.

We had a really good experience here -- even though not all of my Cheesecake experiences have been amazing. The hummus here was fantastic. They actually make it here and make olive oil infused chips with it. Very tasty! We had cheesecake at the end of our meal that was very good as well. I would only say that the service wasn&#39;t the best, but it was a decent meal.
Strawberry cheesecake was the only thing I ordered! I needed my fix. Perfect slice of heaven
Went there for brunch on Saturday. It was fine However, I happened to notice that my favorite dinner appetizer pork belly sliders was no longer on the menu.<br><br>Bring it back.
Great lunch sandwich ..enough to share for two. The zucchini appetizer looks great!  The Cappuccino was creamy and amazing!

Went back here on Tuesday, with a bunch of friends and guess what happened? THEY FORGOT MY MEAL! How much worst can this establishment can get? I mean seriously, so disappointed in this company, I felt I needed to advise my fellow yelpers to completely avoid this location. My mistake for giving them another change. <br><br>Last but not least, the MANAGER wasn&#39;t even going to comp my meal. TRY AGAIN BUDDY.

This is one of our go to places. By&#34; go to &#34; I mean don&#39;t feel like doing it at home. They have a huge choice of meals. Actually I have never had a bad experience here. Never had slow service. Some people appear to make these complaints looking for something free. Food quality is very good, presentation good ,served the way you ask. Plenty of parking. &#34;An issue when in N.J.&#34; Go for it.

Always a wait to get in here i feel which is annoying. They do their best to expedite the large crowds though and I&#39;ve never waited more than 20 minutes typically. <br><br>They have a new location! They are just around the corner from the old spot (same mall) just a couple hundred feet away. The inside looks very nice and clean, an update is wonderful since this is a major location. We got sat at these new outdoor type seats that are literally located in the mall, almost like a little outdoor area from the restaurant that is roped off inside the mall, it was great actually. Granted it was a Sunday so the mall was dead quiet which was nice, but they are lay back seats and i feel like a king eating like that. <br><br>Food was great, service was good. No complaints! just your typical Cheesecake Factory with an insanely large menu.

The Cheesecake Factory use too be one of my favorite places to eat. This location went downhill the moment they renovated and made it smaller. The bread portions are smaller as well. For such an extensive meal, a lot of their food is consistently not good. From their burgers to the fettuccine Alfredo which lacks seasoning to the $30 filet mignon which they can never seem to get right for such a hefty price. And don&#39;t get me started on the horrible door dash service. If they gave me a dollar for every time they messed up my order (burnt food, missing items like my cheesecake and drink) I would be a millionaire.<br><br>However, I gave them three stars instead of one for a few reasons. Despite their bread being smaller, it is delicious. Despite the lack of favor or overall quality of food, their portions are excellent for the price. I simply LOVE their blue cheese dressing (they sell it in a jar too) and the cheeseburger rolls are the best thing I&#39;ve had from there food wise hands down. Their chicken pot pie and kids menu are added bonuses.<br><br>If you want to be blew away try any of their smoothies/milkshakes and of course their cheesecake. I was disappointed when they took my favorite cheesecake off the menu (Apple Dutch Cinnamon) but I quickly found another favorites (Cinnamon bun and red velvet and they have a new pineapple upside down one that looks good).<br><br>Even with those small positives, I would still choose their sister company the Grand Lux Cafe in Paramus, NJ over them any day.
Had a good experience here. Seating was quick. Our server was super friendly and attentive. Drinks were on point and food was delicious. Will return and would recommend.

Waited 40 minutes for our food on a slow Sunday. I ordered an ahi tuna salad ($19) and it came out with about 6 tiny slivers of tuna beside a sad, semi-wilted salad. Why did it take so long to bring this out? Were the staff debating, &#34;Hm...how much do we want him to starve today? Let&#39;s see what is the least amount of tuna we can place on this plate without guaranteeing a scene? 6 slivers should do the trick!&#34; <br><br>Waitress was incredibly pleasant while serving me this meal meant for a baby bird so I guess that counts for something.

My niece wanted to celebrate her birthday at the cheesesteak factory. I haven&#39;t had the best experiences here but we went with it anyways. <br><br>Waited 35mins for a table for 6ppl for outside area since we had a small dog as well. Were told it would be about 30mins. When the alarm went off we proceeded inside. We were then about to be taken to an inside table. When we spoke to the front desk hostesses we&#39;re then told they can&#39;t accommodate us outside because there were no open tablesoutside. Then she blames the hostess who had spoken to us and given us the alarm saying he was knew and didn&#39;t know any better.<br><br>They did not try and accomodate us at all. I am absolutely fed up with this location. Officially done.

Went to Cheesecake Factory in Hackensack NJ ,<br>Very disappointed that the 1/2 chicken is no longer a half chicken and they kept the same Pricing for what they served instead and we had to Waite 20 minutes to get our meals

I use to come to Cheesecake Factory so much that my iPhone would tell me how far I was. Now I come maybe once or twice every 2-3months. <br><br>The service today was great even though it was a typical busy Friday night. To start we ordered our drinks, I always have the ultimate margarita. With 2 of those you will feel nice. I wish it was a bit stronger though but that&#39;s me personally. I love tequila. My boyfriend got a Long Island Ice Tea, I didn&#39;t try it but it looked good. <br><br>We shared wings, hot sauce on the side and extra crispy. They were good, the blue cheese was chunky which was a plus. If it ain&#39;t chunky it&#39;s not proper blue cheese. <br><br>Now the entrees! I ALWAYS get the steak tacos! No matter what I always get them. Today I tried something different. <br><br>!Cajun jambalaya pasta! <br>It was delicious buttttt if they would&#39;ve added sausage to the dish, lorddddd that would&#39;ve been out of this world! I asked to see if they can add some and my waitress said no they only do chorizo for breakfast . <br><br>Don&#39;t get me wrong it was delicious but it was missing that fatty spicy chorizo to make it an official jambalaya. <br><br>Of course we can never leave without taking 2 slices of the original cheesecake!

Came in on a late friday night and we still need to wait. Busy busy place. Its all worth it! Food here never disappoints me. It always tastes very good. Staff are always friendly and attentive.<br><br>What stands out tonight is the Seared Tuna Ahi served on rice. I love how they incorparate this dish. Sauce has a little kick but was done just right. Other dish we ordered are chicken alfredo pasta, seafood jambalaya pasta and chicken bellagio on basil pasta topped with prosciutto and arugula salad. They all came out delicious.<br><br>Of course, we had to have cheesecake. We ordered Red Velvet and Salted caramel which tastes really good but with all the food we had, we shared a slice of each which is just right.

As usual, this very popular chain restaurant is crowded, a testament to its convenient location and brand appeal.  Tonight (national cheesecake day out of all Mondays), we opted to sit at the bar area rather than wait.  The food was understandably slow due to the half off cheesecake specials but the waiter was very friendly and responsive.  My Louisiana chicken pasta was predictably delicious, and the cheesecake for dessert was the cherry on top, no pun intended.  I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;d say this place separates itself from other CF locations, but a solid four stars nonetheless.

Have I been to Cheesecake Factory before? Plenty of times! This time was the best experience I&#39;ve had yet-my server (Kelly R) was amazing. She engaged with my daughter consistently and was absolutely patient. Appetizer -tuna tartare. Entree-almond crusted salmon salad. My favorite meal thus far!! Of course I&#39;ll return-can&#39;t wait!!!

Portions are big so bring your appetite, been here also during happy hours and service is fast and food is always great. Just give some extra patience on Friday eve or weekends because it tends to get crowded unless you&#39;re coming in with just party of less than 4.

More than impeccably delicious food my family and I eat hear for the ambiance. Our usual go to is the calamari, Thai lettuce wraps, fettuccini Alfredo and bistro shrimp pasta.<br><br>The honey oat bread is the best when it comes out fresh! Unfortunately, that is not always the case.<br><br>The service is somewhat slow. We waited for 10 minutes before getting any water or utensils. We had to ask if we can order rather than the waiter/waitress asking in a timely manner.<br><br>Overall, I had a good dining experience, but definitely not on par to the price I&#39;m paying.

10 years ago, this restaurant was really good with really good service. But now, I am a bit disappointed for the service that we received. It all started when I ordered a burger and asked for medium, but received well-done. This was frustrating, because I don&#39;t care for well-done at all. My dad also ordered a Chicken Marsala and it was presented to us in an improper way. I don&#39;t think it tasted that great either, and when I looked at the menu, IT WAS 1,800 CALORIES. Are you kidding. My dad is very old and cannot endure that many calories, it&#39;s just not right for him. But, since I have to pay for it, he insisted to eat it. This was a disappointing experience for me, and I hope that you guys can improve your service the next time.

The service was ok, when we received our appetizer, 5 minutes later we received our main course, felt rushed.<br>Almond crusted salmon salad wasn&#39;t very good, fish was burnt.<br>Wife&#39;s meatloaf was not the same as before.<br>Not sure we are going back.<br>Before, we were big fans OF CCF

I stopped in here to dine at the beginning of December with my mother and 2 children ( 2 1/2 and 7 months old) after taking photos with Santa in the mall. The hostess was horrendous and the manager did NOTHING to compensate us. <br><br>First when we entered the hostess told me to stand with my double stroller behind the hostess desk. Which honestly I was just going to ignore. Even though I felt she was trying to hide my double stroller or something. Instead I sat down anyway. To make more room I decided to take one of the detachable seats off the stroller and place it in the car. It took all of 45 seconds, my car was right outside. When I got back my mom said someone came to sit us. I went to hostess desk to inquire. Omg she was the biggest b*#tch. Almost laughing that we were going to be put on the list again. Even after the person who came to sit us came back saying it was okay. At this point we are arguing and I asked to speak to the manager. The girl was pointing and rolling her eyes at me it was completely ridiculous. The manager finally comes and they sit us in the &#39;bar&#39; section. (Because people sitting in the bar really want to be entertained by my two young children.). The manager apologized but did NOTHING to rectify the situation. <br><br>Our waitress was however very nice. My children go to restaurants all the time and are always well behaved. This was my first time dining at this Cheesecake Factory since they moved locations in the mall. I will not be back. Which is sad because I frequented this restaurant when pregnant with my son.

Good, ol&#39; reliable Cheesecake Factory.  The food is good, the portions are big, you always know what you&#39;re getting.  <br><br>If you&#39;re looking for stability in an unstable world, have a meal at The Cheesecake Factory.  You&#39;re going to feel safe, secure and full.<br><br>I ate here recently after not having eaten here probably since my last review of this place in 2008.  It was great.  The service was nice, the bread still tasted the same, the menu was still mostly the same.  And now that I have a job, the prices don&#39;t seem that bad.  Maybe some would see those things as cons but hey, I liked it.  Honestly.<br><br>The only thing I didn&#39;t like is when they went to seat us the table was still dirty and they bum rush cleaned it while we awkwardly stood and waited.  Why tell us the table is ready if it isn&#39;t?  Ah, well.  Water under the bridge my Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ll see you soon.

I haven&#39;t been to Cheesecake factory for a while and I was so excited about it until this happened. <br><br>I ordered mojito and I found not only dirt on mint leaves but also an ALIVE WORM.. First of all, you guys clearly did not wash leaves at all and second of all.. alive worm!!! come on.. so disgusting........ totally ruined my appetite. not coming back here :(

My boyfriend and I came to Cheesecake Factory on a Tuesday night to let loose for a little bit from school and work. Our server Daniela C was extremely patient with us taking our time to order drinks since we don&#39;t get out much lately, brought lots of extra bread, and was sharp/quick with service while being very friendly!  On top of he food being delicious and served in huge portions, she as a server made our experience memorable. Ask for her section if you come out to eat here!

Not sure why I don&#39;t come here more often! This location is wonderful. The food is great! The cheesecakes are incredible! So many flavors and types to choose from. The service is as fast as it can be considering this place is often very busy. I recommend the chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake

I usually hate chain restaurants but I wanted to post what a good experience I had here. <br><br>My waiter was a pleasure , very friendly and gave prompt service and great suggestions.<br><br>I had an Asian pear martini which was delish. Not overly sweet and not too boozy. I really wanted a second one but I was driving.<br><br>My veggie burger was outstanding. I love the combo of grains and veggies and it was enough for two meals for me! It is something I will certainly be back for!<br><br>My only complaint is a common one, it is super busy and loud but there is nothing you can do about that ! It&#39;s good for a bite while shopping in the mall

I only come here to eat at the bar area bc the rest of the staff in the restaurant area are slow and inattentive making for a long wait for any order. The people at the to go/takeout register are the least pleasant. Bartender josh is great and very attentive and fast with your order. When I come I always get the avocado spring rolls and recommend them to everyone.

This is my second time ordering curbside... first time was on Easter, I placed my order ahead of time, got there 10 minutes before pickup time and food not out until an hour after pick up time.  I was really patient as I know this situation is new to everyone and figured the staff was still trying to figure things out.  Ordered a second time today, again curbside (ordered ahead) , this time it took an hour and 15 minutes from pick up time to get food.  Everything was extremely disorganized, people seemed confused .  I would&#39;ve thought by now they&#39;d have their shit together.  Apparently not.  Unfortunately they have lost my business during this time, possibly for good.
I usually love coming here.. However, today everything went wrong.  The waitress only came three times and all the food was so salty.  It was to the point we couldn&#39;t eat the food at all.

Not long ago I saw a photo taken by Yelper Tina C. of Plainview, NY of an Oreo Cheese Cake. I was craving for a taste and I looked up the Cheesecake Factory and realize that they are a franchised and their are at half a dozen near me within driving distance and one in a place I used to live, Hackensack NJ.<br><br>The web site menu had more than a dozen cheese cakes and had take out too, which made it even more convenient for me since now I don&#39;t need to do a solo sit down just for dessert.<br><br>The decor of the Hackensack restaurant is nice and it is big with two dinning sections and one with a full bar. They have a parking lot and they are part of the up-sale River Side Mall. So it was easy to do some shopping and have a bite to eat on my visits<br><br>I must have gone to the Cheesecake Factory 8 times and half of that I stayed to eat there. Always for dessert, and mostly for cheese cake, the other times I had Strawberry Shortcake, Black Out, and Carrot cake.<br><br>So for the cheese cakes I had Oreo, Strawberry, Godiva Chocolate, Red Velvet, Snickers Chocolate, Salted Carmel, Lemon Mousse Meringue, and White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle. And this is only a third of what is available.<br><br>They all taste good and better than you would think from a franchised restaurant, but of course some of the cheese cakes tasted better than the others. They are light cheese cakes and they don&#39;t give you oversize slices, with lots of cream and pliantly of strawberries for the strawberries cakes including a 6 inch round mini.<br><br>My top three are:<br><br>1) Strawberry Cheese cake and the Shortcake.<br>2) Salted Carmel<br>3) Raspberry Truffle<br><br>The atmosphere and staff were friendly but real busy so be a little patent they will get to your needs ASP..  One note is the cake slices are huge like 10 inches high so plan on shearing with someone and make it even more fun. Plus you can ask for more strawberries and whip cream with your dessert.

My family came here on a Sunday night for my parent&#39;s anniversary. Since we all have different food preferences, Cheesecake Factory is always a great place for us since they have a very extensive menu.<br><br>I ordered the turkey burger and was in love. The garlic aioli was such a perfect pair for the burger. My sister ordered her go to item, the Louisiana chicken pasta. The food has always been consistent through my numerous visits.<br><br>For dessert, we ordered the Oreo and the coffee cheesecakes. Both were delicious and very rich, so they&#39;re both best paired with coffee. I was surprised that the chocolate cake layer on the coffee cheesecake was very dense, almost brownie-like. Either way, it was a perfect way to end our meal.<br><br>The service seemed subpar - the waiter took 15 minutes before he was able to even greet us, but he apologized saying there was an issue with the credit card machine. Overall, great place for dinner, especially for large groups.

Very nice decor. Good, attentive service. Great place for a late lunch. Everything was yummy! The cheesecake is out of this world and so many flavors! I love that they have a to go cheesecake area to get on the way out. Too full to eat it after dinner.

$$&amp; price. Always delicious food and huge amount of everything! I did today CRISPY CHICKEN COSTOLETA: 3 breaded chicken breasts served with smashed potato and sparragus which was awesome; Malbec wine and Lemoncello Cream Tart for dessert...I ate like a beautiful pig but it worth it. It was my free day to eat!!!  jajaja.  recomended

Their food is always on point. Been there with huge groups or small group many times but the food remains consistently good. Of course, there are rockstars in their menu. I like their appetizers more than the entree esp  calamari, lettuce wraps, etc.<br>My biggest issue is wait times. But it has improved since they moved to their new location

The food is pretty good at this Cheesecake Factory and I like the setup of the restaurant. It&#39;s nicely dimmed in there and I love the location since inside a shopping mall. However, we were there on Valentine&#39;s Day and felt like we were being rushed out. Overall, I would come here again if I ever get a craving for some cheesecake.

My last few visits have not been so swell, but today was an exception. Everything was going fantastic till the entrees (which needed an inordinate amount of time to prepare- NOT WORTH THE WAIT) came into the picture. Nevertheless, let&#39;s discuss the good before the bad. The Pina Coladas were great! The starters (both new to my taste buds) were exceptional. <br>I wish we had gotten up and left prior to the following events. The chicken parm-pizza style pasta was a disaster (Ah! What a mess). The texture is hard to put into words; it was grainy and chewy. Besides, I ate so much bread waiting for the arrival of my entree I could not fit only but a few bites.

Had an excellent take-out experience today.  The food was ready as soon as I arrived, packed perfectly, and tasting just as good as dine-in.  The pick-up procedure was orderly and safe.  And how fun to use a coupon code for a free slice of cake!  This was a real spirit lifter.
Overpriced frozen food and terrible customer service.

Typical Cheesecake Factory but newer.  Always crowded and NO WIFi??  Really??  Make the kids wait 40 mins for a meal how about some internet since there are not seats most of the time <br><br>Update:  with the movie theatre it&#39;s more crowded than ever...  still no WiFi

Huge restaurant located inside a local shopping mall. This spot gets busy for brunch and here&#39;s the reason why-- AMAZING DESSERTS! I got the almond toasted avocado and kale salad. The reason why I enjoy coming here is because their menu is extensive. You want pasta? Check. You&#39;re craving pizza? You got it. Something small to bite on? You betcha. Mexican? Oh yeah! And the best part of it all is their LONG list of different flavor cheesecakes. I got the Oreo cheesecake and I&#39;m thinking of going back just for that  I recommend it to everyone!

We love Cheesecake Factory. We have never really been disappointed in what we ordered except once. I ordered a medium rare steak salad and it came out well done. The manager came over and switched my steak salad to a delicious steak and when the bill came there was no charge. I told him that we fully expected to pay and he said not at all. THAT IS CUSTOMER SERVICE AT IT&#39;S BEST

Selection is overwhelming!  Food was decent, but I had one gripe....<br>drink prices were not listed on the menu.  Calorie counts, all kinds of other info and dishes listed had prices, but not for drinks.  Which puts the customer into the awkward position of having to inquire about the price before ordering -- which is unacceptable.  We had a margarita (not great, and small) for $10.25!  That&#39;s the price I would pay in a NY restaurant, not a chain in NJ.
Best food ever! Love ordering  the Tex Mex Egg rolls <br>their a little spicy but worth getting! The shepherd&#39;s pie great too full of flavor.

Amazing food, nice atmosphere. Super busy but had to wait a while for drinks and refills. Dirty appetizer plates were at the table when they brought our main dish so we had to straighten everything up quickly and hold some of them until someone else came.  One of our appetizers didn&#39;t come until the main meal, I said it&#39;s a bit late now and she said I know no one told  me they were ready and dropped them on the table anyways, unbothered and not a little sorry. The food and restaurant  is really nice but service was pretty rough.
Probably could deal with less than 1300 calorie lunch/brunch, but the chicken and waffles were fantastic!  Service was a little lacking though on this visit.

We went back to the Cheesecake Factory at the Riverside Square Hackensack location and what a difference! I was skeptical at first because I ordered a drink with a twist of lime and the bartender put lemon in it but that was the worst thing that happened. We had the crab and artichoke appetizer and the chicken potstickers for appetizer and both came out great. We both had the hibachi steak dinner and both were delicious. Would highly recommend this location!

This places was super busy. Waiters and waitresses everywhere. Our waiter was okay but really could have made dinner better by remembering our order and at least singing happy birthday like the other members that was working. No biggie though. The food was great and drinks saved the night.

Extremely difficult to place an order to go / pickup you&#39;ll be on hold for 10+ minutes most of the time. On top of waiting for a long period of time once you&#39;re there so your food will be cold. Essentially a Dine in only high end restaurant with great food and a big menu. <br><br>Main issue is this location is to busy too consistently to function, so if you don&#39;t mind waiting this spot may be for you. Better off going to other locations or restaurants as this location is &#39;capped&#39; on business. God bless them.

I was very disappointed on Valentine&#39;s Day when my husband and I ordered our food for delivery. I was very upset by the quality of food. I ordered the Cajun chicken and shrimp jambalaya pasta and my husband ordered the Jamaican black pepper chicken and shrimp. My pasta was very over cooked and the meal had no flavor at all. My husbands meal was bland and subpar. We also ordered the egg roll platter and that was the only relatively good thing we ate. We were both very disappointed. I emailed Cheesecake Factory and have yet to hear back from them.
I love Cheesecake Factory . I think the quality of food and service are so good! The Godiva Cheesecake is also really yummy ~

It&#39;s pretty surprising to see a lower rating than I expected for this restaurant. Been here several times and the food and service is always near top notch. Wait staff is always pretty efficient even when visiting in large groups. Only once did I have a problem with take out I ordered an entree with extra chicken and they didn&#39;t add the extra chicken but they did make sure to charge for it. Luckily I checked before I left and they added the extra chicken although it took 10-15 min to wait for it.

I would love to come eat there every night but my pants are getting a little too tight. You have got enough people who you can feed. I could not even think about working there I would be bringing cheesecake home every night. It&#39;s the best thing I have ever tasted. It&#39;s so hard to pick just one piece of cheesecake it&#39;s not fair but you know that because you are EVIL. Lol. We can&#39;t wait until we walk off a few pounds then we will definitely be back. Whoever makes your cheesecakes them they are absolutely disgusting. LOL.

This is my second time going into a cheesecake factory and due to the time, it was extremely busy but my party of four didn&#39;t have to wait more than thirty minutes to be seated which was my cut-off time.  Anything above that is not worth the wait when you can be seated quicker in another neighboring establishment.  <br><br>As we walked to be seated we all realized the floor was slippery so once our waiter arrived we informed him of our concern.  He informed us that he would let management know of the slippery floor to ensure the safety of their patrons.<br><br>We all quickly scanned the huge menu and decided on our drinks and meals.  My drink of choice was a mojito which was very good. I took a chance trying a pasta dish with vegetables, and was pleasantly surprised to find it was cooked to perfection with an abundant of flavor.  <br><br>Overall our experience was good and the waiter was very accommodating to some of my fellow diners needs. :)

I went to lunch, with a friend whose never to the Cheesecake Factory. I was raving about how good it was. I ordered the crab artichoke dip. The dip was semi hot and bread semi hard, like it was sitting a while. I then got the pasta orders. My shrimp pasta was very oily. Then the chicken Romana my friend got was very dry. I then ordered the strawberry short cake. I did say I was in a rush and how long would it take to prepare. I got it and it was nothing comparable to the one I got last time. Strawberries were soggy and old. The butter cake they were on was hard and cold. I wasn&#39;t pleased with any of my meal. The servers seemed like they had bad attitude and miserable. I used to work at a restaurant years ago, the service was nothing in comparison. I won&#39;t be coming back here,

This place always has a wait on weekends, but the wait times they give are pretty accurate, so you can walk around the mall. Their skinnylicious menu is actually pretty decent too.<br><br>I had the Tuscan Chicken. Not sure how restaurants do it, but they always manage to not overcook chicken breast, which is awesome. It was a pretty generous portion, especially with the vegetables. Cheesecake factory is a good option when everyone wants something different.<br><br>Of course the best thing here is dessert, so go for some cheesecake. I occasionally pick one up to bring to a party or something.

I&#39;ve dined here four times. Our waits have ranged from none to over an hour, so I avoid TCF on the weekends! The staff is very nice.<br><br>Our last two visits weren&#39;t great. The appetizers are good, I loved the cheese bread and guacamole. However, the rice was very hard in my &#34;Factory Burritos Grande&#34;. The burritos were great besides this, just a bit hard to chew.<br><br>So far, I&#39;ve only had the banana cream cheesecake. It was great at the restaurant! But when I ordered a slice to-go, it was a bit plain, with no banana slices or Bavarian cream.
Service was horrible. Price was terrible. This waitress didn&#39;t even want to serve me as I was calling for her. Very bad experience.

Last Saturday I had lunch with a friend at Cheesecake Factory. I had grilled chicken over salad. Shortly after I became violently sick to my stomach. I contacted the manager and reached out to corporate. Neither responded to me. Now I feel that my obligation to let everyone know how bad the food is. Rethink your dining experience, don&#39;t give them your business

We were told to try The Cheesecake Factory repeatedly, so on our first trip to the US of A  we did . Naturally we just had to witness the good feedbacks ourselves. Came with so high an expectation and belly starving we were not so happy on the long wait (30minutes). However what frustrations we had on the long wait the food made up for as they were  gastronomically wow! I&#39;ve to be honest North American food doesn&#39;t always get the same reaction from me so its quite something . We had ordered individual dishes to share as we wanted to sample different fares. Everything was an instant favourite. The Seared Tuna Ahi was a fusion of Eastern Sashimi and Western Vinegrette  which actually came out nice and light on the palate . Surprisingly this dish came with steamed rice to balance the acidity (clever) . On another plate  the Jambalaya pasta was uniquely different from the Ahi Tuna bringing a wonderful international variety to the menu . I love how the Southern heat compliments the dish&#39;s smoky flavor brought on by the sausage.<br>The portions was just a little over  enough. <br>A nice good place to spend dinner with family . I can&#39;t wait to come back and explore the rest of their menu .
A bit too expensive and the line to wait can be crazy but otherwise the place is great. <br>Artichoke app - 5.0<br>Jamaican shrimp meal - 5.0 (insanely good!)<br>Jambalaya- 5.0<br>Service - 4.25

I&#39;m on vacation and I ordered a chicken, mango and avocado salad and it was missing the AVOCADO!!!! I payed almost 16 dollars for this salad which probably 3 dollars were worth of avocado since it&#39;s so expensive at the moment and for them to miss the main ingredient is just unnaceptable.... they need to pay more attention, if they mess up on a simple salad I can&#39;t imagine what they&#39;ll do on a main dish. Worst place ever!!!

After years of having friends recommend the place and them always ranking in the &#39;Top 10&#39; for worst dishes (calories, fat content) we decided to check them out.   <br><br>A big busy bustling place with a big diner-style menu and they show a page worth of pizzas so by default they were added into &#39;The Pizza Project 2015&#39;.<br><br>Like all other chains - it&#39;s hard to resist being able to feed the entire family and the adults get their slosh on all for under $70 (and that&#39;s with some serious doggie-bags to bring home).  Similar to Donald Trump&#39;s current lead with the GOP&#39;s - you can&#39;t help but admire that the Cheesecake Factory is so brazen and in-your-face and just plows ahead with ridiculous portions and could care less about obesity and heart disease.<br><br>The pizza lunch special - the salad was completely okay for a few mouthfuls of lettuce and a sliver of tomato.<br><br>Their Portofino Pizza - surprisingly good crust, solid amount of chicken and peppers.  Only real gripe was the thin and watery pesto that was leaking underneath to make the pie soggy.<br><br>After my next yearly check-up I don&#39;t think my doctor will allow me to go back there but otherwise it was a completely decent pitstop when you&#39;re at the mall shopping for back-to-school stuff.

The menu is huge so they have a dish for everyone. I love their weekday happy hour in the bar area. My fav appetizers are avacado eggrolls,guacamole,korean cauliflower. Their veggie burger is amazing.

The food wasn&#39;t bad but for the amount I had for the amount I paid for, it was too expensive. Ended up paying about 23.00 bucks for steak that added up to 3oz and a chicken breast that was probably 3oz as well. Food was actually good and that&#39;s why I have them 3 stars but the size of the portions could be a little bigger(chicken Madeira and steak Diane)

My third-ever yelp review. That&#39;s how compelled I was to memorialize this horrific experience. <br><br>I waited until 5:42 for a pre-paid online order that should have been ready at 5pm. Myself a several other guests with pickup orders were left to wait aimlessly without explanation or apology. The employees working the bakery/pickup desk were ill-prepared and poorly trained to handle the volume (that this restaurant ALWAYS HAS). <br><br>Only after I sought out the manager on duty, Dennis, were any of us able to get the food we&#39;d waited for. My order was incomplete, and they sent me out the door without everything I&#39;d ordered. This was after Dennis refused to refund my gratuity, claiming it was a function of the online ordering system. And still not so much as an apology. In fact, it was as if the impatient guests at the pickup counter were an imposition on him. Egregious. All of these failures fall squarely on him and the poorly trained team. <br><br>The sad thing is I still like the food. But this is Northern New Jersey, this is big leagues. The team needs to get with it. And the company needs to figure it out, fast.
Another chain restaurant. Avarage food, crowed, they do not take reservations, what makes even crowded.

Miss the old Cheesecake Factory! It was just ok, when we went it was a ridiculous wait time - had to wait an extra half hour on top of the hour we already waited. Waiter was nice but this review is based on the food. I haven&#39;t been in a while and it was pretty disappointing. Portions are so much smaller and more money lol! I ordered the Grande burrito which use to be my favorite and it was sooooo skimpy. There was basically 5 pieces of chicken in the middle and hardly any cheese on top. And soooo much rice. My sister ordered the New Coleslaw chicken sandwich and there was barely a teaspoon of coleslaw and didn&#39;t really have any flavor. Just save your money and eat somewhere else. Not worth it :(

This is one place we&#39;ve pass by everyday looking at it thinking when we should be exploring this option.. <br>they gave us a warm welcome and gave us a preferred seating even though it was really busy.<br>We&#39;ve orders buffalo chicken blast and chipotle chicken pasta. They gave us the bread basket with salted melted cheese in the beginning. The brown was amazing...<br>Coming to the main course the food was amazing. The chicken was well done tasted just right not too hot not too mild. The pasta was just so good.. they were so patient with taking the order .<br> <br>Overall a good experience a must visit if you love the fried chicken and the pasta...

The 1.5 hour wait for a to go order and the photo of the order says it all.<br><br>They need to rethink the entire process or say fine in only.<br><br>That experience alone has changed my mind from all cheesecake restaurants.

I love The Cheesecake Factory, I am not afraid to say it out loud. I always have a great time here with great food and nice service.<br>I was here tonight with coworker and we had a blast.<br>Our waiter Koriey is very attentive and constantly checked our table to see if everything was alright. Food was always decent and in huge portion, you can always make sure you will have leftovers for next day&#39;s lunch!

Great place to eat. The service is fast and that is what I like about it. The food is really good and I recommend that whatever you want you should get it. Also the cheesecake is really good.<br><br>We usually get the Godiva cheesecake but some others are good as well. I would suggest that you should eat here in the future.

I LOVE The Cheesecake Factory, but I try to stay away from this location. Service is usually subpar, and the last two times (TWO CONSECUTIVE TIMES) they told me they couldn&#39;t make my meal after I had waited over 10min for it.<br>Love the menu, love the business, just not this location.

Ive been here numerous times but never wrote a review on Yelp. We went there in the morning for breakfast. We were seated outside and glad we did since it was nice out in the morning. We ordered a breakfast burrito and an omelet coffee and orange juice. I have to say the breakfast burrito is enough to feed two people because I couldn&#39;t finish it myself but it was very good and fulfilling for a breakfast item on the menu. I felt the service was good and on point since it was not so busy. I would definitely come back again in the morning for breakfast.

I&#39;ve particularly enjoyed this location for a while....until recently when I encountered the worst kind of service. Last Friday after work, we decided stop by for some quick drinks and appetizer. We sat at the bar and went through a round of drinks. Martinis and vodka cranberries to be exact . The second round we notice the drinks were just juice. We informed our waiter Brian that we&#39;d like for him to submit a request to remake the drinks or just take it off the bill. He said, &#34;oh the process is a bit lengthy and he has to get a manager involved...blah blah&#34; so we ended up asking him to just take it back and remake them. He says &#34;don&#39;t worry about I&#39;ll make it better&#34;. Then comes back with a bill that&#39;s 5$ higher than the usual saying he charged us extra to add more shots. How do you make unsatisfying drinks then make it better by adding more alcohol without my consent and on top of that tack on more money to our bill?!?!!!!! Shocked by Brian&#39;s thought process we request to see the manager. A manager by the name of Josh comes to listen to my story and quickly he accuses me of ordering the extra shots and because I requested so, they had to tack on the extra charge. Appalled by the situation, I try and explain the situation again and he refuses to listen but to repeat &#34;ma&#39;am do not raise your voice at me&#34; when I did not raise my voice. He takes our bill and takes the 5$ off (the non approved incurred charge) and still doesn&#39;t bring back our drinks!!!!! I guess at this location the blind leads the blind. Incompetent floor manager equates to another incompetent waiter. Service driven industry just thrown out the window

Decor: nice cheesecake atmosphere, 4 stars<br>Service: well trained staff and large menu, 4 stars<br>Food: I like the wide variety cheesecake always offers so anyone can find whatever they like. The food is always alright. 3 stars

Worst Restaurant I&#39;ve Ever Been To!<br><br>We waited for an hour and a 1/2 for our food and when we got it, it was cold. NEVER AGAIN! SOPHIA the waitress was SOOOOO enthusiastic for being there that she managed to stop by our table a whole 2 times during our 2-hour visit. Once to ask what we wanted, 2nd time to drop off our check! Disgusted!  <br><br>LAST TIME!

The Family went here for Father&#39;s Day brunch this past Sunday.   We arrived at 11am , waited approx 40 min ( not bad) and were seated. Our first server came right over and took a drink order. Approx 10 minutes later another server came to our table and retook the order and stated he would be our new server.  He took our food orders .  He was friendly and courteous.  <br>The problem arose when the 6 of us waited an hour for food to arrive . The first 2 of 6 orders arrived shortly after an hour . We called the manager over as the one order which was jambalaya hash had to be sent back.  The food was cold and the sunny side fried egged were curled up and dry. The rest of the 4 orders came out 1 at a time. Needless to say we all finished our meal at different intervals   Our server apologized for the kitchen&#39;s production. As that was not enough when we received our bill we were charged twice for 2 entrees, which when brought to his attention our server took care of .  Very sad to see the volume for brunch cannot be handled well at this establishment   The manager although apologetic did not send anything, complimentary , to the table nor affect our bill in any way for the inconvenience

I came here to give &#34;the Cheesecake Factory another chance. I was wrong. I was with my fiancé, we ordered a everything pizza for appetizer and I ordered the pasta carbonara with chicken and she had fresh grilled salmon(instead of mash potato she wanted broccoli). It went wrong from the entre, it took 10 - 15 mins after our appetizers were done. There were people seated way after us and had almost finished their dinner. By that time we were not that hungry anymore. My dish came out and my girlfriends&#39; came out. She did not want mash potatoes, so the waiter came and said yea she did not want mash and took the dish back. As we waited for her food to come back again she wants to try mine, she took a bite and her face cringed,&#34;omg...it is soooo salty!!&#34; So I took a bite...it tasted like it was in a salty bath....I asked the waiter to get the manager. Josh(manager) came and apologized and agreed with me. The had said he would take it off the check. We ended up paying for the appetizer. Honestly if it were me...I would of took off everything.. sad to say there was I reason I did not return and it was 5 years ago.

Three of us had a wonderful experience here last night. Although there were a lot of people waiting in line, since the place is so massive, we were sat in about 5 minutes. Our waitress was really friendly, as was the busser fellow who brought everything out. <br><br>What really won everyone over at our table was my order of Hibachi Steak -- a large portion of Hanger Steak (which I asked for rare) which was cooked to perfection and incredibly tender, on a bed of bean sprouts and onions, with a side of skin-on red-potatoes and wasabi butter, accompanied by a sort of light teriyaki sauce -- this dish was banging, and my friends kept offering to trade me bites of theirs just so they could keep taking more bites of mine. Oh, and the breads they brought to our table, three different types, were warm and delicious. My friend&#39;s salad was everything she expected, while my other friend&#39;s Chicken Tortillas came with excellent beans and amazing corn cakes but the main component was underwhelming. For dessert, I didn&#39;t care much for the Lemon Meringue Cheesecake but the Key Lime Cheesecake was absolutely addictive...<br><br>I never got to eat at chain restaurants or even fast food as a kid, and living in NYC it&#39;s really never even been a consideration for me, but I&#39;ve always heard great things about the Cheesecake Factory and now I know why. This was my second experience and it was terrific. Although my first experience at the Yonkers location was a nightmare, I&#39;m glad I gave the company a second chance, and this location was just great. I cannot wait to return again for that Hibachi Steak!
