I live super close to this location so it&#39;s literally one of my favorite restaurants to come to. I never have a bad experience with service, food, or anything really. Always an A1 experience. <br><br>The ONLY reason I&#39;m giving it 3 Stars right now is because the cucumber lemonade has so much potential but it&#39;s killed with all the sugar! I can barely taste what I love most about cucumber , its refreshing flavor. I understand this is a chain restaurant and things are typically frozen, imported, etc etc so not asking for a farm to table approach buuuut lay off the sugar pls. Our guts will thank you lol<br><br>Just a small suggestion! I love it here otherwise :)

If I could put no stars, I would. 45 minutes to get drinks. Unbelievable/unreal. The waiter was no where to be found so we couldn&#39;t even tell anyone that we were waiting. Very unpleasant experience. The place is extremely hot and without drinks we were definitely getting dehydrated. Still, no drinks. We got appetizers but no drinks. We asked the food runner and he said that he will check. No drinks for another 20 minutes. We got the food, again no drinks on the table. We again told the food runner that we were waiting for the drinks, but he ran away like he couldn&#39;t care less. We have food but no drinks. I&#39;m not gonna say anything else about this place, use your judgement.<br>[we asked for plates-we got dirty ones; see picture]

I LOVED Cheesecake Factory but fell out of love big time. I get Chicken Marsala and ask for extra Marsala sauce. I offer to pay extra and no matter what I do they refuse. It came to the conclusion that the GM told me if I don&#39;t like it then I should go elsewhere. I offered to buy 2 entrees to just get all the sauce from both on one. They said NO!  They also removed crab cake appetizer and told me it has been removed from the menu EVERYWHERE. That was bullshit because I went to Nashville and of course they had the crab cake appetizer. Nashville really a land locked state offers it but not a costal CRAB state. I haven&#39;t been back in over a year and never will. They also if you notice only give you 3 pieces of butter for a huge basket of bread which is usually stale. If you ask for more you get 2. So pathetic that this publicly traded company only cares about investors not customers.<br><br>I did as you said and filled out the form but received no phone call. As expected!   NEVER RECEIVED A CALL BACK OR AN EMAIL. NEVER WILL I GO TO ANY ESTABLISHMENT OWNED BY CHEESECAKE FACTORIES PARENT COMPANY.

Food was excellent, but service was VERY lacking. <br><br>I&#39;ve eaten a lot of places, but this was actually my first trip to The Cheesecake Factory. I was very happy with my meal, as was my wife, but server was lacking. He was probably having an &#34;off&#34; night, but he didn&#39;t smile, talk much or check our table often. That was a disappointment. <br><br>We waited a long time from being seated to getting drinks. A long time waiting to have our order taken, and a very long time to order dessert. So long that we asked to see a manager. He was kind and comped desserts and also took our tea and soda off the check. From ordering to receiving our entrees was not bad at all. <br><br>That was a review saver, because without that the service was so bad - it could have been only 2 stars.

Can&#39;t really say anything bad about the cheese cake factory. You know the quality of the food.  Depending on the day, service is great. Wait time, it varies at all time. But I always have a good experience and eat good food. Dame expectations as always.

My recent eat in was not the best. (Note* Our server was nice, but not as attentive) I had the Fettuccini Alfredo pasta, &amp; it was pretty salty. The fried Mac n cheese was ok, but it was a little salty too; not as salty as the fettuccini though. I didn&#39;t want to complain, because I&#39;m not that kind of person. If it&#39;s tolerable, I&#39;d rather not waste food; but can they just taste what they cook even if it&#39;s a little bit. I almost needed a sip of my drink after each bite. Good thing I only got the lunch portion.

I almost never Yelp about the waiter but I gotta give big kudos to our waiter Angel, thanks for being so accommodating and making our dining experience so pleasant tonight!!! He made up for our not so great last visit, in which we were hardly getting any attention from our waitress perhaps due to our table location (outside facing the indoor shops) and she didn&#39;t look very happy working there. In contrast with the last server, Angel was super attentive, made sure we were happy with everything and maintained a very positive and friendly attitude throughout our dinner, which was very refreshing to see. I can see he enjoys his job and takes pride in what he does, which is so rare to see these days... nowadays too often we encounter unfriendly service and I wish more waiters would smile more just like this waiter Angel. We were observing him and we were impressed how hard he was working so I decided to ask his name, so that I can surprise him by mentioning him in my review. I come here quite often but I must say he was the best server I&#39;ve ever had at Cheesecake Factory. Excellent customer service and big smile go a long way, please keep it up!
The food is mediocre, the wait horrific and the service is next to non existent. Are they going to France to get two glasses of artisinal water?

Went back to Cheesecake Factory again after not going for a long time. Same thing - music is way too loud... so annoying. Louisiana Chicken Pasta was my all time favorite - no more; they&#39;ve changed the ingredients and I had to throw it out. Why the change in atmosphere and menu?
STEVE WAS THE MANNNN!!!! And delicious food it was so good ! Amazing service made the night tho, def come here (:

This is by far the worst Cheesecake Factory in the world ! My wife just had a kale quinoa salad. The salad tasted like it had some type of cleaner or chemical in it. It made her throw up minutes after she ate part of it. When we brought it to the waiters attention. He treated it like it was an over cooked steak. Not that that they poisoned my wife with chemicals. Stay away from this location !

Had my second thoughts about this place with their brunch but wow was I wrong. I had just made it with only 15 minutes remaining for brunch and it was packed with a wait of over 30 minutes. Saw a couple of seats open at the bar and the bartender was more then happy to take care of us. The food was great and the service was even better. Would recommend this place with a great brunch menu to chose from.

I have been to a few Cheesecake Factories at this point in my life and I am always impressed with the size of the menu, the variety of plates they have to offer and that every single thing on the menu is actually good!  They must have an enormous orchestra of chefs in the kitchen working to prep and cook such a wide variety of menu items for such a large restaurant.  <br><br>The portions are reliably large so I always leave with leftovers for later or tomorrow&#39;s lunch.  I especially appreciate the big water glasses so that I am never empty.  This Cheesecake Factory in particular has very friendly and quick service, we never have to second guess this place when it&#39;s suggested for our lunch stop.

Food was okay but the best part of dinner was the service and the cheesecake. Our server Malcom was fantastic and a very cool dude. We were greeted promptly with water and bread, and our waters were always refilled. The s&#39;mores cheesecake was outstanding. The texture was silky and not too chocolaty, well balance with marshmallow and graham crackers with a dollop of whipped cream.

I am usually not a fan of chain restaurants but this place exceeded my expectations. Came here for dinner and it was really good. My chicken dish was cooked perfectly and their cheesecakes are delicious. The service was nothing special but the food definitely made up for it.
If you want to enjoy foods, then find other place. Maybe cheese cake only, but really???

Always the best! It&#39;s my favorite restaurant, I got there at least once a month and everything I have tried has been great. And I always make sure I take some loafs of The pumpernickel bread home!
Worst service ever.. food took more than an hour to arrive. No water, they didn&#39;t even give us folks and knives.. no way to describe how bad everything was

From all the cheesecake factories in the world, this is my least favorite. I don&#39;t know how easy it is to mess up a plate that all other cheesecake factories can get right but this place sure does it. They get two stars because they didn&#39;t mess up the cheesecake- that&#39;s about it.
Loved the bbq burger!! The waiter was super friendly, atmosphere was very nice price was good as well!!!

I am likely the biggest Cheesecake Factory fan on the planet. I eat at any CF I come across whether I&#39;m in my home state of NJ or Traveling through the country. I visit the Hackensack NJ area for 3 days every month to have my scans and follow up visit at the Cancer Center in town. I order CF from DoorDash now that it&#39;s available in this area. I stay at a nice hotel with a nice restaurant but I prefer CF over anything the restaurant here has. That being said; I was super disappointed last night. I&#39;d say the blame is 70/30 between the CF and the DD driver (CF taking the 70). I ordered the Thai lettuce wraps(a staple for me) the new spicy cauliflower bites and key lime cheesecake. When it arrived and I took everything out of the bag something was leaking. Turns out it was two of the three sauces and they were all over everything. So I wiped everything down and realized there was no plastic ware. Remember I&#39;m in a hotel so I could either let my food get colder (it was 33 degrees last night so I was expecting that) or I could just eat the lettuce wraps with my hands. Surprise number 3...no chicken. I know they usually package it separately but apparently they forgot to place it in my bag (or the driver had a snack on the way here) So now I&#39;m eating vegetarian lettuce wraps with my hands. The cauliflower bites were EXCEPTIONAL! I could eat them all day every day lol. A fork would have been helpful because they are quite sticky. I waited about a half hour after eating to break into the cheesecake. Key lime...delish but hard to eat (I had to use two plastic coffee stirrers ) and the top of the cheesecake was smashed like it was tipped over. That&#39;s on the DD driver. Likely that&#39;s the cause for the leaking containers as well.:.but the lack of chicken and plastic ware is on CF. And yes, the driver should have checked for a fork but when your packing something to go, especially with a hotel address....throw a fork in the bag. <br>This won&#39;t keep me from ordering CF again tonight lol. I&#39;m here till Wednesday and there&#39;s nothing I&#39;d rather eat up here than CF....I received a small credit for the chicken/fork blunder last night so they better make it up to me by making sure everything is in the bag and tightly wrapped. Food quality is always on point so I don&#39;t even need to bring that up. I hope to push the stars up tonight. I know you&#39;re probably wondering how I gave 4 stars with these issues. It&#39;s an overall rating and I can&#39;t give them less than 4 when there were just tiny issues. It is a step down from the 5 I usually give but they still rated 4....and a half lol.

Fried chicken and waffles!!  The brunch was ok and I had a mimosa to accompany my food.  Unfortunately, you can only be served a mimosa after 12p.  Although you can still order from the regular menu,  I decided to be daring and try their brunch menu for kicks!  The portion was perfect, but for the price you pay I expected a little more.  Maybe I&#39;ll give it another try!!

So my boyfriend took me out for a pre shopping birthday meal this past Wednesday. We finally had a day off together so every minute was precious. Anyway we were sat right away in a nice quiet section in a cozy booth for two . The drinks were great, the food was great as always but... the service was what made our precious time together so absolutely enjoyable. Ryan, our waitress was just so sweet and understood our game plan. She was on point with spacing out our apps and mains so we can really just drink, laugh, talk, and be happy. Ryan was super knowledgeable, extremely sweet and attentive but in a way that wasn&#39;t annoying. We once in a while go to the cheesecake factory because we love the cocktail selection and the food but sometimes we feel rushed. Most servers like to turn and burn tables, and I get it when your busy you need the table... but with her it was quality over quantity. We are going to call ahead on our next visit to make sure she takes care of us. Him and I both work long hours and she just made the beginning of the evening exactly what we needed. Thanks again Ryan, you rock .

My wife likes this place but every time i agree to go to this place it keeps on getting <br>worse. The management is to blame here. I believe it&#39;s the lack of experience and not aware what&#39;s going on in the restaurant. They think just because the customer is seated their job is over. Wrong guys and gals ..... you need to walk to the floor and see wHrs going on at the tables and all the customers waiting for their food. Offer a refill of their soda ask the customers if everything is ok . The place is so disorganized and everyone is running around doing nothing .<br>Last time I am coming to this place .

I had the meatloaf delivered by door dash and the food was disgusting I honestly was more satisfied with my door dash delivery lady than the hideous cook they have there I know I will personally not be ordering from here again

First time at the new location - disappointed. Had guests from out of town - arrived at 8:25 finally got a table at 9:45. 20 minutes later got order taken. After another 15 minutes one of the wrong drinks arrived. An hour later at around 10:45 food arrived. One of the dishes that should have had chicken arrived without chicken. Manager says &#34;did you want chicken in that&#34; - seriously. <br><br>I know it&#39;s not the Ritz and it&#39;s a Saturday night but come on.

If this was my first time visiting a Cheesecake Factory, it would be my last. I&#39;ve been countless times and this is by far the worst service and experience yet. 1st - we&#39;re seated and after about 10 minutes someone finally comes over to greet us and take our drink order. We tell the waitress that we are celebrating a birthday and she was very nice and told us she too had a birthday soon. Then when our server Demian comes over and introduces himself, it goes down hill quickly. My silverware was covered in chocolate and wasn&#39;t washed, he replaced it with a clean set. We had to ask for refills every time, he went a long period of time without checking on our table. When it came time for dessert, he went to get menus and was gone for a long period of time. I had to look for him at one point. They never sang happy birthday but someone must have told him because when the check came he was very apologetic. also, the bathrooms were disgusting... completely trashed and none of the stalls had toilet paper... luckily I was only looking to blow my nose. This could have been a great time but details that needed to be addressed lacked attention. Not worthy of a star

Couldn&#39;t believe this was my first time coming to Cheesecake Factory. The menu was huge as it took me a long time to order a meal. Finally I decided to have white rice with orange chicken and it was delicious. Sat outside as it was a nice night and the service was also good. Staff was very helpful as they gave suggestions for different meals they felt I should try. With a menu like what they have, I would definitely come back so that I can eventually try everything. Also the cheesecake they had was good.

As I am typing my review,  I am tasting the sweet plantains from my order that was surprisingly good at my desk at work. Lol <br><br>I&#39;ve been here plenty of times but it has been a while. My recent visit was yesterday with the fam per their request. There was 45 minute wait but we were seated in about 30 minutes which was a world record for me coming to Cheesecake Factory establishments so off to a good start. <br><br>Our waitress was pretty attentive and very energetic in a good way. She went a head and took our drink orders as we were still deciding of what to eat. As we got our drinks, we went ahead and ordered our meals. I ordered the Jamaican Shrimp with black beans and rice and plantains. I was expecting a mediocre dish at best based on previous experiences lol but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised it had a decent flavor and tasted pretty good. My daughter ordered the Four Cheese Pasta. which she enjoyed but I tasted it and was not impressed at all. I didn&#39;t taste 4 cheeses and the flavor was bland to average.My son had the Mac N Cheeseburger which he enjoyed and the fries it came with tasted very good. He crushed it. Kids both ordered cheese cake slices which of course is the one thing they do have that&#39;s pretty Damm amazing lol and earned the right to be called Cheesecake Factory. I am not a big cheesecake person but I have to admit I like their cheesecake&#39;s in particular. <br><br>Overall listen it is a huge Chain spot and the food is okay you pay more for the name than the overall quality in my opinion. The sister company Grand Lux Cafe to me has way better food quality. I would recommend this place if you are a true Cheesecake fan because that they do extremely well no doubt about it. Kids were happy which is all that matters I guess lol.

This review is related to takeout orders. Last night we ordered takeout from this location through Door Dash. Everything we ordered we have had before in the restaurant and the quality of takeout is definitely not what you get for dine-in. The cheeseburger spring rolls were so burned they were basically inedible, I asked for a burger to be medium-rare with extra sauce on the side and received a well done burger with no sauce at all and missing the tomato, lettuce, and pickles. The two slices of cheesecake were so badly packed part of both of them has been smashed in the container closures. The Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta was also lacking some of the vegetables it was supposed to have. All in all it was an $85 dinner (plus delivery and tips) that was partially inedible and of extremely low quality. Probably won&#39;t order from them again.

Not sure what is going on with this location, it just seems to get worse each time we go. It doesn&#39;t matter if you go when it&#39;s busy or slow, service is slow and food takes forever to come out. Better off going across the street to the coach house diner, they have a liquor license and they are always fast.

I stopped here to have a few after dinner drinks after a long day. I have one word for this place, the bar in particular- Pathetic! The bartenders are so inexperienced and careless with the drinks. I will not go back. The manager should have someone come in and train the bartenders on how to make a drink. The Pineapple Moscow mule was so sweet and lacked the real ingredients, just horrible. Good luck if you go here and stick to the water, at least they can&#39;t screw that up.

No wait on a Saturday afternoon which was lovely. First timer and the menu was overwhelming! They sure want to be all inclusive! <br><br>Mac and cheese bites were an awesome start and a recommendation from our waiter. <br><br>I had a sale from the skinnylicious menu and it was perfect and more than enough! My friend had garlic chicken which I tried and enjoyed as well. Large portions, great drinks. The cheese cake of course was to die for. We shared the salted caramel and had left over!

Other Yelpers hit it spot on! Came here for a casual Sunday Brunch and while the food for fine the service was not. From start to finish we had a terrible experience, from needing to ask for water each and every time to plates and glasses not being clean up. I am not sure management actually cares about the business. Each time it took so long that we needed to ask where the drinks were, where the appetizers were and where the entrees were. We got our 2nd round of drinks only after we asked another server to check on it and after we finished our meals, clearly someone forgot to place in the order. This is a management issue, they are clearly either understaffed or untrained. <br><br>We paid our bill and told the manager our comments but outside of a few rehearsed &#34;sorry&#34; lines, he walked away. Given that its owned by the same parent company with similar menus go down the road to to Grand Lux. The management team actually wants your business. Yelpers I encourage you to not only leave your comments but speak with you wallet and go to a different spot. Only when this location feels it on their P/L do they have incentive to change. Don&#39;t pay full price for a fraction of the service.

My boyfriend and I love The cheesecake factory and we usually go to this one in hackensack or the one in williowbrook but after the last time in willowbrook we didnt have a nice encounter with the manager there but wednesday night we came here and it was the best service, everything was on point. Our waiter Amanda M was so amazing super friendly. There was a small encounter where some ketchup must haven fallen by us, which we didnt realize. The Manager Eddy came over to check if anything had fallen on us and if we were okay which it wasnt that big of a deal but he was so so nice and even offered us a piece of cheesecake to take home which again he did not have to do at all, but the fact that he did and was so concerned and caring is why This will now be our go to spot. AMAZING AMAZING services !!!!! btw best mac and cheese balls EVER ! So yummy !

I opted to come here after a very long hiatus - and didn&#39;t even realize they moved locations within the same mall square. My friend had recently mentioned the Cheesecake Factory and I decided I needed me some oversized portions for a good price. <br>I was seated immediately and my server was a little slow but nice nonetheless. I knew exactly what I wanted due to my extensive research during work hours- shhh. Anyways I ordered the chicken Riesling dish- but customized it with crispy chicken instead of that grilled nonsense. It added the perfect texture against the rich and creamy mushrooms and bacon with buttered pasta. It lacked a little seasoning but I was able to counteract that with the salt and pepper provided on the tables. I was extremely satisfied with my choice so I decided to try dessert as well. <br>I have been craving carrot cake for a while now so that&#39;s what I went it. The cake itself was moist and tender, the cream cheese filling was pleasant. All in all it was a very good dinner.

By far the worst cheesecake I&#39;ve been. Rude and stupid people.... use dirty soaked &#34;white towel&#34; grey ... to clean the table. I was told 20 mins wait I waited 55 mins and that&#39;s when I had to tell them. Anyway .... so while waiting 55 mins I was observing the staff especially the boss boy or woman. They use the same cloth to clean about 8-9 table.  Our table was still wet when we were sitting down and when asked to dry it the lady said I didn&#39;t do this someone else did . Anyway food was ok. Typical soaking in butter food  lol I love butter so god knows what was in there . The bread was my favorite part of the meal.

Sat for 30 min in uncrowded and slow atmosphere without even a menu while another table was served and ready to pay their bill in that time. Waitress was rude and inattentive, drinks forgotten, food late. I&#39;m usually a huge fan of CF but this was unacceptable.

When me and my family got here, the place was packed. It was about 5:30 p.m. on a Monday. We had to wait an hour which is fair because it was 7 of us. But after getting called up, the hostesses told us to move to the left. It looked like other people were waiting to get seated too. Why call us up if we&#39;re gonna have to wait 5 extra minutes for a table to clear up? My aunt and grandma can&#39;t stand up for long as they have knee issues so they were definitely feeling annoyed.<br><br>But whatever. When we sat down, it took a good 10-15 mins for a server to come and ask us for our drinks. Like I know the place is packed but still. We were also missing one small plate and we had to ask two different servers to get one.  <br>My family and I shared buffalo wings, calamari, crab cakes and the egg roll sampler. I got the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and it was very dry so I asked for more sauce. It tasted alright but the chicken tasted like it had too much olive oil. I think they refried it. I wanted to try some cheesecake because they&#39;re famous for the cheesecake so why the hell not? So I got the chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake. That was the only good thing apart from the brown bread.<br><br>After we finished paying, I got really nauseous and it wasn&#39;t until the next morning that woke up in a cold sweat and threw up. It was the god damn pasta.<br><br>Never again am I eating the food here.

Yesterday I had  lunch there and my server was  not attentive and gave off f a &#34; I was bothering him vibe&#34; when i asked him for things<br>The tip I left him was a reflection of that. I got home and was eating the second half of my mac and cheese burger today and i pulled a half inch of plastic with writing on it out of my mouth! <br>I called  and spoke to Robert the manager  and told him i will bring the plastic and rest of burger i could not eat after that. I told him whatever the number on the plastic it is  proof of  some brand of product they use. He said no need and took my info and said he was mailing me a $25 gift card! I think this is a slap in the face my bill was more then that. I don&#39;t want a gift card  i don&#39;t plan to EVERRR EAT THERE AGAIN. They need to send me at  LEAST  a larger monetary refund by check! I have contacted corporate and waiting for a response<br>SHAME ON<br>YOU<br>IM GOING TO CONTACT A ATTY FOR THE DISRESPECT FOR HAVING CHEWED ON<br>PLASTIC and offered a $25 gift certificate to EAT THERE AGAIN

I don&#39;t care what anyone says...I&#39;ll always love The Cheesecake Factory!! I like the food here and portions are always super large. I personally think the lunch sizes are more reasonable but we don&#39;t always have time to sit here for lunch. Love their pasta dishes and the stuffed mushroom. Service was slow when we came. This specific restaurant is clean and spacious. The bathrooms are always clean too. There&#39;s outdoor seating but not much of a view since it&#39;s literally in front of a big parking lot. <br><br>The best deal for The Cheesecake Factory is when they give you free slices of cheesecake when you purchase a $25 gift card around Christmas time (buy it and use it on yourself!) or when it&#39;s Cheesecake Day and all their cheesecakes are half off.

The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food is always great but they need a better system for carry out and Doordash orders or when it is super busy. Because waiting an hour and some change for an online order is just not what I like to do with my time.

This is a pretty nice cheesecake factory. They renovated not too long ago, and I think the food taste better than before! The wait isn&#39;t too bad (depends on how many people you have). I think the average wait is about 10 minutes for two people. I love the pasta and desserts!

Went here for lunch today with the Mrs.   We ordered off the low calorie menu.  We had the chicken dumplings which were so good.  I was even sopping up the sauce with the bread like it was gravy.<br><br>For our entrees, my wife ordered the Chicken Salad Sandwich with Sweet Potato Fries.  It was ok, just a little too much mayonnaise for my taste.  I had the Turkey &amp; Avocado Sandwich with a Side Salad.  It was really good and had thick slices of smoked bacon.<br><br>All was healthy up until this point (and filling).  We then strayed a bit, (a lot actually).  We ordered two slices of cheesecake to go (can&#39;t go to a place named The Cheesecake Factory and not have cheesecake right?)  We ordered the Key Lime and the low carb (will have to let you know about the low carb when I actually eat it).  <br><br>Once again, thanks Lor A for a great tip. Sorry couldn&#39;t resist the cheesecake.
We went there for quick afternoon treat. It was quiet busy the service was good. The best part cheesecake &amp; coffee! It&#39;s a good spot to stop by after shopping.

Our server Brittany K. was great.  She greater us with a smile, was eager to serve us, was pleasant through our entire meal and kept checking to make sure everthing was ok.<br><br>Our food came out just as we ordered it and was the quality you would expect from Cheesecake Factory.  <br><br>This location tends to be very very noisy.  Patrons are always loud.  Plates, silverware and dishes always seem to be banging around.

I went here June 24th 2019 at around 10:00 pm. I ask the hostess, a small girl with black hair for a table, and she tells me there is a two hour wait. I&#39;m upset, a two hour wait, how could that be? I&#39;m just kidding she replies. What kind of hostess from hell is this? Very unprofessional. Other than that, my waiter was great and the food was great, but the hostess ruined it for me.

Worst service ever! Server name was Edward M. He really didn&#39;t care nor did he provide any type of great guest service. Everything was beyond mediocre. It&#39;s sad because Cheesecake Factory usually has some amazing servers. What happened to the hiring process here?<br><br>If you do go to this location avoid EDWARD M at all costs. He needs to be EDUCATED about hospitality.
Always without fail takes me back to my college days. The Cajun jambalaya pasta is always my favorite. And cheesecakes are great. Can&#39;t ever decide on what to get!

My friend and I came for lunch on a Thursday and it was surprisingly busy! The host offered indoor or outdoor seating, but we chose to go to the bar because we were in a slight crunch for time and bar service is usually quicker.<br>Our bartender was really nice, forgot his name but made me a pretty weak Long Island Iced Tea. It came in a huge glass but tasted like too much sour mix... I&#39;m a 102 pound girl 5 feet tall, I usually feel tipsy off one glass of wine....sooo... don&#39;t know what happened there.<br>It was kind of difficult to get his attention, even though we were the only bar guests there. He was preoccupied stocking and cleaning or whatever and paid little attention to us. I ended up sucking down my drink like a lemonade and enjoyed my meal, regardless.<br>The Sheila Salad definitely brings this review back up to 4 stars because it was phenomenal! Food came fast and hot, delicious and perfect! <br>I love the interior of this particular Cheesecake. It&#39;s very open, so you&#39;re not confused about where the bathroom is, where to find your table after you use the bathroom, where the indoor dining, bar area, and outdoor seating is.<br>And most conveniently, it&#39;s part of the Riverside Mall, right next to Barnes and Nobles.

My first review on yelp, mainly because i had a bad experience with this restaurant. I ordered on the phone for pick up, a margarita pizza, chix Alfredo, chopped salad and two cheesecakes. Said 25 mins, okay sounds reasonable. <br><br>I Come in after 25 mins to pick it up, they already charged me for it, so I thought maybe the food was ready. Waited for quite sometime only to find out that my food was just waiting in the kitchen to be picked up. First of all, don&#39;t charge a customer whose order is not even ready to begin with and has to wait for 20 mins to get it. Now, I get my food finally and I check it out and the Pasta they used was penne instead of linguini. I didn&#39;t ask for it, and it looked like slop. Manager was there and I asked him if it normally comes like this, he then apologizes and I changed it to angel hair. Waited again for another 30 mins, all for a corrected Alfredo. It has been an hour that I&#39;ve been waiting. They couldn&#39;t even communicate to rush it. Finally the guy in the counter saw me and tried to rush my order from the back. I finally got it and didn&#39;t even bother to check it. <br><br>Now comes the tasting part. The pizza, as you expect, was already cold. It was a bit undercooked too. I can still taste some raw pizza dough. Sauce was good tho. The salad was okay, had balsamic vina. The only bad part was the chicken, it was one of the leftover ones you get from the slicer. The end pieces of the chicken. They didn&#39;t bother to chop that. The two cheesecakes were good, as expected. But the damn Alfredo, was a disaster. The sauce was not even seasoned, along with the chicken they use. It was like eating reduced heavy cream with just a touch of parm. Horrible, so horrible. I can&#39;t believed I payed for that slop. <br><br>Just come here for the Cheesecakes, that&#39;s it. Everything else, just a big N-O. NO.

As much asI love the food here, and it is delicious this review is only about the suggested tips they put on the bill. Gratuity should be based on service not on the taxable bill. Why should I be paying tips on tax?
Oh God too overcrowded, too many people. Food takes forever to come out.  If you have time then go there
It&#39;s a chain place. Not sure what else to say. Don&#39;t expect it to be this super classy joint.

PROS: As with any cheesecake factory, the food is great and there&#39;s a lot to choose from. The prices are just right and they offer you big helpings of whatever you ordered. The wait staff is very nice and knowledgable about the menu. Parking isn&#39;t an issue since it&#39;s in a mall and the bathroom are very clean.<br><br>CONS: Theres always a long wait, not just because it&#39;s popular, but because the bus boys are slow at turning over tables. When it&#39;s not busy the restaurant will stick you in the corner by the window looking into the mall rather than in the center of the room. The plastic menus are always sticky and the food takes a long time to come out.<br><br>OVERALL: This is a typical cheesecake factory. It has a few problems like cleanliness and time management, but the quality of the food is good and the wait staff is always cheerful and ready to serve you.
Love the prosciutto and Arugala flatbread! The Brussels sprouts to start and enjoy a glass of Malbec!

Delicious food every time! Service can be a hit or miss, but today, we had a waiter named Walter who wash great! Remember everything without writing it down! Never missed a beat! <br><br>The bread is delicious, but careful you don&#39;t fill up before the great food arrives. <br><br>Try the:<br>Avocado egg rolls - they&#39;re amazing! <br>Stuffed mushroom - delicious <br>Miso salmon - greatness <br>Ruslan chicken - healthy and delicious at the same time. I have this almost every time! <br><br>Cheesecake? Ha! You can&#39;t go wrong!

Delicious food and absolutely delicious cheese cake. I recommend the mango cheesecake ! Besides that i thought the manager was super rude, which sort of ruined the experience. Otherwise i would still come for their food and cake!

Update:<br>Unfortunately, I doubt I will ever go back to this location unless for business outing purposes and have no other choice. I ordered the chicken chipotle pasta and chicken came out burnt. I notified our server (who was really nice) and she took offered to take it back and bring out a new dish. However with the new dish came a comment from the manager as well. Manager apparently wanted our server to pass on the message that the chicken is supposed to be &#34;blackened&#34;. Whatever that means. This pasta dish is one of my two favorite dishes at Cheesecake factory and there was not a single time at any other locations where the chicken came out burnt. Honestly, if the manager had something to say he should have come to the table himself but instead sent the message through the waitress. It is unfortunate I didn&#39;t take a picture because I wasn&#39;t planning on writing an updated review but this location is no longer one of the places I would refer to anyone. I got a new dish which I had to ask to wrap up because my party (business outing) was done eating which I intend on throwing out after the smart remark the manager passed along to our server. <br><br>Please take customers&#39; feedback more seriously and try to talk directly to the customer rather than hide behind servers&#39; backs. It is just plain rude to pass along a message like that. It&#39;s not like the place is super big or it was that busy tonight. <br><br>Yelpers should think twice before going here.

PEOPLE WITH ALLERGIES BEWARE!<br>I have an egg allergy and my server did not care one bit. I asked for mashed potatoes and he said he would make sure all my food was safe. He serves me the food and comes back a few minutes later asking if I tried them yet because he couldn&#39;t find his kitchen manager to ask if it&#39;s safe to eat. I took two bites and had an allergic reaction. <br>You&#39;re better off going to Maggianos. They take allergies seriously and have a scratch kitchen
Smokehouse burger was delicious. Edamame looked very old and tasted terrible, unfortunately. Skimpy with the goat cheese on the beats and goat cheese salad. Cheesecakes are always good per usual.

I&#39;m not a big fan of places that let you wait 40 min when the whole place is empty, just to create a line .<br>Food is ok , you gotta wait for like another 30 min after you wait in line , at this point you are so hungry you will eat a horse .<br>Last think is not cheep at all , $100 for two salads and pasta .
bread, stale. Fries, stale. Calamari, all breading. My chicken dish, no seasoning. 45 min  serve time. Server could care less about us.  <br><br>Doesn&#39;t belong at riverside square.

This location is my go-to at night if I want some cheesecake and consistently good food. The whole grain bread and butter is my staple appetizer lol. <br><br>The service is usually very good. The wait isnt too long, given that its packed every time I go there = Sign of a good restaurant. <br><br>I recommend this location to friends when we hang out because it&#39;s close by me and it&#39;s always good food. I have yet to have a bad experience and I hope that keeps up.

This is our second visit in the last month or so. The first time we thought it was just an off day. Food took too long, and the service wasn&#39;t very attentive... seemed understaffed. This time, it took us an hour and 30 min and throughout, was the same stuff. Sat and it took a substantial amount of time for someone to take our drink order (we stopped him because by then we all had our full orders ready). Then another 15 min or more for drinks and bread to come. When the food finally arrived, the two apps we ordered had not come out, they came with the main meal... not acceptable. I got no refills on my drink because no one noticed it was empty for about 40min. Just not the level of service myself, or our table and of 8 expect when dining at a higher-priced option. Seems like someone needs to manage it better

This place consistently delivers quality lunch at the mall. What else could you really expect or ask for? Service is great. Atmosphere is good for any size party and the menu could accommodate any human any or every day of the year, as it is so varied. Salads, sandwiches, burgers, and apps are all solid choices. Portions are gigantic, so be sure to share or be ready to be stuffed and take something home. <br><br>Note: anything not on the skinny menu has SUPER high calories. So proceed at your own risk and/or share appropriately. <br><br>Four stars because it is reliable, consistent high quality (mall) food. <br><br>Best dishes:<br>Thai lettuce wraps<br>Any of the salads on the skinnny or non skinny menu<br>Burgers<br>Cuban sandwich<br><br>Enjoy. And yes of course, the cheesecake is light, fluffy, and bangin&#39;. But best off for your health if you skip it altogether. Not so tough considering how full you&#39;ll be anyway. Oh what the heck, be bad, share a slice. Hit the gym later.

There&#39;s something for everyone at Cheesecake Factory and it&#39;s out go-to place when we have family visiting. <br><br>This location is a little dull compared to the one in Shorthills Mall which has better customer service than this one. Here the staff is politely indifferent and once you ignore that  and concentrate on the real reason you&#39;re here...the cheesecake...you can have a good time.<br><br>This time we just had a range of apps and didn&#39;t opt for the main course and couldn&#39;t be happier - we unanimously feel that the small plates are much better than the main course at the Cheesecake Factory and they have an extensive menu to choose from.<br><br>The Avocado egg rolls, Dynamite shrimp and the Warm crab &amp; artichoke dip served with crusty bread are always a hit and this time was no different. This time we also got the Beets with goat cheese salad (gotta get those greens) and the Crispy crab bites. The salad was  good, the crab bites were strictly average and smelt fishy. <br><br>You can never go wrong with the red velvet cheesecake.

I first want to say this place is called the Cheesecake factory for a reason.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here a few times mostly for the cheesecake which is why this place has a solid 3. But I sat down to actually eat here twice. The first time, I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta which was mild in the spice department and could use more seasoning. <br>Then the second time I went to eat I ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp. Which when you read the description sounds very promising, but unfortunately was not. First they forgot my sweet plantains but somehow they put them on my boyfriend&#39;s plate, so he thought it was his and ate them. Kinda made me sad lol and then when I actually tasted the dish it lacked in flavor. Like it&#39;s crazy how a little bit of salt can make a big difference in a meal. <br><br>After those two disappointments in two separate meals, I&#39;m convinced they don&#39;t put any salt in their food. <br>But as far as the cheesecake goes it&#39;s pretty stellar

We order take out at least once a week. Getting  through to the takeout counter is always extremely difficult. After answering the phone you are ALWAYS played on hold. The other day I was on hold for 15 minutes. Drove to the restaurant, arrived and still on hold. No one had ever answered. What was the benefit of calling! This is HORRIBLE! The best part about takeout though is the friendliness and competence of Kiki and Lisbeth. These ladies are great!<br>Tip for the managers- deploy staff or hire staff- Do Not leave customers on phone for extended periods of time.
It&#39;s Friday night, and I just called and was told that they don&#39;t take reservations.  Hopefully when we walk in around 7pm, it won&#39;t be too packed for a party of 4.
This was so bad I would give it a 0 star rating. Terrible service, food was burnt, worst place I have eaten at.

This review is solely based on the food experience.<br>I would give ZERO stars if I could.  It was my family&#39;s first time at The Cheesecake Factory after they reloacted to the other side of the mall but if I can turn back time, I wouldn&#39;t have gone there.  The food was inedible and I still cannot believe that the food came to our table in the condition that it did.<br>Our family went on Christmas Eve around brunch time, probably a bad idea for future reference.  The food took FOREVER to come out, although the restaurant itself didn&#39;t seem as packed as it would be on a usual Sunday brunch time.  When the food came out, the server informed me that the plate was VERY hot, so becareful.  At first glance, the food looked ok.  I had ordered a meatloaf, took a bite and it had a burnt taste so I looked at the dish more carefully and I saw that all four outer sides of the meatloaf was burnt.  Our waiter came to check on us and I told him that my meatloaf is a bit burnt.  He asked if we wanted anything else to replace my dish but I declined since we waited so long for our meal to come out and told him I&#39;ll just eat around it.  I took a bite of the mashed potato that came with my meatloaf and it was quite cool and the outer part was some what hard - almost as if it had been sitting out for a while.  I then tried to eat the &#34;unburned&#34; part of my meatloaf by trying to cut the burnt sides off of it and flipped the meatloaf around only to find a disgustingly burnt meatloaf on the othter side.  <br>I wanted to speak to the manager at this point so we were waiting to flag down our waiter.  Our 10 month old baby was getting fussy while all this was going on so I tried to give him some pancake from one of my kid&#39;s dish.  I grabbed the pancake with my hands and I felt a hard, crunchy texture - almost like a toast! I flipped the pancake over and that too was burnt! Our waiter finally came around and we told him we NEED to speak with the manager.  He was more than willing to get the manager so we waited.  While we were waiting, my husband and I were questioning all of our food so we took a bite from the other kid&#39;s dish - spaghetti and meatball.  My kid is 2 years old and he was just happy to finally eat his food so he was just digging in but when we took a bite, the pasta had a rubbery texture and the pasta was all clumped together.  Five minutes later, a chef or a cook wearing a cook&#39;s uniform came to our table.  I showed him my dish, and explained that my child&#39;s pancake was burnt and that he should try grabbing it to feel it himself.  I also told<br>him the spaghetti is either undercooked or it was sitting out too long because it has a rubbery texture.  He looked at our food and told us that the meatloaf and pancake is definitely burnt and apologized.  He asked if we would like something else to replace our dish, but we declined and told him we just want to pay for our drinks and one &#34;edible&#34; dish that we barely touched because of everything that was going on.  The chef/cook left and our waiter came to the table and informed us that the bill had been waived so we didn&#39;t need to pay anything.  My children were still cranky so my husband had to goto Smashburger across the mall from The Cheesecake Factory to get some burgers for them. <br>I&#39;m just sorry to my three little children who had to spend an hour at the restaurant without having a proper meal and I&#39;m sorry for myself for losing my appetite and I&#39;m sorry to my husband that our meal was a disaster.  I&#39;m also sorry for our waiter who had to get the chef/cook and apologize on behalf of the cook who cooked or tried to cook that food for us to eat.  If I could, I would like to see that person try to eat the food that was sent out.

The place well.... it&#39;s amazing! The Wait line was a pain but worth it. I ordered salmon with veggies (good, a bit dry but it was still pretty good), flat bread with pear and blue cheese (holy crap. I love this combination will definitely order this again!) and of course the cheesecake, what can I say, that&#39;s is what they&#39;re known for and they did not disappoint! The cheesecake fixed everything!!!!

Cheesecake Factory is one of my fav restaurants but this location is not as well managed as others. Came here on a Saturday night and the floors were greasy, the air conditioning was spotty, the waiter was all over the place, my wine glass was dirty, and the food was sloppily rushed.  This is not the Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve come to love.

Very disappointed in this establishment? As soon as I walked in I already saw red flags ? Employees talking to one another while customers stand waiting to be acknowledged. The food was awful ! I ordered the skinnylious burger and was like rubber meat ? I imagine this is now a burger would taste like a week later ???<br><br>The service was dreadful ! Our waitress had a difficult time hearing our order and was constantly saying &#34; WHAT&#34;?? No excuse me, what ! I absolutely can look pass those things, however, she barely came back to check on things, our food came out cold, never asked if we needed anything else, that was a blessing though, I couldn&#39;t wait to leave ! <br><br>I would have rather went to Burger King ( which I don&#39;t go too) for better food, believe that ?!? <br><br>Find somewhere else to have lunch/dinner or cocktails, it truly is a terrible restaurant.

Looks can be deceiving when you pull your car in the parking lot.... It appears as if there are a herd of cattle waiting to get inside the restaurant. For a party of two, your wait is always 15 minutes...so don&#39;t be discouraged go inside and ask how long will of a wait to be seated. Food is always fresh..service is usually good but there is always a slip up at some of our favorite spots....<br><br>Our server Caitlyn appeared inexperienced and nervous. Nervous for what.... I don&#39;t know...<br>She kept telling us &#34;one more minute be right there&#34;, huh..Finally she came to the table and maybe that was when she head me say to D, &#34;If she say one more minute again&#34; I don&#39;t know... She was acting really weird with us...<br><br>Nevertheless of the weird server,  food was great!You only have to screw me once I won&#39;t return here or perhaps visit another location. There are other restaurants for me to use my AMEX at......

Shame on you Cheesecake Factory. <br>Lousy service. Dirty plate. You lost my business.  <br>You sat my husband and I at a small table behind a pillar. Ten minutes go by no waiter. Tick Tock Tick Tock. Still no waiter. A very nice waiter offered to get us bread till our waiter comes. I said no thank you. I do not want to sit here and wait any longer. He was very nice and sat us at another table. HA!!! <br>We sit down and the first thing I noticed is a dirty plate with a napkin on it.  Yeah right. My husband and I walked out. <br>I went back inside to talk to a manager. She questioned the dirty plate. REALLY!! <br>That&#39;s not possible. REALLY!! <br>I know a dirty plate when I see one. <br>And I know bad service and a manager with a attitude when I see that too!   <br>Bye bye

Entrees are alright but the cheesecake is amazzzzinnnggg. I recommend trimming the 30 page menu and strengthening the taste of the options left. The lemon raspberry and chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecakes are top flavors.
Whenever I visit here servers are very welcoming and foods are awesome enough to try different ones per visit. I never regret visiting here :) Good job!

A cool place to hangout with a group. The bar looks nice and cocktails were good(we tried 3 different types of martini)<br>Food was really good! <br>We had avocado egg roles for an appetizer and miso salmon and pork sandwich for an entree. Everything tasted really good!!!<br> The only downside of this location of the Cheesecake Factory is that the cheesecake(we ordered strawberry cheesecake) was very disappointing. It wasn&#39;t that good at all...we really expected it to be something special :( <br>Overall a nice experience. I would go back but wouldn&#39;t order dessert!!!

Cheesecake factory... I have eaten there a few times in the past, but I have since given it up.  I now stick to driving up in front of the restaurant to run in and pick up a slice of cheesecake from time to time.<br><br>Let&#39;s talk about the food.  First, they have an overwhelming menu of which I usually win the unfortunate prize of choosing whatever they do NOT have available (Sending me back to the endless menu of doom to choose again, ugh).  If you are lucky enough to find something that is available expect giant portions of mediocre, &#39;stuff yourself&#39; food; Not my thing.<br><br>The cheesecake on the other hand is very tasty.  The ability for me to drive up in front, throw my hazard lights on, and run in and grab a couple of slices of great cheese cake when the craving arises is what has saved this place From a one star review.<br><br>Hey, at least the people eating there keep them open nice and late so I can show up and grab a slice of cheesecake from time to time,.  I&#39;m sure they would close earlier if they were cheesecake-only establishment =]<br><br>2 Stars.

The service is ok but the appetizers are amazing. Try the avocado egg rolls and the Koran spicy cauliflower, they rock. The bean burger was boring but the whole wheat bread they give for the table is perfect. The host on Saturday night (March 24th) seemed bored and didn&#39;t stay on top of who was supposed to be seated next. She stated we had a 5 minute wait and it turned in 17 due to her not paying attention.

Our waiter provided terrible service and didn&#39;t come by to check on us or pick up our appetizer plates. The food was uncooked and as a result a friend ended up with food poisoning. Definitely wouldn&#39;t recommend going to this Cheesecake Factory again. Service could be way better.

Never disappoints!! My go to is the four cheese pasta, if you haven&#39;t had it you&#39;re truly missing out - trust me. Every location is consistent with their great service and excellent food. I always leave happy :)

It&#39;s a decent representative of the chain.  Nothing more nothing less.  The place matches every other Cheesecake Factory out there.  Large in a busy mall with large amount of food traffic and large menu to compliment its largeness.<br><br>The only problem with the large menu is that the food becomes hit or miss proposition for the patrons.  Depending on the time of the day the day of the week and the chef running the kitchen today but if you&#39;re looking to come to a place fancier than let&#39;s say Panera Bread then this place is for you and it the choices are going to be the same across the various places in the chain.<br><br>One good thing that I do have to note is that the kids love their cheesecakes.

The s&#39;mores cheesecake is the best! That fresh burned caramel taste of the marshmallow just adds to the delight. Wonderful! <br><br>I also I am a fan of their summer spring rolls, with two sources that are bound to please people who don&#39;t have a spicy palate.<br><br>Another menu fave is the Asian lettuce wraps, making a good light meal in itself. Steak Diane is also great if you prefer a more substantive dinner. <br><br>Choose the paradise tea (comes unsweetened), if you are aching for a treat sans alcohol.

I love Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>What&#39;s even better is they have a small plates / tapas menu now. The staff here is always friendly and polite. The food is always good. The cheesecakes are out of the world. <br><br>I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve had a bad dish here and I&#39;ve eaten at this Cheesecake Factory since my high school years (oh goodness, that&#39;s over a decade ago!). They have never disappointed.<br><br>However, warning you that Friday and Saturday nights get a bit crazy so expect to wait or go on off nights like I do.<br><br>Another tidbit: if a table opens up by the bar area, there is no wait for those, hop onto a stool and enjoy your meal! (I&#39;ve often gotten around the 1 hour wait this way.)<br><br>Best cheesecakes include the Godiva and Chocolate Turtle (Caramel &amp; Nuts)!

We were charged for an extra drink on our bill because the staff claimed they cleared 5 mimosa glasses from our table when we only ordered 4. Our waitress even agreed that we were did not order the 5th drink. She stated she will &#34;ask them to take it off&#34;. <br>Instead, the manager came over to us and basically interrogated our group, demanding we tell her which one of us ordered the 5th drink. She was extremely rude and developed an attitude when I OFFERED to pay for it. It was $7.95 so I offered to just pay for it, if it was that big of a deal. But I also asserted that we did not order the extra drink. I told her to check the cameras if she wanted proof. She MOCKED me when I said that. She repeated &#34;check the cameras&#34; in a high pitched voice and rolled her eyes. WHAT IN THE WORLD?! If I did that when I worked in retail I would have been FIRED. <br>After this encounter we were kept even longer (almost 45 minutes) before we were given the option to pay. <br>They eventually took the charge off but the manager never came over to apologize. <br>The worst part is that our poor waitress apologized profusely for something that wasn&#39;t even her fault! She explained that it was &#34;her word against theirs&#34;. <br>A busboy incorrectly counted how many glasses they cleared from our table and so they charged us for it!<br>Why is a busboy responsible for charging items to a table&#39;s bill?? There&#39;s a reason busboys aren&#39;t waiters. THIS IS THE REASON. <br>After spending over $300 at this establishment, we were held hostage for almost an hour because of a $7.95 mimosa we didn&#39;t order. I understand they were only trying to ensure they were getting paid the right amount but they handled the situation so poorly. Never returning to this location again.

For the longest time I have heard nothing but great things about the cheesecake factory. After putting it off repeatedly, I finally came in for brunch. Unfortunately, it&#39;s reputation did not precede. <br><br>Pros:<br>We were sat almost immediately.<br>Our order came quickly<br>We came in under our $50 gift card<br><br>Cons:<br>Where do I start? Now, let me start this by saying that I realize this is not a diner and that done of these things may just be personal grievances.<br><br>First off, my coffee mug was dirty as there was food remnants stuck to the outside. More than that, when someone orders coffee, why would you not bring cream and sugar?<br><br>I ordered coffee, a custom omelet with mushrooms, ham, peppers and cheese with potatoes and toast. <br><br>If someone orders toast with their meal, doesn&#39;t it makes sense to bring pats of butter and/or jam? Who wants to eat plain dried bread?<br><br>In general I want impressed with the food. It wasn&#39;t anything I couldn&#39;t get elsewhere. <br><br>I ordered a slice of white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake and still wasn&#39;t impressed. There was absolutely nothing that caught my attention, it was just bland. I also wasn&#39;t a fan of the chocolate graham on the bottom.

I enjoyed a lovely lunch here. The half-size portions they offer for lunch are about $11 and still a good amount of food. <br><br>The BBQ ranch chicken salad is amazing. I loved every bite. Service was great too. My child enjoyed the kids pepperoni pizza, and my spouse loved the orange chicken. We got a slice of cheesecake to go. With two alcoholic drinks the meal came to $62.

Service was excellent our server&#39;s name was Carlos and he was extremely attentive. He came by every 15-20 mins to ask if we needed anything. It&#39;s really great when you don&#39;t have to wonder where the hell your server went !!<br><br>Food is average- good . It tastes how you&#39;d expect a chain restaurant to taste. Nothing really stood out in a sense of great or terrible. <br><br>The drinks are great though. Very fruity and beautifully presented! Great flavor! :)<br><br>Cute spot for a date ! Quality vs quantity($) ratio is Not that even though

if i could give negative stars i would. its been said over and over before but it worth repeating - they have THE WORST take out / pick up and customer service ever. EVERY SINGLE time we have ordered for pickup there has been something wrong with the order / food - they&#39;re ALWAYS missing a big part of the meal or have given us the wrong order. we have given them the benefit of the doubt so many times - its friday so its too busy ok we wont order fridays lets try on a tuesday; lets check the order when we&#39;re there etc. but nonetheless they still manage to screw up some way some how. tonight was definitely our last time ordering from here. honestly i just think that take out is not a big part of their profit so i dont really think they care whatsoever about the experience or the customers which is a shame because we have eaten in at least once weekly but we are so disappointed by the service received during take out that we are just not eating there again at all. all of those issues could just be solved by adding an extra 1 or 2 employees dedicated for takeout only at least during their busiest hours. its not that complicated. tonight we placed an order online - said itd be ready at a certain time - it was pouring rain but we made sure to get there by that time so our food wouldnt be cold - food was not ready for another 15 minutes to which ok but to top it off they forgot part of the order - the dressing which was clearly written on the ticket and it took them AN EXTRA 15 MINUTES to get it from the kitchen?! along with another disappointed customer who was waiting for a simple black coffee. SO DISAPPOINTING and not that this review will matter apparently but truly such a large restaurant with so many employees they should really step up and do better. and the worst part like i said is the service you get - the employees just act like its no big deal and totally dismiss you. ive worked in retail, customer service and in restaurants before and if you&#39;re any good at you do this service behavior is totally unacceptable.

One of my favorite restaurants to go to in the area on a last minute date night with my boyfriend. Came in around 8:30 pm was seated rite away, which was nice and unusual for the cheese cake factory. We looked over the menus and our waiter came over rite away to take our drink orders and came back with bread and butter. We ordered the fried mac and cheese, shrimp scampi for me (as usual) and my boyfriend ordered two appetizers for his meal even though he only needed one and barley touched the other one. He ordered the buffalo blasts which were really yummy and he ordered the southern fried chicken sliders. The service was great and friendly as usual I had a great experience here.

Like any other cheesecake factory chains out there. Decent food, good portion sizes, decent service. However this location is in a huge mall so be prepared to wait between 30-45 minutes. Also parking is a bit limiting so circling the parking lot is part of the fun.
Drinks are tasty. Food is great. Avocado rolls and sauce are a must have. Service is always great. No complaints here.
Ate dinner at the new renovated Cheesecake Factory . Atmosphere is great and the service was better . Angel was attentive and sincere . Great experience !

They have terrible customer service. My partner tried calling them once and was on hold for 20 minutes trying to order a CAKE. Then I tried calling them MULTIPLE times and they declined it each time and wouldn&#39;t let me talk to them. Don&#39;t get me wrong their food is ok, but that is no way to treat any costumer!

I can&#39;t eat at places like this since I found out that the recipes are planned out to add as much fat, salt and sugar as possible thereby hitting all points on the tastebud compass. A slice of cheesecake for 1,800 calories? Since seeing that I compared it to my favorite, the decadent Junior&#39;s Cheesecake. The Lil Juniors in the supermarket which is 4oz, is 380 cal and NOT made to be diet or low cal at all. The novelty of Cheesecake Factory has worn off for me. Now its just packed, waaay too noisy and gigantic portions that often look like a ride at Disneyland rather than a meal.

A beautiful place that is horrible on every level without going into the details, just read through the reviews and make your own call. As for myself i will never recommend them again to anyone and will never step foot inside a ghetto fancy place like this. Super incompetant and super rude on every level from staff to the General manager Chris. You get what you pay for folks!
The food was great especially the cheese cake and if you go please shout out to my waiter who was great Dave

So I would only go here for the happy hour. The food and drinks are otherwise way over priced for what you get. Drinks are basically half off during happy hour. The food menu is great for a happy hour. They have a lot of selections. This place gets really busy so come a little early. They also have a skinny menu.

Came at 5 for an early dinner at happy hour. Service was slow, food was alright. Placed in the bar, which wasn&#39;t too kid friendly. Don&#39;t order the nachos: the chips were actually deep fried and way too greasy. Just &#34;meh&#34; overall. Usually I like it, but it not this

The quality of the food was poor at this location. I suspect there is lack of oversight in the kitchen.  After disappointing food, I looked through yelp and found a significant number of bad reviews for this place.  I think management needs to urgently get to the bottom of the problem and figure out why the food coming out of the kitchen isn&#39;t at  par with  other Cheesecake Factory restaurants.  The food feels un-fresh, not expertly cooked and flavors are off.

Happy hour, happy hour, happy hour! The price is right and so is the food. I never leave hungry as the portions are generous. The salads are tasty and the happy hour apps easily lend themselves to a full meal (order two and you will likely take home leftovers.)

Place was packed on a Sunday but that&#39;s to be expected. Wait wasn&#39;t bad at all. Service was steady. Food was on point. We had spicy buffalo chicken meatballs and they were awesome. Dinners were fantastic. Chicken Romano and tomato basil pasta worn grilled chicken were our entrees. Grabbed a cookie dough cheesecake to go. Will definitely be coming back.

Cheesecake Factory is probably my favorite commercial chain restaurant. Their food is great. Service is inconsistent which is why they get 3, not 4 stars. A must try is the chicken costelleta (sp?) comes with crispy chicken in a lemon cream sauce, asparagus and delicious mashed potatoes. Yummy!

I came here with 4 of my friends and am not that pleased.  I ordered the pasta campagna and it was my first tome trying it. It tasted better than it looked. It said that the tomato sauce was mildly spicy but it was not spicy at all and Im not the type of person who can handle spicy food that well. But it was still good. My two other friends ordered food with steak and there was barely any meat on the plate. It looked nothing like the pictures. Id say it was 50% rice 30% corn and 20% meat. Unbelievable. My other friend only got 4 pieces of meat. My other friends were satisfied with their dishes. While the dish was good none of us could finish it and i barely ate any of mine because the wait was literally so long. All of us starved ourselves for the day so we can eat good and choosing cheesecake was a mistake. The wait was so long we had to stuffed our mouths with the bread. Was not a pleasant experience at all.

My 4 star are ALL for my server the last time I was there- Maribely S. I loved her. She was the image of the perfect waitress- friendly, knowledgeable, attentive, and patient. Normally I wouldn&#39;t pay much attention to my meal at a place like The Cheesecake Factory, but our waitress really made the meal so enjoyable.<br><br>I was out with some coworkers and we were being ultra difficult, not being able to decide on drinks and food. Maribely was the nicest, most helpful server at a chain restaurant I&#39;ve ever encountered. She recommended the avocado egg rolls, which we all ended up loving, even though we don&#39;t generally like deep-fried anythings. I ended up getting some sort of fish tacos that I actually really enjoyed, on her suggestion.<br><br>I walked away very happy with my overall experience and would go back if I was in the area. It&#39;s conveniently located in a high end shopping center (there&#39;s a coffee bar and some comfortable couches around the mall), five minutes from endless other shopping options.

The Cheesecake Factory is a good option if you and your party aren&#39;t sure of what to eat. They have a gazillion page menu.  I love the Sheila&#39;s chicken salad, and the chicken club sandwich. Also, the brunch is awesome (lemon ricotta pancakes HELLO) - but skip the coffee. It sucks.<br><br>The service is a hit or miss. One visit you can get a great and attentive waiter, but on another visit your waiter can be not so attentive. I get it, it&#39;s a crazy big restaurant and it can get REALLY busy. <br><br>All in all, I&#39;m sure I&#39;ll be back.
What a disappointment.... I wish Cheesecake was at the other location... the service was better and the attitudes. It was one of my favorite places

Worst service ever. Was told the wait would 1 hr. turned out to be 1:20 mins.  We were a party of three. My wife dish came out first. 25 mins later mine came out.  When I complained as to why all the food was not brought out at the same time  he said &#34;we are not allowed to carry trays&#34;. When after 15 mins later and my daughter turkey sandwich still wasn&#39;t out, I complained again then the manager came out and said they had used the wrong bread. Really!!! It&#39;s regular white bread.  Waiter was terrible.  Manager did comp her meal but we will never go back. <br>BTW The table next to us walk out due to too many problems with their meals.

Like other Cheesecake Factory locations, they get very busy. They do not take reservations or call a heads so be prepared to wait if you come on a Saturday night. I came early to avoid the rush, and waited only about 20 minutes. The food was delicious as usual. I had the Cajun chicken littles, which is basically adult chicken fingers- I just wished they were spicier. My boyfriend had the ribeye, which was perfectly cooked. The drinks were tasty, but not very strong. I had the red sangria (11.50 a glass) and he had the pineapple Moscow mule (11.00 a glass). For dessert, I had the tiramisu which is fluffy and delicious. They offer cheesecake tiramisu and regular tiramisu. Normally I get the cheesecake one, but this time I decided to try the regular. They are both amazing!!!<br><br>Overall, I am never disappointed with the Cheesecake Factory
There is nothing negative I can say about Cheesecake Factory! Fabulous food and grand desserts! Love it!

I usually am not to fond of eating at franchise restaurants, however cheesecake is as good as it&#39;s going to get. The food and service are usually consistently good. Usually it doesn&#39;t really matter which restaurant you go to they are pretty much all the same.<br><br>Now with my experience, we started with a few apps. Some good choices are the crab and artichoke dip, buffalo blasters, and crab cakes. We all got different entrees but I like the steak, herb crusted salmon, and pastas are a pretty solid choice as well. This place has really huge portion which is usually a good thing but not always, so expect to be bringing something home.<br><br>Now regarding the deserts, where can you go wrong depending on your preference. You have two pages of assorted and unique cheesecakes to choose from. My two favorite are the Reese&#39;s and the Godiva cheesecakes. But keep in mind I am a chocolate and peanut butter lover!<br><br>Overall, good selection for lunch or dinner and you should have a decent to good experience here all the time.
One my favorite place , I love  the santa fe salad, and my strawberry martini  is best, great service and very clean definitely i recommenthis place .

Saturday night, around 8pm. Wait for a table of 2 was 15 minutes. We parked ourselves at the bar and our table was ready just as we got our drinks. <br><br>We were seated quickly towards the back. The waiter took our orders at the same time as the table next to ours. They got their food and were almost done when a manager stopped by to apologize for the kitchen backup. Our food took a while to come after that. We also ordered an app but they forgot about it, which is for the better anyways. <br><br>I love their savory food but the process of getting the food sucks. <br><br>I love the Chicken Madeira. Not a fan of cheesecake. <br><br>Weird note on the bread basket: some baskets have variety, some don&#39;t. What gives?

So went to cheesecake factory at Hackensack yesterday, must say it took 15 mins to find parking... with a baby we had to wait for 30 mins to get a table. We were lucky to sit while we were waiting and there were many seniors and kids waiting to sit before they got a table. When it&#39;s cold outside, restaurants need to give people some extra seating arrangements at least while waiting. Ordered kale quinoa salad and veggie melt sandwich with fresh tomato basil mozzarella flatbread app.<br><br>The Good: Veggie melt sandwich was heavenly. Even as I sit the next day I can feel the flavor calling my name. It was just rightly balanced with lots of veggies and less cheese. The toast on it was crunchy and you can hear that if you run a knife on it. Rustic and Awesome!!<br><br>The Fair: our TBM flatbread was too good to look at (artistic and all)... however one bite and I knew someone had gone overboard with salt. Surprisingly the hubby was ok with extra salt, so, mheh... who cares for skinnylicious qpp having more sodium :p<br><br>The Ugly: the so called super salad was horrible. First it was like someone just threw torn kale on a plate. Then inspecting a bit I could see quinoa. The taste was not right. Basically kale is a bit bitter so instead of making a salad with a hint of kale for bitterness, the entire dish was bitter. Cut grapes here and there helped a bit but once there were no more grapes left, it became inedible. The waiter was great to get me extra bread to cleanse the bitterness from my pallet.<br><br>So all in all, it was an average experience. Might come back here just for the veggie melt.

My family would make the trip to this mall at least monthly many years ago. If you live in NYC and want to eat at Cheesecake Factory this used to be the closest location. We also like the feel of home we would get from shopping in a Mall such as this one. <br>Like most reviews say, it is higher end stores. I like the Barnes and Noble location. You can always find gifts in there.<br>During the time we went to this mall it was undergoing renovation. It has now become very luxurious inside. The tile floors and glass roofing are great. I love the seating area. When you shop until you drop you can sit down to rest comfortably in the mall. <br>The reason we don&#39;t shop here any longer involves the transportation. In Winter. We had to wait in the cold on the highway for the bus to and from NYC. I remember one day climbing over huge piles of snow to cross the highway to get the bus back to NY. I can&#39;t tell you how many times we would be flagging the bus down as it passed us by. It became to much trouble and unsafe to be out on the highway.  <br>Someone told us about Park and Ride and the bus going to the Mall in Wayne. We started going to Willowbrook Mall. It is much easier to access from NYC.<br>I often wonder if they started providing bus transportation to and from their parking lot. An over hang with protection during inclement weather would be nice at The Riverside Shops. <br>If you don&#39;t live nearby, or own a car keep this in mind when you go.  Maybe if enough people express an interest they will help us by providing this service. I would certainly like to return to Hackensack for a visit.<br>The food and service were always great at this CCF. I miss going there!

I often come there for happy hour after work on some Fridays. The bar is always crowed but the service is good. <br><br>The quality of the mixed drinks depends on who is making it. Over the course  of a few years, one tends to know who will make a proper margarita and who&#39;s just serving lime juice. <br><br>The happy hour menu is tasty, affordable and great portion size. We have come for dinner here but I prefer to stick to their happy hour options.<br><br>The cheese cakes are super delicious, tons of options and never that a bad experience. The dinner menu has a lot of food that isn&#39;t to my liking but my husband seems to not mind it.<br><br>The staff are always friendly and courteous and that what keeps us coming back.

The ambiance was nice and the servers were friendly and helpful.<br><br>My factory burger was good, but I don&#39;t think I would order it again - the baguette was a little hard to bite through. I think it was an interesting bun choice that didn&#39;t work for a burger in my opinion.

I&#39;m a veggie lover!! I could eat veggies all day everyday! They have amazing salads here (if you&#39;re into that) this is the place to go. All their food is good but their salad options are top notch!

Kale salad (very good!! Would be better without the raisins)<br>Calamari and texmex are great appetizers but will make u full.<br>Chicken madeira (most popular meal) tasted incredible, so did the pan-seared salmon and chipotle linguini.  <br>Spicy Chicken cashew was amazing too!<br>Banana cheescake lovely!<br><br>Service and ambience were outstanding.<br>Next time I wouldnt order appetizers to enjoy my main meal fully.

I&#39;m going to keep this short because my real review will be going to corporate but yesterday night I had a terrible experience with this Cheesecake Factory and I didn&#39;t even dine in. I was kept waiting for over 20 minutes on the phone to place the order and over 30 minutes for my food once I was there because my order was non existent. It is clear that there is poor management (who I directly spoke to) and staff: It is far more understanding to hear a manager take responsibility on behalf of the staff than to justify the problem with different excuses in a rude manner. This location is a hot mess. <br>In addition, the specific order that the manager took himself was incorrect.

Delicious food and great service; I have yet to order a dish that I haven&#39;t enjoyed. The lighting is a bit dim for my liking, but overall the atmosphere is nice. I recommend the crab cakes as an appetizer, and thoroughly enjoyed the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp dish as a main course. Their chicken and biscuit dish was yummy as well. Of course, the highlight of the restaurant was the dessert - cheesecake. My favorite still has got to be the original cheesecake, but I also enjoy the Oreo cheesecake and red velvet cheesecake. <br>Downsides: <br>- long wait (can range from 10 minutes to 2 hours) <br>- it&#39;s a bit pricey <br><br>Would still recommend to a friend, however.
Very good food, used to go to the old location alot. The new location has different people and the service just isnt that great anymore. Needs better service

My go to restaurant, great foot at affordable price, awesome drinks and the wait staff are always on point! Wouldn&#39;t hurt for the hostesses to be more friendly, that&#39;s the only reason for 4 stars. Cheesecake is the best place to eat in that mall! Try the red velvet cheesecake!

I LOVE there cheesecake, if i could live off of it forever i would. There food is okay i do like it, but there are times when I will go strictly to get the Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Cheesecake!! It is amazing if you have not had the cheesecake here you are seriously missing out! It&#39;s pricey but it is really good so if you haven&#39;t you gotta go!
I was the best Host to ever grace that floor, and the first and only to get a Yelp review
