Done with this place, even within their new location nothing has been improved. Tight sitting areas where you can barely hear because your so close others. Also, botched our steak dinners. We order medium cooked steaks and it came out well done. Very disappointed.

This is the best Cheesecake  Factory.  I have been to others but this is far the best.  The GM is awesome and friendly  .his staff is nice.  The food is great and the service  is great.  There Location  is good.  The wait time was not bad at all.

This is probably the worst service we have experienced in a while. The waiter was inattentive, too slow, got the wrong order and unapologetic. I love their food but the service makes me never want to come back.

This is a review of a slice of banana cream pie cheesecake I picked up from here. I think the fact that I was compelled to write a review about a piece of cake speaks volumes about how good it was. But it wasn&#39;t just good, it was unbelievable. Ordering that slice of cheesecake was one of the best decisions I ever made in my life. I&#39;ve made a couple good ones over the years, but I am particularly proud of this specific one. <br><br>Now to the cake. I&#39;ve never had cheesecake that was so rich and moist. Each bite was heavenly. The crust at the bottom had a soft and crumbly texture that was also really good. The banana creme had a great texture and tasted like a creamy banana. The cake was served with a generous portion of sliced bananas and whipped cream. No joke, I ate this thing for three days--savoring every bite. OK this is getting weird.

ugh we were waiting for our food for like 20 min and then our waiter shalissa walked bh and we asked if he had our food and he said &#34;a few more minutes &#34; me and my sister were traumatized and heartbroken

I had to wait 1 hour for tacos... Ask to pack my salad and they throw it away... Waiter didn&#39;t even bother to say sorry was a mistake, instead she just didn&#39;t come back to the table. We order cheese cakes and she took almost 20 minutes to bring it to the table. <br>2 and a half in a restaurant is just absurd.<br>Been here before and I never had to experience such a delayed specially a Monday night that was NOT busy.

Went with my guest for lunch today.  We were seated within 10 minutes as promised by the lovely ladies up front.  Then it went down the hill from there.  There was a party of high numbers of people on the side of the restaurant we were at; so all the waiters/waitresses paid attention to that party.  We waited for 20 minutes and nobody said anything or approached us to service us.  Not even to say hello.  When the front lady who seated up passed by, I inquired with her about a service.  A few minutes later, she came back to check only to find that no one had attended to us yet.  So she called someone and finally a waiter showed up.  He quickly apologized and stated that it wasn&#39;t his responsibility.  He took our order, left and came back with our drinks.  The lovely cheesecake brown bread was not offered.  I grabbed a passing by waitress who purposely ignored us and quickly ran toward another guest.  So I had to ping the front desk lady again.  She profusely apologized and came back with bread and butter.  By this time 15 minutes from the time of ordering had passed.  We waited a few more minutes.  I honestly lost count but hey, at least we were no longer starving.  Our waiter came back to let us know that food would be coming out shortly.  After dropping off our food, he never came back to check.  By this time, my guest had run out of her drinks.  We had to quickly stopped our waiter while he was in flight to another customer, or else my guest may have died of thirst... lol... (I slowly sipped my water because I know it was a rare commodity this time around ...) when we were finally done, I asked for the bill.  I don&#39;t think our waiter heard me.  Another 15 minutes went by ... I decided to go to the restroom and hunted our waiter down to pay for the bill.  Given the amount of times of me getting up and chasing after employees at this restaurant, I&#39;m sure that the calories from the meal I had will not stay too long.  Hopefully, this experience will help me loose weight in preparation of the holidays.  We left our waiter 15% tips because we&#39;re not savages. Disappointing experience? Yes... and we&#39;ve been coming to this restaurant and/or it&#39;s subsidiary (grand luxe cafe) for years.
If they put as much energy into seating people as they did making sure my 7 month pregnant wife didn&#39;t sit at one of their 20 empty tables, maybe they wouldn&#39;t have a 30 minute wait.

Other than the wait during weekends and night time, this place is awesome. There is a large selection of food and the service is almost always great. Most entrees are huge! The Bistro Shrimp Pasta is one of my favorites.

You know you are going to have the cheesecake, the only hard part 1) where are you going to put it after all the delectable and large portions of  food that somehow made it from the plate to your piehole and 2) which perhaps the hardest part... which cheesecake do you pick?!! I mean they only have like 50 something options to choose from, enough to make your eyes cross and your heart swoon.  (Note just like I don&#39;t count the calorie content, I have never actually counted the # of varieties so don&#39;t hold me to fact checking) <br><br>Pro&#39;s<br>Service was great.<br>Standard Cheesecake factory fare. <br><br>Con: <br>Only sad thing is they stopped making the thai chicken pasta :-(. <br>Always good  food but don&#39;t ever look at the calories and if you&#39;re diabetic take your insulin before you come. (They do have a healthy options menu...but I haven&#39;t ever brought myself to ordering it. It just seems wrong.)<br><br>Overall:<br>Big portions, come hungry and leave for lunch for tomorrow.  I got lucky and have something sweet to wake up to tomorrow.  Gluttony at its best.

I love Cheesecake Factory But They have the worst to go service that you can imagine and if you order via dordash worse! Don&#39;t do it! Tonight I order the Thai chicken lettuce And they didn&#39;t put the chicken and the sauces either!! I put my complaint on doordash and what they told me is that the cheescake factory can refund me $ 17 to spend at the restaurant! but this is not what matters! I&#39;m pregnant and I waste 1 hour and 15 minutes waiting for my dinner and the cheesecake factory sends me the incomplete dish! they must have more respect for the clients and look at the orders well before taking them out!

Ordered from Cheesecake Factory thru door dash.  Cheesecake Factory screwed up the entire order.  They were notified of food allergies and ignored them.  The food was not prepared correctly, items were missing and some items were only half orders.  Then the restaurant had the nerve to blame the delivery service.  I will never go to this restaurant again.  Wish I could zero stars unfortunately the rating system does not allow for it.

I went there with my wife and 4yr old son looking for a good meal.  We have eaten there numerous times with great service and food.  Tonight was not the case, got a table right away surprised that happened usually there is a way time. We sit and our waiter is helping every one else except us. No greeting for us no bread no water no explanation that maybe he will be back to help us. Then he takes drink orders of family seated after us they get drinks and bread and we get nothing. Then he checked at another table to see if they good was good. At that point we were done we decided it was time to leave as we were leaving he looked at us and said nothing. We are not going back sad to see service like that at Cheesecake Factory. This happened today at around 7:20 pm.

The Cheese Cake Factory, especially this one in particular has been around for a while and I have to say it has yet to disappoint me...<br><br>Pros:<br><br>The food is A+ as well as their drinks.<br><br>(I normally order their avocado rolls &amp; margaritas)<br><br>Their staff are always on point and attentive.<br><br>Their menu has a lot to offer.<br><br>Great for dining solo, date nights, happy hour etc..<br><br>Cons:<br><br>Parking can be an issue sometimes but it&#39;s  totally worth the wait.<br><br>- I highly recommend this Cheesecake Factory ~

Came here at around 930 PM and the greeter told us the wait time would be twenty minutes but we were seated in less than ten. Our server, Angel, was very polite and checked in multiple times throughout the course of the meal and made it an overall very enjoyable experience. Will definitely be coming back for more.

Went to this location for lunch and it wasn&#39;t all that bad. It didn&#39;t take much time to be seated 5-10 minutes, and the staff was very welcoming and nice. <br>Once we were seated and ordered drinks the waiter asked us if we were ready to order right away, which I have never had done at a restaurant usually they wait a couple of minutes before asking.<br>We all ordered burgers and they were cooked the way we ordered and all the food seemed fresh, the only complaint I had would be with the fries, some of them were hard as rock, which isn&#39;t very appetizing. <br>Also towards the end it took the waiter a long time before coming to ask if we were done. We were waiting for him for about 20 minutes. <br>Besides those issues this location is pretty good, fairly clean but could be a bit better, would go again if I had the time.

There&#39;s always a long wait to get seating which is to be expected, and the food is on the pricier end, but everything is always SO good and we always have things to bring home because the portions are huge, which makes up for the price.<br><br>Seating is a little packed but the staff is always welcoming and friendly, constantly checking up on us to make sure everything is going well.

I love coming here. Their caesar salads are very rich and delicious. The smaller size could still feed more than one person. I usually get a salad with chicken as my main meal, but I decided to try the four cheese pasta the other day and it was pretty good. Their food is always well-presented.

I love cheesecake and never really pay too much mind to the service because I always know what I want so it&#39;s not much interaction. But today I came for lunch and had ANGEL as a server and he is phenomenal! Definitely stood out and hope to have him again the next time! The Louisiana pasta btw is to die for!

Worst experience in a restaurant in my life. I ordered a burger and as I was eating it I feel something odd in my mouth. I reach in my mouth and I put out a stiff black metal wire! How terrible and scary is that? I was shocked. I immediately stopped eating and told the waitress who took the plate and got the manager. The manager came to the table with the wire in his hands and said it from the brush they use to clean the grill. He said he&#39;s sorry and walked off. Like it&#39;s no big deal. That could have caused tremendous bodily harm, like cutting my tongue, mouth, cheeks, stuck in my throat, stomach, intestines, etc. It was metal so it&#39;s not going to dissolve in the body. I&#39;m concerned I might have eaten and swallowed a smaller piece of wire without noticing. My throat is bothering since eating there and I got very sick after eating at this location which ruined my night and took me days to recover. The stress and anxiety of thinking another piece of metal wire is stuck in my throat has been terrible. Can you believe they didn&#39;t even comp my meal or even offer a free drink, something. So I paid and left, I was so furious. I called corporate told them what happened, they said they would call me back. No one has called me back. This location has terrible management and the company doesn&#39;t care about its customers as is evident by their lack of response to such a serious incident. Stay away from this place, I regret ever going. Never again.

What made our experience exceptional was our server Brittany k. I work in the food industry and her personality comes one in a million. She was not overbearing nor fake. Her genuine friendly attitude really made our experience an amazing one. <br><br>She paced our meals perfectly. Food was mediocre but I didn&#39;t even notice. <br><br>Request Brittany k, I bet my life you will have an enjoyable dining experience.

Really enjoyed meal here early on Sat night. Avocado egg rolls were delicious as shared appetizer. I had grilled pork chop which was perfectly cooked. My wife had shrimp with pasta that she really enjoyed. Big portion size and decent service in a busy night. Good value for food.

This one is massive. Service is mediocre but I never had a terrible experience here. Their strawberry shortcake is always delightful.<br><br>I really like their veggie burger - it&#39;s ingredients are very different compared to any veggie burger I&#39;ve ever had.<br><br>I tried the Louisiana pasta tonight and it really did blow away my expectations. Well seasoned, not drowned in sauce and there was a lot of chicken, very well proportioned to the amount of pasta there (and I ordered take out!) I suggest trying it. <br><br>It&#39;s a chain, just keep those expectations in mind.

I don&#39;t know if this was a fluke or did i just become a fan of the factory. Guacamole was fresh and well seasoned, although the chips tasted old and stale. The guac was too damn good to care as i shoved it in my mouth with anything on the table. i didn&#39;t know what i wanted to i opted for the cup of soup, half sandwich and salad dish. The cream of mushroom soup was full of mushroom flavor and had a nice texture. The sandwich was turkey and cheese which was toped with a  beautiful ripe tomato and then I slapped some of that guac on it and DAMN!! That just happened!!!... The caesar was cold, creamy and tasted exactly what i had in my mind. Service was average and the place was filled with a bunch of weirdos but i really enjoyed the food and will be back for this combo again.

Normally we have a good experience but today was awful. Our food took way too long to arrive. When it did, the order was wrong. My husband had to send his order back twice. My meal was not cooked correctly. The manager came to see us when my husband&#39;s order came out the second time incorrectly. However, he was not at all accommodating. Nor did he offer an apology for the mistake the second time. The waiter was missing in action for most of the meal, to the point where we had to get up and locate him as well as get our own olive oil for the salad we ordered. He did not even ask us if we wanted dessert or coffee before bringing us the check. Overall a really disappointing experience.

One of my go to places for salad. The salad are generous portions for the price and always filled with amazing flavors. I never second guess my order even if I try something new because I know it will be amazing.

This was only my 2nd time at a Cheesecake Factory and it was satisfactory. It was pretty busy for a Sunday at lunchtime but we were seated right away.  I ordered the huevos rancheros and they were horrible. There must have been an entire can of black beans on the bottom of the plate and then tortillas and VERY runny eggs on top. I like my eggs over easy but these must have been in the griddle for 10 whole seconds.  The salsa and avocado on top made the meal edible.  The tortillas were completely soggy. Next time I&#39;ll just order a simple sandwich. <br><br>My friend ordered the skinnilicous (sp?) chicken tacos and she really enjoyed them and wanted more (hence the 3 star rating). I was so disappointed by my slop of a meal I didn&#39;t bother ordering a piece of cheesecake.

I only come here now to get a slice of cheesecake for my husband. They are way to crowded for my liking. I used to like their orange chicken but I guess they changed cooks and it is mediocre now to say the least.. their cheesecake is great but they give u a smaller slice now with the famous chocolate cake they have. Also the girl who is the cashier in the front for the cheesecakes has the nastiest attidude I&#39;ve ever seen. She&#39;s a heavy set Caucasian girl and is absolutely rude. Asking for more whip cream is like asking for $100 to her I guess- u should see the way she looks at u. Other than that this location is ok.

I went to The Cheesecake Factory tonight was very disappointed with the food and the waitress service the food came out very cold.<br><br>The waitress was not attentive whatsoever did not come by and asked if we wanted anything while we were waiting nor when we got food asked us if we wanted anything else refills on our cold drinks or cocktails did not bring out any kind of condiments when going up to the manager of the restaurant explaining what went on she did not do any kind of compensation on the bill or to buy us a cup of coffee or dessert very disappointing on this manager do not recommend this place to anybody for poor mismanagement and poor service and food quality coming out cold prices were high especially from Cheesecake Factory which is nothing special whatsoever which has dim lighting where you can&#39;t even see the food menu which is horrible you don&#39;t even know what you are ordering and less use your cell phone to see their menu very sad maybe they were thinking you&#39;re on a romantic date LOL but how can you be a romantic date when they have music cranking when you can&#39;t even hear yourself think it&#39;s so loud very poor establishment do not recommend whatsoever 1 stars from me<br>Dan H
Don&#39;t ever come here for brunch. The food really bad. They are so cheap that they don&#39;t even give you maple syrup for your waffle.

I&#39;ve been coming here for years and I am satisfied every time! The food is great, and I&#39;ve sampled the whole menu. The service is great and if there&#39;s ever an issue, management is so great in helping solve issues and/or making you happy

We did my sons birthday party here. Meal was OK but Ribeye steak is literally terrible. It was dry, thin and I received well done instead of medium rare. The reason for 4 stars still is a great service by Novell who didn&#39;t charge us for teas and Birthday cake as well because of steak. She is very kind and caring.
This place is the best. We got seated right away, the waiter was good, and the food was phenomenal. I recommend the Imperial chicken and shrimp to everyone.
The food is pretty good. Recommend the buffalo blasts. Wait time is a little long sometimes, even when the order is just a drink or appetizer.
This is literally where I always go on my time off. I love their pasta and cocktails. Greats service long wait at the door.
Do not recommend pasta dishes. The sauce was watery. The mozzarella appetizer was not good either. I should have stuck to the salads.

I&#39;ve been loving this Cheesecake Factory for years. Let me put it another way - since the Thai Lettuce Wrap app was $9.99, but is now $12.99. That&#39;s awhile. <br><br>To fully appreciate the Cheesecake Factory you need to follow a few tips: <br><br>1) Sit in the bar area - it&#39;s less noisy and crowded, has more efficient service, and TVs for sports. 2) The menu is humongous, so let your server help - figure out what you&#39;re in the mood for and let the server make recommendations. You&#39;ll save lots of time and energy. 3) Portions are large, so share apps and don&#39;t eat all of your meal - otherwise you won&#39;t have room for cheesecake. 4) Get cheesecake! But first carefully look over your options by going to the cheesecake display counter and fully peruse the selections. It&#39;s life changing. Then consult the expert - your server. It really helps. You&#39;ll learn stuff. <br><br>If you follow these simple tips you&#39;ll have a fun, enjoyable, entertaining, tasty, interesting, and fulfilling dining experience. If you don&#39;t you&#39;ll over eat and feel stuffed, uncomfortable, have no room for cheesecake (but you&#39;ll get it and eat it anyway) and then you&#39;ll fall asleep in your car and get in trouble with your wife, husband, girlfriend, boyfriend and/or weight watcher group leader. GO THERE! but follow the rules. You&#39;ll all be thanking me later :-)

I finally had the opportunity to check out the new location and it&#39;s nicley done interior.  The wait was about 25 min but the host was very friendly and made time go by with a polite conversation. All my food came out in a timely manor and was spot on.

I&#39;ve been to many of the cheesecake factories and this is the one with terrible service. They do NOT listen at all. My order ALWAYS comes out wrong and they take forever. <br>This location has the worst service possible. Even at the bar it&#39;s terrible. I sat at the bar with my husband and still it took forever for a drink. The bartenders look like they rolled in the dumpster and then came to work. They do not smile at all. <br>It&#39;s called a CUSTOMER SERVICE position, which requires to have a smile. <br>This place needs to train their servers and bartenders to have better service and to make sure there are no mistakes on customers orders.
As large as the menu is. It&#39;s  incredible that every item on the menu is delicious. Looooooove Cheese Cake Factory

I&#39;ve been here many times and this is the worst experience I&#39;ve ever had. The server, Damar, was very rude and immediately judged us for being young adults wanting 6 separate checks. I&#39;m a server in a very busy restaurant and always get guests to ask me for separate checks and that&#39;s the way of life. He mentioned getting a bigger tip if he does that. Very disrespectful and judgmental. Also, our food came out different from how it&#39;s came many times before. The chicken bellagio came with no arugula, there was only one piece of chicken and the cream sauce was extremely overpowering. Our waters were empty for a while. My friends wine glass was sitting empty the entire time while she had another glass. Our food took 4 minutes to come out all together. I still tipped normally because I know what they get get hourly, but he did not deserve any of it.

Ok for a bizarrely large assortment of comfort food and ridiculously sized portions. Leftovers could provide food for two more meals. The music is way too loud to be comfortable, and I can live without the top 70&#39;s classic rock. Something more varied and substantial would be better. That said, it is a reliable place to find the average.

Atrocious.  This is a high priced diner with awful food and terrible service.  Multiple requests for bread, only to arrive an hour after seating. <br>Filet mignon ($30) arrived moo-ing. No offer to comp.  Even after it went back to oven while everyone else was done with meal. Still not cooked properly.<br><br>Shrimp overdone.<br><br>Service and management unresponsive.   Wanted to know if we were interested in dessert.  If dinner was this awful, and took over an hour to arrive, why would we be interested in dessert?<br>Safe your money and head to a diner.

Always a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. Their menu can be quite overwhelming, but I usually stick to what I like anyway... Their prices are decent and their portions are HUGE. There&#39;s always a wait at Cheesecake Factory, so get here early or plan on waiting. They have happy hour at the bar with cheap plates and drinks!<br><br>Here are my favorites:<br>Appetizer: Avocado Egg Rolls / Buffalo Blast<br>Salad: Luau Salad<br>Sandwich: Turkey Burger<br>Pasta: Bellagio<br>Entree: Chicken Lettuce Wraps<br>Drink: Skinny Mojito<br>Cheesecake: Vanilla Bean

I try to avoid chain restaurants in general but my fiancée and I were looking for a place to grab a drink after shopping and this was the only bar with open seats at the Shops at Riverside.<br>   The beer my date ordered was tapped out so he got something else, no big deal, but still annoying. I ordered a skinny sangria, which tasted fine and I would get again. FYI it was in a wine glass, not a giant goblet or anything, so we were a little surprised to see one beer and one sangria cost us $26 with tip, definitely not worth it in my opinion.<br>    The major issue was actually that the entire bar smelled really gross, like dirty wet rags. It was not the nice night cap we were looking for, it was overpriced and smelly. Definitely not recommended.

Went here for dinner with the family. Our waitress Valarie did a horrible job of taking our orders. She butchered and forgot the details of our order (ex: dressing on the side). When we brought it up with her she called over the manager insisting she was correct and we were wrong. When the manager came (Josh), he mentioned the discrepancies happened in the kitchen &#34;because it was a busy night&#34;. Busy or not, the service was non existent. Valerie and Josh both proved to be unprofessional. Definitely will be avoiding this location moving forward.

One of my absolute favorite places to go to! Drinks are fab and every single dish i have ever ordered has never failed! All are great! Wings, avocado rolls (apps) buffalo chicken blasts, calamari, the jamaican shrimp dish, chicken and biscuits, louisiana chicken pasta dish, all salads and cheesecakes are delish!<br><br>Note: if you dont like crowded, noisy places then you may want to try this place during the week because it gets very crowded weekends and wait is quite long around dinnertime.

I came in for lunch and decided to sit at the bar since I was alone and like the interaction with the bartender.  The moment I sat down the bartender welcomed me and asked if I wanted something to drink.  After that he asked if I was going to dine in which I said yes he put down a setting.  The order was taken and the food came out in under five minutes.  The food was good and my glass of water was never left empty as I kept getting refills.  Overall this was a good experience and I&#39;ll be back.
The service is still good, but either the buns are getting a lot bigger or the hamburger patties are shrinking. And I&#39;m pretty sure the bun size hasn&#39;t changed, so......

After a long day with family we decided to check out the Cheesecakes new location in Riverside Square Mall. After sitting down we ordered a round of drinks. One of the girls in our party asked to have the house espresso martini with baileys (theirs is only coffee and vodka) the waiter explained that he would have to charge her for a shot of baileys and the full martini price (which would have been a $22 martini, and obviously not the right way to ring it up) and we said fine, just because she really wanted it. Drinks come out and the girls martini was more coffee/no baileys and was unhappy with it, because we specifically asked to have baileys in it, not more coffee. We send it back and in return she looked to receive what she wanted. After tasting it we realized it was straight baileys. She didn&#39;t want to complain and just drank it. When the waiter came around I politely asked what was the martini. He said baileys chilled. So after explaining the up-charge to us he brings a martini with extra coffee, then just straight Baileys and blames it on the bartenders. Everyone orders a second round except the one girl because her experience was already ruined. She orders a water. About 15 minutes go by and we only receive one drink and no food. The one drink that comes out is a baileys straight up in a martini glass. Haha has to be some kind of sick joke. We get the waiter and politely explain no food or drinks, except this baileys martini that no one ever wanted. He now blames the kitchen on the food. A minute later our over cooked food from being under a heat lamp shows up, except our chips and guacamole. Still no drinks. I stop the waiter and he can see that things aren&#39;t going good, so he immediately offers a manager. Manager comes over in a very condescending tone, blaming that they cut a bartender and having issues in the kitchen, and giving credit to the lackluster server. Meanwhile still no drinks. Manager explains he will go to the kitchen to see what&#39;s going on and will come back with our drinks (and we now see our drinks sitting on the bar). Manage comes back 5 minutes later and While our manager is talking our drinks now show up, except the poor girls water, and missing another persons drink. Manager asks is there anything else he can do. And we said yes, can we get her a water. Water never comes out. (Manager can&#39;t even handle a water order?!) Waiter is now hiding from us. I had to get the waiters attention for the water, and the other girls drink. After finishing the second round our drinks sat empty for 15 minutes. Now our meal is forced to be over because we can&#39;t even receive service. We receive our check and there is two baileys rocks$ martini charges, which is basically 4 shots, even though the request was for one shot! At first it seemed to be a simple mistake but progressed into a disaster. Nothing was done to ensure a better evening. I always enjoyed Cheesecake Factory, but this will be the last time I go there and will be liquidating my stock in the company tomorrow. This meal happened at 6/12/18 at 9:00 pm, high tops in the bar.

I mean is the food good? Yeah, but every time I come here (which is a lot) is get the chicken Caesar salad (because who doesn&#39;t love a good Caesar) and I always ask for without croutons. Nothing against the Cheesecake Factory croutons I hate them everywhere equally. And every time they still put the croutons on it. Yesterday I took my grandma out for her birthday and I didn&#39;t want to complain to the waiter on her special day so I let it slide, but this is the THIRD time it&#39;s happened to me and it&#39;s getting a little ridiculous. Are the salads premade or something that everyone puts them on anyway? My waiter tried to explain that it&#39;s because they see Caesar salad and they just made it without looking at the &#34;no whatever&#39;s&#34; someone may ask for. I&#39;m really not one to complain at ALL because I work in food as well and I know how annoying it is but at the end of the day it&#39;s the point that I did ask for it without and still got it with. I know it&#39;s just croutons but I hate them. I ended up just picking them out for  what felt like 10 minutes...

I feel like a Cheesecake Factory shouldn&#39;t deserve 4 stars. But the reality is, they have good food, it&#39;s reliable, and safe, and it&#39;s definitely better than 3 stars.<br><br>They have a ridiculously extensive menu. The portions are large. People should probably share more instead of ordering a dish each. If you eat here on the regular, you will probably also become large.<br><br>My favs:<br>BBQ Ranch Salad<br>Louisiana Chicken<br>Jambalaya<br><br>Negatives: The quality of the bread. I am pretty sure their bread used to be fresher and of a better quality a number of years ago. The sourdough is usually ok, but that honey oat bread frequently comes out flat and dense. It also sometimes seemed reheated instead of baked fresh.<br><br>Servers are usually great and hustling.

Greeting- yes<br>Vibe- mad hatter<br>Service- good<br>Bathrooms- Pass<br>Parking- free lot<br>Price- moderate<br>Food<br>Big salads $15 mostly lettuce. <br>Turkey burger tastes weird, would not get it again<br>Good potato fries<br>Blackout chocolate cake very good<br>WIGB? Yes<br><br>Overtime the CCF has cut back on its main ingredients. Portions have reduced in size and prices have increased. It&#39;s not as great a place as it used to be. The desserts are still the standouts.

I&#39;m not very at ease to write a negative review but the way you&#39;re received when you call them is very disappointing for this kind of place. I spotted that they don&#39;t get reservation but the way to tell it and the way they let you understand that you have an accent is really bad. My conclusion, they don&#39;t really need new customers.

Chicken Katsui tastes awesome as well as Godiva cheesecake. The wait was a bit ridiculous, so can&#39;t give it a better rating until they start taking reservations. They should at least adopt a mobile approach like California Pizza Kitchen where they just text you when your table  is almost ready so you can roam the mall in the meantime.<br><br>Update.... I&#39;m really sad the chicken katsui as been taken off the menu.<br><br>Don&#39;t order the tiramisu... a subpar tiramisu shouldn&#39;t run you ~$10. Order a Chris&#39; Outrageous cheesecake instead.

Food is great. Love coming here for their mushroom soup and French Country Salad. HOWEVER, DO NOT ORDER OVER THE PHONE. You will be ON HOLD FOREVER! One time I was on for 15 minutes!! They need better service desperately when it comes to take out

Always good to come here for a lunch with one of my girlfriends to catch up. The lunch menu is slightly cheaper but still has generous portions. I ordered the Asian Pear Martini and Louisiana Chicken pasta for lunch. If you like pasta and a little spice and extra kick, go for it. Then we had cappuccinos for dessert.

I love the orange chicken here but the service here is not one of my favorites. I&#39;m. Customer service queen so if on more than one occasion I&#39;m not a priority of the staff, then Ill pass on returning. Today I ending up here craving orange chicken but didn&#39;t want to wait so I decided to order to go. The lady told me the food should take 15 minutes. After 15 minutes I asked how much longer, and she didn&#39;t know. 8 minutes later I asked the same question she then told me to have a seat and she&#39;ll bring it to me when it&#39;s ready. I waited 40 mins total.

Every visit here is a great one.  The menu is so plentiful, you don&#39;t know where to begin.  We went w the stuffed mushrooms for starters.  Although there on the small plate appetizer page, you get 6.  My friend and I shared, and it was perfect. For my entree I had chicken &amp; biscuits. It&#39;s grilled chicken breast, mashed potato, and the flakiest, most delicious biscuits you&#39;ve ever had, all smothered together in thick gravy. Need I say more! Comfort food at its best!! Drinks are always great here. I usually go w the mojitos, which come in a variety of flavors. Cheesecake Factory will always be on my top 5 list! おいしい  おいしい

The food is usually good here, but I have to share my last experience. My wife had 2 gift cards that I received through work. She tried to use them recently and was told that 1 card had a 0 balance. <br>She was embarrassed as we had just received the cards in the mail. She paid the balance in cash and we called the distribution company the next day. After several emails and calls the Cheesecake Factory refused to honor the card and said that it was used the day they refused to honor it. I am not sure if it was the waitress or computer, but someone got our money. <br>Not returning in my lifetime.

Slow service, a bit disorganized. Very unenthusiastic staff, and food and desserts are not proportional to price. Compared to other locations, same chain- this is an inadequate representation of other restaurants. Going to grand luxe at garden state plaza next time instead.

The food was very good actually I had the filet mignon and the dulce de leche cheesecake. The food was truly mouth watering. Steak was deliciously savory and the cheesecake was so sweet, perfect for my tastebuds. The reason for subtracting one star is that the waiter was so busy it took him so long just to get us our drinks other than that every else was beautiful. Very nice, very nice

We have gone for dinner at this location a couple times now where they have messed up our dinner or forgot something. Last night, our waitress seemed to be in such a hurry to get our order, and guess what, it was wrong again. We will start to try other spots locally before coming back.

We came to cheesecake for dinner and I know it&#39;s pretty crowded and busy but still wanted to come. We ordered our appetizer and it came in a timely fashion as well as our drinks. Unfortunately, when it came to our entree it was a complete disaster. It took forever for the food to come out. Our waitress didn&#39;t even bother come by to give us an update. She passed us by so many times and didn&#39;t make contact with us. Finally after 40 mins or so our entree came and it was cold. We told our waitress and she just offered to take it back and warm it up. After 15mins or so the manager came and clearly he didn&#39;t care. Again, just offered to warm up the food or give us a warm sauce to pour over. At the end we got the bill and never saw the manager again not even to apologize or see how the rest of the meal went. It&#39;s very disorganized and the staff seemed not to care, which really sucks because the food can be pretty good. I don&#39;t think I will come back to this location.

Love the caesar salad, A+ on service and food temperature, food was served hot.  Would recommend going 2hrs before closing time, atmosphere at that time is like the hallway seen in the movie Drive(2011).  You remember!?  When Carey Mulligan(Irene) sat with Ryan Gosling in their hallway after her ex-boyfriend returned home from jail.  Anyway, I had a great food loving time, yummy.

Not worth the $70 bill we got AT ALL. The chicken Alfredo- one note, one color. I couldn&#39;t believe it. I thought it was a mistake. No green garnish, no tomatoe, watery cheese sauce, just all white pasta and cheese. Extremely bland cheese at that. So bad that I couldn&#39;t make myself eat the whole thing. I just ate the chicken. <br><br>For $19.50, higher than most places,  I was pissed. The Passion Fruit ice tea had no passion. I don&#39;t know how they made it but it was VERY bitter and had no fruit taste at all. Had to put about 6-8 packs of sugar to get it to taste somewhat good but then got a s u gar rush to the head after 3 packs. So headache, bad dinner, stomach ache. The cheese and bacon tots tasted terrible. There was creamy, watery cheese inside :-( My husband&#39;s fries were stiff and practically stale. The carrot cake is dry, doesn&#39;t use the traditional icing. Moreso got strings of carrots and nuts than cake batter. :-(<br><br>Only good thing: Lemonade, mozzarella appetizer, cheeseburger. Serve and hostess was good and very polite.<br><br>Verdict: absolutely will not waste my money here again. I could do better at a local pizza shop- True Story! And pay only $22 for everything.

Today we went to your Riverside Square location in Hackensack, NJ for a quick dinner.  After being seated we waited 30 minutes and not one of your servers came to our table to even offer water.  During that wait we asked a bus boy clearing the table to get a waiter.  We then watched him stand and talk to see real waiters and still no one came to our table.  At that point we got up, informed the hostesses that we were leaving and why.  They looked confused, but did not extend an apology nor did they make any effort to get us to stay.  easy retraining and other measures are needed.  This is an affluent mall and expectations are high, not they shouldn&#39;t be in any of your locations.  While hopeful that you will fix this, the damage is done and we will not return to location.

Every single time has been amazing. There&#39;s one bartender on week days around happy hour (4:30-5:00) ish; she&#39;s the best. Very attentive &amp; sweet &amp; friendly. Even though I go there every once in 2,3 months she remembers exactly what I like. I like their food a lot. Drinks are very consistent &amp; well made.

I&#39;ve been going to The Cheesecake Factory in Hackensack for years &amp; it&#39;s always been a pleasant experience, however something has been a bit off since they&#39;ve moved to the other side of the mall. Portions have gotten smaller &amp; service has become lackluster. I brought my mother there for a birthday lunch this past Friday &amp; it was the most AWFUL service I&#39;ve ever received there. Our waiter (Whose name is Kevin) was so rude &amp; condescending. He was not welcoming and seemed to have been in a bad mood. Usually the servers I&#39;ve dealt with there are so friendly. He basically came to our table and said &#34;Hi I&#39;m Kevin, are you ready to order or do you need more time&#34; in a very dry tone. My mother ordered a water for her drink and she asked for a straw, as he gives her the straw he proceeded to say &#34;Yea we don&#39;t usually give straws for water because it&#39;s pretty wasteful&#34; as if we asked for an explanation. As we continued to scroll through the menu he comes back to the table &amp; just stands there and doesn&#39;t say a word. We felt like we were being rushed to order. Oh &amp; also we had to ask for bread. The table behind us were ordering something and I guess they asked for a substitution for something &amp; says to them &#34; Yea the menu is pretty much as is, we can&#39;t just change things around or else we&#39;ll be here all friggin day&#34; I mean SERIOUSLY?! Everyone in our section was miserable dealing with this guy. We all ended up waiting over 30 minutes to find this guy, myself and another guest ended up walking around trying to find him until another waiter (more friendly than this guy) was able to assist us. THE WORST EXPERIENCE I&#39;VE EVER HAD THERE, hire waiters that actually want to be there &amp; not make customers feel uncomfortable. I gave 2 stars instead of one because the food was fine.

What happened to my favorite restaurant? No other words to describe what used to be my go to place. Poor service and lack of training.  I&#39;m not sure what is going on with the service at this location. We sat on the patio and it was one of the worst experiences I&#39;ve ever had at Cheesecake. The server literally rolled her neck at my dinner guest tonight when he asked for her attention. I was mortified as it was a business dinner. Took forever to get the check and when I finally got it, the bill was incorrect. Only positive thing I can say is that the food was ok. Management should look to retrain their staff.

Ahh, the Cheesecake Factory. As long as I have living relatives, I am sure the road of my life will always lead to a Cheesecake Factory somewhere in the country. My family, and my wife&#39;s family, and most peoples&#39; families I know, all have a special place in their heart for the Cheesecake Factory. Me, well? Not so much. I mean, as far as chain restaurants go, you can definitely get a decent meal here. Half the battle is navigating the menu, which is like a yellow pages, complete with ads and local promotions sprinkled throughout.<br><br>I am a firm believer that the more items on the menu, the less spectacular the food. The Cheesecake Factory bucks that trend ever so slightly, for with literally 100+ items to choose from, you&#39;d flat-out expect all the food to suck by my formula. But the food is OK. I have yet to find something on the menu that would give me cause to give them more than three stars, but you could certainly do worse eating elsewhere.<br><br>Here&#39;s what I think MY perfect Cheesecake Factory scenario would be:  <br><br>It&#39;s been a long day, say, having attended a bourbon festival with friends for hours on end. We&#39;ve just gotten done telling our driver that for all the booze they had at the festival, there wasn&#39;t much food to eat, and now we&#39;re starving. And, of course we all have both feet in the bag. As we drive down the highway, we spy a Cheesecake Factory, and ask the driver to make a stop. In an unusual twist of fate, we are pleasantly surprised to find there is no wait for a table. In fact, not only is there no wait, there are no screaming children to be found anywhere. Still, we decide to eat at the bar. Once sat, we get a few more adult beverages, and then proceed to order *EVERYTHING* on the appetizer menu. We stumble out full, accompanied by the sound of our arteries hardening, and proceed back to the limo for the long ride home. We are happy. Very, very happy.<br><br>We&#39;ll have to try that some time. Maybe a 4-star review isn&#39;t completely out of reach under the proper circumstances...

6 of us stopped in after my mother&#39;s wake. Ordered a round of drinks which took quite sometime to come out. My sons girlfriend wanted an espresso martini but asked for some Baileys in it. Waiter said sure but we&#39;ll have to charge you extra, she said no problem. Her drink comes out sometime after ours and it&#39;s a chilled Baileys, not an espresso martini. We then order several appetizers. The appetizers come out a little more staggered than they should have, especially the chips and guacamole, that didn&#39;t come out at all. In the mean time we order a second round of drinks, after, again quite sometime the one person that didn&#39;t order a drink gets one the rest of us get nothing. The waiter seeing our frustration offers to send over the Manager, well that was an epic failure. After explaining the many things that went wrong he offered a weak apology and walked away. We gave up asked for our check wanting nothing more than to get out of there! Last insult we get our check and were overcharged!! <br>One of my worst experiences ever

I come often to your place but I m very disappointed. For the past year I ask for artichoke and is on your menu. I always get the same answer, sorry we don&#39;t have it artichoke is not in season. Does your chef or management know that artichoke is on season from January till June and now is in his peak season. Come on take it off the menu otherwise don&#39;t offer it to your customers.  Really  I you deserve more stars but don&#39;t fool your customers with this stupid answer artichoke is not in season.

Just brought the family for breakfast at cheesecake. My mother and wife both commented how every time we come(couple of times a month) that every single person we deal with is friendly ha e not had a bad waiter in the last year. Not sure if there had been new management. But I&#39;d like to commend the management and the team they put together

Love their food! But usually the line is long and depending on the server the long can be even longer. However, on my last visit the waiter was very attentive and even though she kept forgetting things, she was very friendly and made it up with her great attitude. I will definitely keep coming back!
2 thumbs up for the tuscan chicken on the skinnylicious menu... So tasty!!! Highly recommend this dish

I went to Cheesecake Factory in Hackensack today and was very disappointed! To begin, I ordered the Korean style cauliflower as an appetizer. The waiter came back to tell us they were out of it! We were there at 3:30 pm. Ok so then I ordered the GRILLED chicken avocado salad. When it arrived the chicken wasn&#39;t grilled. It was sliced chicken breast cold cuts.  I told the waiter to return it. The manager came over and tried to explain that the chicken is grilled. But, it&#39;s not warm.  Well any restaurant I went to that had GRILLED chicken ......  it was warm. No excuses ! They should have everything it says on the menu, and change the name of the chicken to cold chicken breast. Very upset!
Always a bit of a wait, but it is for good reason. The food is great and the staff is very professional. Portion sizes are big and fit the price. The buffalo blasts are amazing!

For some reason I find eating here a better experience than its more upmarket counterpart  Grand Lux Cafe. For those not caring about calories it is hard to pass on the meatloaf along with the addicting buffalo  bites. Everything seems fresh and well prepared , and I just love the low carb cheesecake .
The Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pasta is amazing! Don&#39;t forget to ask for extra sauce on the side because the pasta sometimes gets dry. Amazing customer service!
Food is mediocre here they need to fix there cloth napkins it left lint all over my lap and pants !!!!! Fix it fast

I came here for lunch with my family and we loved it. It is located in a very well kept 5 star mall with high end stores. I had the Crusted Chicken Romano with pasta and it was spot on perfect. The others had salmon and chicken teriyaki and they said it was the best they ever had. We then got two slices of cake: Chocolate cheesecake with Tuxedo Cream and a slice of Red velvet - both were outstanding. The coffee was really good too. Our waiter Mike was on point and never missed a beat. <br><br>The wait was short [about 20 min] and well worth it. I recommend that you come here for a late lunch to avoid the busy crowds at night. After you eat, walk around the mall and go to the trendy furniture store Arhaus - very cool place to visit.
I love it.. all the appetizers, entree.. they have so many varieties and the best part is dessert! I like it so much here

This place is really good, beats out any Friday&#39;s, Outbacks, Chili&#39;s , and Applebee&#39;s! The portions are huge so be prepared to stuff your face. My fiance and I had skipped appetizers and ordered to entrees. He had the meatloaf and I ordered the Thai glazed salmon. I&#39;m not a fan of meatloaf, but I tried it and it can change any vegetarians. The Thai salmon had a soy and sweet ting to it. We were so stuffed that we ordered our cheesecakes to-go. I had the tiramisu cheesecake and he ordered the banana cream cheesecake. The fluffiness was melt in your mouth heaven. I definitely recommend this restaurant! Everyone should go at least once in their lifetimes.

After all these years, I still have my to go to place as Cheescake Factory.... <br><br>I don&#39;t know why but something about it draws me in.... Is it the huge portions that I can take home and enjoy for 2 meals? Is it the vast amounts of cheesecakes and desserts calling my name..... or perhaps the way I can customize my lousiana chicken pasta with angel hair with extra sauce mmmmmmm<br><br>The prices are decent for the portion sizes. I feel the apps are a bit higher priced but they are yummy.<br><br>Cant wait till my next cheesecake venture.

Only saying 3 stars, due to the price of these foods.<br>I can only afford these foods on a special occasion. If they were cheaper even for college students and college student discounts. I wouldn&#39;t mind coming to this place on a weekly basis than an annual basis.

Went out to eat here on a Wednesday evening. I was surprised to see how crowded it was for a weeknight. We were able to get a seat right away nonetheless as this location can accommodate a lot of patrons.<br><br>We started off with the chicken quesadilla appetizer. It was very tasty, although the portion of guacamole that we received with it had black chunks of avocado. Not a good look.<br><br>One thing I hate that some restaurants do, this one included, is that they don&#39;t list drink prices on the menu. We each ordered a sangria. It was served in a wine glass, mostly filled with ice. They came out to be $11.50 each. Definitely not worth the price. Should have none better : / keep that in mind if you go here.<br><br>For my entree I order the chicken parm sandwich.<br>It was definitely flavorful and tasty, however, the portion was small. <br><br>Overall, the food is good here. Good quality as well. I just feel like you don&#39;t really get your money&#39;s worth here. The price doesn&#39;t justify the quantity of food you receive. Other than that, no complaints.
The food is good but when u go there when it&#39;s full you get terrible seatin g. And when you want to move your seat they say u need to wait 50 or 50 more minutes.

My bf treated me to dinner here and I found hair in my food. BLONDE hair! The customer service sucks here, I also celebrated my birthday here in Dec and the food was horrible. My food was cold and my drinks were blah. I would go to any other location but this one.

Big place. The food is good , price is decent and the drinks are standard. Dessert is the best a lot of options . There&#39;s 2 TVs by the bar to watch a game. Have a take out section if your on the go .

It was lunch time and while in the area I decided to settle on this place. I&#39;ve been to the one in the Palisades Mall so I knew what I was in store for. Server was friendly, not too chatty and didn&#39;t mind the fact that it took me about 20 minutes to study the million page menu they hand you....I always do that! <br><br>There are way too many decisions to make, and every time....every time!!!....I still have no clue what to get. I usually end up getting my old standby Chicken Bellagio. The last time I had it was in Palisades and it was too dry and nightmarish. However this time it was spot on. Nice and juicy, not overbearing, just delicious. The great part is that you can get a second meal out of their servings. Not a bad thing, but sometimes reheating food like this can completely ruin it. <br><br>The only problem I had, their beer fridge for kegs was broken. :( Which meant no draught beer! What kind of country are we coming to?!

The only reason this place got 2 stars was because of the food. My friends had the macaroni and cheese burger which was amazing. It was smokey, cheesy, and very nice. I had the chicken chili which was alright. It smelled weird but it was creamy, and nice. The service? Was HORRIBLE!! <br><br>Our server was Ashely (or Ashlee) it&#39;s Friday night and I understand it&#39;s busy I work in hospitality but this is completely unacceptable. When we got to our table, it was dirty. We had to ask the table to be cleaned. Then it took forever for the bread to come. We had to ask for straws for our water, rarely was our table asked if we were doing fine. When our entrees came we were happy! :) then my friends asked for water (there were 3 of us) and they both got their waters refilled but my cup was empty and she just kept moving? It&#39;s an industry standard to refill a guest water WITHOUT asking. My friends shouldn&#39;t have even asked for THEIR water to be refilled. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t come here on a Friday. My friend (who was with us tonight) said she came on a Saturday and it was seamless service. <br><br>I&#39;m not overreaching here, these are just regular industry standards. I love to tip my server and I have friends who are servers so I get it. It&#39;s hard but dirty table? And dirty floor? How clean can everything else be? I wouldn&#39;t waste my time but I&#39;m sure others have had a great time. It was honestly just our server.

Let me make one thing clear...this review for the majority is not based of off the food served at Cheesecake Factory. After having an extremely poor experience at this Cheesecake Factory, I reflected on what had actually happened before writing this review as to not overreact.<br><br>One evening about 2 months ago my boyfriend and I decided to venture to CF, I was having a craving for cheesecake, and the food is also pretty decent. So we were off to get dinner. When we arrived the the hostess took our name down and told us that it would be a short wait, which was fine. When we were seated it didn&#39;t take very long before we knew what we wanted to order because we always get the same thing.<br><br>Our server came over and was polite. We placed our order with him when he arrived, for me the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic, and for my boyfriend, a cuban sandwich. We also ordered an appetizer, fried calamari. Now for the appetizer we had a specific request, neither myself or my boyfriend like the tentacles that are normally served with fried calamari so we asked if we could have the rings only. Now this is something that we have asked for on more than one occasion and at more than one CF. The server said that there was no problem and left the table to go put in our order. A few minutes later he came back to the table and told us that he was sorry but that his manager said that it was against policy to serve the fried calamari without the tentacles. I explained to the server that we ask for this every time we come in and it has never been a problem, we asked to speak with the manager...<br><br>A man came over, unfortunately I do not know his name, but he was very nice and told us that he would oblige our request for us. He did explain that it&#39;s not normally something that they do but that he would do it for us. A few moments later our fried calamari came to the table with the tentacles, so it seemed like there was some miscommunication. We explained to the food runner that the manager said he would make our order rings only, this she was not aware of, so she took the plate back to the kitchen. A few minutes after that a woman came charging over to our table and said, &#34;just so you guys know we can never do this for you again!!&#34; I replied by telling her that we already spoke to a manager and everything was taken care of. She condescendingly replied, &#34;I&#39;m the manager and I don&#39;t know who told you that we do this but we don&#39;t, It&#39;s against our corporate policy!!&#34; I told her that this is a regular occurrence and that we have never had such a problem before. She argued with me that she doesn&#39;t do this for anyone and that our request would never have been granted at HER CF and that if corporate found out that she did this she would be in a lot of trouble. At this point there was no arguing with her. Every thing we attempted to say was shot down by her. She was so unprofessional. She had no interest in giving us a good guest experience from the start. She was right and that was it!!! We asked her for her business card with every intention of complaining to corporate and as she went to give us the card she just tossed it at us like she was doing us a favor, and then stomped away from the table like the beast that she was.<br><br>If you are planning on visiting this CF remember a few key things. 1. this place is run by a female dog named, Stephanie Bucciarelli, on a power trip who obviously has no training on how to give customer service. 2. Be prepared for a mediocre experience with an upscale price tag. and 3. get your order of cheesecake to go as to spare yourself from the rudeness that is oozing out of this place. 4. If you have a complaint, voice it, because without feedback issues cannot be known or corrected.<br><br>Needless to say that my boyfriend and I have not visited CF since.<br><br>P.S. Many other chains like Houlihan&#39;s, Long Horn, Olive Garden, even Maggiano&#39;s don&#39;t even serve the tentacles or will hold the tentacles with no argument. I don&#39;t understand why this caused such a big problem, never has this ever been an issue at any other restaurant establishment no matter what the cost. I would think that with CF&#39;s price tag that they would want to cater to their guests and keep them as returning patrons.

Pleasantly surprised!  Hadn&#39;t been in years.  Went at 5 pm on a Saturday. Hostess said it would be a 20 minute wait and it was exactly that.  Waiter (Justin) was fantastic.  I had a delicious chicken dish, my wife had an omelette.  My daughters pasta was perfect and my sons meatloaf very good also.  And yes, the cheesecake!   Best anywhere.  Get there early.  Much more economical option btw than Mortons or Oceania.  Also at Riverside.

Service was friendly and helpful but didn&#39;t remember that I asked that my english muffin ahould be served on the side.  This wasn&#39;t why I gave my visit 3 stars as the food was nothing special or out of the ordinary even though they had a huge menu.<br><br>Then again I should know better just by the name and stuck with maybe ordering a slice of cheesecake.  I will maybe visit next time just for the sweets.
Love love love the food and love the staff. Walter, our waiter, was phenomenal and went above and beyond for us. Can&#39;t wait to come back.
Obsessed with the ahi carpaccio dish and lemon drop martini&#39;s. The cheesecakes are a must too! I go every so often and never get disappointed..

There is a large selection of reasonably priced menu items. They have a lot of salads to choose from if you are looking for a healthy option. The cheesecakes are all delicious, and the portion sizes are large.
No complaints.... Not bad for the price and it being a chain restaurant.

I like eating here because it&#39;s usually pretty consistent .. only once I came and ordered the free range chicken and they used wayyyyy too much lemon like i felt like I was eating one of those sour candies that makes your face pucker up lol..<br>(i had ordered that lemon chicken 2 previous times and it was great but the last time it was too much lemon)  but usually I can count on them that my food is gonna taste fresh and good... they have such a huge selection too so that&#39;s great

To start off, I really love The Cheesecake Factory. The menu is big offering all different types of food and I&#39;ve never gotten a meal I didn&#39;t love. I&#39;ve been here twice since they moved to the other side of the mall, most recently yesterday, 1/1/2018, with my sister after a little New Year shopping. One thing that baffles me is why, when rebuilding, they didn&#39;t open the foyer area up more. You come in and are given a pager and told your wait time and then after it goes off you wait some more on the other side of the hostess stand. I don&#39;t mind waiting &amp; always come prepared to wait because I understand the high demand of this place however waiting on top of strangers in heavy coats is frustrating since they just redid this place and had the chance to fix it. Moving on - we were seated, given menus and soon realized it was going to take our waitress awhile to get to us as another table next to us was flagging down other servers trying to find her. I&#39;m assuming she had another section to wait on since I rarely saw her in the area, which is fine but if you&#39;re going to give a server two sections try to make them somewhat near each other that way she can easily check on both. Eventually she came over and took our drink order, which, thank God because between shopping and the wait, I was thiiiiirsty. I got the Shrimp and Angel Hair Pasta from the Skinnylicious menu and my sister got the Mac n Cheese Burger. I love the Skinny menu because I usually order apps (all time FAVORITE is the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes - GET THEM) and can still order a meal and not feel like I can&#39;t breathe after. My sister asked to sub out regular fries for sweet potato ones and was told that&#39;s fine however when the food was brought out the woman delivering it said &#34;Oh yeah we don&#39;t have any more sweet potato fries so we gave you regular fries is that ok?&#34; Not having an item is no big deal but bringing the food out and THEN asking if that&#39;s ok when its already in front of the patron? Maybe next time take the time to come out and actually ask if there&#39;s another side she may want instead. Besides that, everything got devoured pretty quickly and afterwards we ordered a piece of our go-to Dulce de Leche cheesecake to share. Fluffy, sweet heaven is the best way to describe any of the desserts here so always try to save room. Overall, I know I&#39;ll be back because I genuinely enjoy the food - just not those few minor issues.

Would you like to gain a few pounds in one sitting? Then cheesecake factory is the place to go! Everything is good but really large portions. Even the salads are colossal. But the dressings are packed with flavor and probably lots of calories too so ask for it on the side because they really pour it on if you don&#39;t. The cheesecake slices are humungous so share with someone .... or be a glutton. Whatever the case, the cheesecake is yummy but super sweet. The specialty drinks are sweet too so just get a whiskey on the rocks like i do and keep it simple.
Very disappointed with the food. We order a mac and cheese burger and it was completely burn. We told the waiter and all she said was sorry. We still couldn&#39;t eat it so sorry doesn&#39;t help.

Service sucked - food was ok!<br>Cheesecake Factory is a solid pick if you are with a group of people and everyone wants to eat something different. They have a huge menu where everyone is bound to find something that they like. Its always busy at this location and there is always a wait. This time around we waited for 1.5 hours - which sounds like a long time but with the mall next door you just put your name in and then do some shopping in the mean time. This place will NOT blow you away but it&#39;s still a good place.<br>However the service the last few times just SUCKS! Our waiter only stopped by to bring us drinks, our food, and then the check. He never asked us if we wanted another drink, or anything else. He could have probably doubled his check if he had done so. Dinner was about 2 hours long, not because we ate or drank that much but just because of the super slow service. Their cheesecake is pretty good tho :)

I ordered a to go order. That was a pain they put me on hold for 15 minutes. And this is not the first time this happened. I ordered two kids grilled chickens. For my kids. The size of the chicken was the size of two baby carrots. The kids chicken cost $9.00. That is expensive for a kids meal. So, I asked for the manger because this situation was ridiculous. The manager said this is the right size. He was very fake nice. He said he would ask the executive chief and he said it was the right size. With a rude grin on his face. In conclusion, I will never go to The Cheese Cake Factory in Hackensack. I strongly do not recommend going there. It is a huge waste of your time and money .

Just like any other Cheesecake Factory - large portions, large caloric intake, insanely large crowds. It&#39;s decent food, but I have always been confused by the chain&#39;s popularity (I wouldn&#39;t wait 2+ hrs for a seat here, but others do).  I like eating here, but not if I have to wait more than half an hour (as is usually the case). It is more &#39;affordable&#39; than Houston&#39;s and the new seafood place right next door, though.

I&#39;ve tried cheesecake from Cheescake Factory and they really need to change the name because they don&#39;t have it.  The texture is awful, the taste is tangy, and the appearance is just not enticing to the palate.  <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t feed this to my dog, probably give it the runs.

Please keep in mind that this is a chain restaurant so it&#39;s already starting with customer-centric decor and time tested dishes. Came on a Friday night and was told that the wait would be 20 min; it ended up being 25 min but it wasn&#39;t too bad. Walking over to over table, I noticed the floors were freshly mopped to the point of being sticky and slick at the same time. Our waitress was busy closing out other tables when we were seated, but she made sure to come by and let us know she&#39;d be right back. The complimentary bread wasn&#39;t delivered until the same time as our appetizer, which you can interpret as the bread was delivered late or the app came out really quickly, up to you. The food and cheesecake is always on point, since again, it&#39;s a chain. Overall, not a perfect experience, but definitely solid. I wouldn&#39;t avoid this location at all.

The manager Erick was awesome. Our waiter was on top of things. Appetizers are a must avocado egg rolls Thai lettuce wraps and fried Mac n cheese balls. My sons burger was over cooked so I advise to order your burger medium. But Erick took care of it with no hesitation. Been coming here for years and never been disappointed.

I swear I only go here for the avocado eggrolls. They&#39;re the bomb! and that tamarind cilantro sauce it comes with is my weakness. The Marsala chicken dish is also good and they&#39;re star berry lemonade heaven. The wait is always so long though. Whenever I go there&#39;s always at least an half an hour wait. Good news is that you can wait by the bar and order some apps while you wait. Definitely recommend this place. Everything is so tasty. There menu is huge! They serve Everything from Italian to Tai to Mexican... Can&#39;t go wrong with this place.

Stick with the pasta and salads which are super good. Th turkey burger, philly cheese steak... Not so much.  <br>That said, I&#39;ve also been here so many times that I can say the staff are always friendly (can&#39;t say the same for the hostesses).
Love the chain - hate this location. <br>Just horrible. Over 50 min wait time instead of promised 40. To get 2 pieces of cake from the front - over 25 min.

I had never been to the cheesecake factory prior to this weekend and it was pretty much as expected. The food was decent - bread was undercooked but my Smokehouse BBQ Burger was acceptable. The meat wasn&#39;t flavorful but the toppings made up for it, although at nearly 100 g of fat that shit better be delicious.<br>Our server was awesome though. Super helpful and into her job. I was kicking myself after I left for not leaving her more than the 20% tip that I did.

Can I give ZERO stars? My mom and I used to go here consistently a couple of years ago when I would be back home from college and we always had the best time. We came back here for the first time last Thursday night, and I have been SICK for A WEEK because of FOOD POISONING. I ended up getting the STOMACH FLU. I ordered the ahi tuna salad from the skinny menu and my mom got Renee&#39;s Special. We also got the skinny salmon rolls (which they said they ran out of, then they suddenly appeared). Overall, we were unsatisfied with the food and service which has never happened before. I got chills when I got home that night and a slight fever in the morning which I didn&#39;t think much of (it is the cold season afterall). My mom felt fine (Thank God) but I have had consistent fevers every 4-5 hours all week (102-103) and have had TWO VISITS TO THE HOSPITAL where I needed IVs for  dehydration because my body was rejecting everything. I eat sushi and raw fish regularly and have never had this reaction before, and honestly this week and my body have been through hell. I wouldn&#39;t wish this on anyone. <br><br>POINT IS: STAY AWAY. SERVICE SUCKS ANYWAY. <br><br>WE WILL NOT BE RETURNING.
this is our favorite, staff is friendly place is clean and the food and portion size is always on point, the cheese cakes are decadent

The Cheesecake Factory makes my very short list of chain restaurants that don&#39;t suck.  It&#39;s not fine dining, but if you are stuck in a homogenized, American suburb somewhere, this is the place you should probably choose.<br><br>This particular location was rather large.  The very high ceilings and outdoor seating only increased the effect.  It is so refreshing to eat outside of the city, because you can easily find a table with plenty of room around you and not have people sitting so close by.  In short, it was relaxing.<br><br>The menu was ridiculously long.  They have specialties that number into the hundreds, I dare say.  Being Easter Sunday, I thought I would try for something with ham in it, but no such luck.  Out of all the very many selections, they don&#39;t do ham steak, even on Easter.  Oh well, a passing thought really.  I decided to settle in on the shrimp and chicken gumbo (1530 calories).  The dish had so much color.  There was a large mound of white rice in the middle surrounded by a soupy gumbo.  There was plenty of nicely cooked shrimp, green onions, and tomatoes, but no sign of any chicken.  There was trace amounts of andouille sausage, but it did not have much flavor.  Overall, it was okay.  The dish had a lot of flavor, but it wasn&#39;t seasoned as nearly as heavily as I would have liked for a gumbo.  The portion size was more than fair for the price though.    <br><br>I did stick around for dessert and stayed for the obligatory cheesecake.  Another long menu was presented to me.  I opted for the Adams Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake (1330 calories).  This particular cheesecake has the dubious honor of having the most calories out of any of the selections at Cheesecake Factory.  Lucky me.  At least it was pretty good though.  It couldn&#39;t have been larger really.  It had just about everything in it too.  There was cake, fudge, peanut butter, cheesecake, a huge dollop of fresh whipped cream, and so forth.  It was a sinfully delicious way to shorten my lifespan, really.  I loved it.  Outside of New York City, I would probably rely on the Cheesecake Factory for my cheesecake indulgences, because they actually are pretty good at it.  <br><br>4 stars for the cheesecake<br>3 stars for the food<br>3.5 stars overall

I only gave it three stars because I truly like their food-even though it always upsets my stomach. Most dishes are served in some kind of a butter or cream sauce which is tasty as heck but does me no justice. I also assume the calories aren&#39;t the best. Service is hit or miss-just depends on who you get and the mood they are in. The wait is ridiculous and I always find myself asking why I choose to wait an hour and a half to be sat for dinner. I guess it&#39;s not the restaurants fault-people like it and show up to eat-but perhaps they should expand the seating area or have a lobby where you can order appetizers while you wait. <br><br>So my experiences here have always been a 50/50. If the food is good, the service is not. I usually find the servers to be absent more than they should be during the course of the meal. I&#39;ve had to get out of my seat to get servers before. Eh. Last thing-I hate the seating-its not super personal. Booths are great-their tables leave you no room for privacy. Kind of annoying.

I STARTED GOING THIS PLACE SINCE 2007~ it was the most cleanest place in the town and the food was amazing... now all are gone.... I ain&#39;t going this place anymore. And I will never ever going again.

Why do so many people rave about this very mediocre and overrated place? For starters, we all ordered drinks. The waitress got all of them wrong; giving me a Dr Pepper instead of root beer. I don&#39;t know how she could mess up a simple task. Then, we got a spinach dip. In the sour cream I noticed that there were white, dry strings of something that shouldn&#39;t have been there. For the dinner, I ordered chicken costeleta which was fried and oily. It didn&#39;t taste too good. We didn&#39;t even bother with dessert. Very high priced for what you get. Average service. Not the best food. I do not recommend this restaurant especially since there are so many better restaurants in this mall.

with all do respect I was truly upset with my pasta that was brought home for me.  I had asked for extra pasta with the garlic cream sauce and instead they give me little sauce and it is Alfredo sauce.  I do not know if the staff are lazy or the kitchen however a certain amount of pasta with the wrong sauce is a disgrace to me.  I have always worked in the food industry and my father who ordered the food has been a chef for more than 40 years.  I look at this very bland, dry, farfalle pasta with a small amount of sauce and I think where in the hell is my money going.  Clearly anyone could have mad pasta wit thin Alfredo sauce at home, however the cheesecake factory seems to love to charge you.  I will never eat there again....guaranteed. By the way I should mention that this is the third time that this restaurant did this to me and my expensive dish.

I can always count on good food, great cocktails, and of course yummy cheesecake galour each time we come here.  There seem to always be a wait for tables so we usually just grab a seat in the bar area.  The staff are always friendly and energetic.  Always a good time. Cheers!!!

Was thinking if I should send this review or not when we visited a couple of weeks ago, but it&#39;s always a good idea to give your opinion on your own experiences. Might help others. So here goes: I went with some friends for dinner and our disappointment started when our waitress took forever to come over to our table. (By forevever I mean about 15 minutes to bring us our menus.) Without a hello, the waitress said, &#34;I&#39;ll be back to take your order.&#34; Umm, can we order some drinks first? Guess not because she walked away and came back about 10 minutes later, she didn&#39;t say hello; just asked for our order. My friend said hello and asked her for her name, and she said &#34;Cece.&#34; She quickly said, &#34;what can I get you.&#34; Let me just say, she was not a nice, welcoming waitress. She was full of attitude and we couldn&#39;t understand why?! but wow, our experience just got worse. My fries came cold and sadly were burnt. I ordered just some juice and it came warm, no ice. Thankfully, our friends liked their drinks but told us their food was &#34;ok.&#34; Our waitress just seem not to want to serve us even though she constantly checked on the table across from us. Huh? <br>Employees will make or break your business and it can effect how customers view the place and the food they eat. The evening was dissapointing and embarrassing as our friends were from out of town. And omg how I glorified this place to them. Would recommend to those who can handle waitresses with bad customer service. EEEK. Hopefully this doesn&#39;t happen often at the Cheesecake Factory.

The food is very good. I come here with my 70 year old mother, my husband and our two kids 11 and 9. There is something for everyone. We are always happy with the service. Very happy with the service every visit!  It&#39;s a busy place so prepare to wait depending on what time you go.

This place is getting zero stars for me. Customer service sucks. Waited 60 minutes for our order only to find out it was &#34;sold&#34; like this is some fast food restaurant. Manager was not helpful at all throughout this entire process. Will not be returning. Even though they have a new location, it&#39;s the same BS wervic

Food was good but if you order a liquor drink the wait is approx 15min. I asked the waitress why this happens and the answer was the bar is very busy. My wife and I have been to The Cheese Cake Factory 5 times in 2017 and the issue in receiving a liquor drink, glass of wine or mug of beer has been absolutely terrible. It&#39;s obvious to me the problem continues because of poor management

This restaurant is almost identical to the Grand lux cafe and both fail in my book. While the bread that they serve is delicious, everything else in my opinion falls flat. I&#39;ve tried sandwiches, burgers, steaks, pastas and salads and nothing to me really stood out as delicious. It&#39;s not a horrible spot for dinner but its overpriced and nothing there keeps my wanting to come back.<br><br>I think its more of a novelty place, the portions are usually large and the staff is friendly, but the food is seriously boring.

Came here for a Birthday dinner waitress was nice but food took forever 2 managers came to apologize for the wait we got our food it wasn&#39;t what we ordered for one of us so had to wait again for the correct dish to come out and now my dish is cold waiting for hers I haven&#39;t been here in 11 years and for good reason just don&#39;t do it and if your in here reading this please leave now .

First off, let me state that I have been a loyal customer at Cheesecake Factory (at this specific location, as well) for over 10 years. Never had a bad meal or a bad experience here... until last night. My buddy and I ordered two rounds of the same drink each. Ketel One and club with a splash of Campari. We were taken aback when we received the bill and saw that they banged us for $20 worth of Campari. To be charging $5 extra for a SPLASH of Campari is outrageous. Never experienced this anywhere else. <br><br>We talked to THREE managers. They each gave the same &#39;&#39;this is corporate policy&#39;&#39; BS.
