ZERO effort made to help us out with the inconvenience. We were expecting the ridiculous $20 Campari charge to be taken off, but they couldn&#39;t even offer up a coupon and couldn&#39;t even utter a &#39;&#39;sorry&#39;&#39; to us. This is absolutely inexcusable. Not to mention we ran up a $160 bill as well... 2 rounds of drinks, an app, entree and dessert to go... EACH. Extremely bad look when management can&#39;t be the least bit considerate with long-time loyal customers spending good money. Thanks to the stubbornness of management, Cheesecake Factory has lost my business forever. Great job!

I like this Cheesecake Factory in particular as this is the one I go to consistently but have also eaten in Wayne, King of Prussia, Boston and Costa Mesa locations.  I can see how the opinions may vary on ratings as I gave the CF a 4 star review but only after settling into a &#39;groove&#39;.  <br><br>I have tried many dishes and consistently love:<br>1.  Meatloaf - what is it about crunchy french fried onions; this is an exercise in gluttony.<br>2.  Thai lettuce wraps - the lower cal alternative to a pig out meal but you don&#39;t feel like you&#39;re eating a salad because of the yummy sauces.<br>3.  Avocado eggrolls - yes, you can OD on these but I had them a lot before switching out to another appetizer.<br>4.  The dark bread with the butter - not an entree, I know, but I have gone to CF in anticipation of the bread!  But only the dark bread.<br>5.  The lunch specials are really good and a great value.  There are smaller portions than dinner but really good pricing on almost anything you&#39;d want including the meatloaf, most pastas, salads and sandwiches.<br><br>Dishes I really like generally include most of the salad dishes because I was on a &#39;diet&#39; for a really long time:<br>1.  Chinese chicken salad <br>2.  Cobb salad - yes, I know, still fattening but the fiber ....<br>3.  The combination appetizer plate is great for sharing and trying items that you may not order on your own like the corn cakes (yummy but small) and crab cakes mixed in with the run of the mill buffalo wings, mozzerella sticks.<br><br>There are definitely one or two dishes that I did not like, including the salad with gouda and pear.  I had this in Wayne and literally asked the waitress where the pear was?  She was pretty snooty and told me that there were (obviously miniscule) pieces of diced dry pear in the salad.  Righhhhhhhht.  If the taste is THAT subtle, why the heck headline it in the description?!?!?!?<br><br>Generally, all of the cheesecakes are delicious, but the challenge is in finding the room after eating dinner.  The low carb cheesecake is okay but I like stuff on mine and this was a plain version.  Could never get myself to try the fish tacos but I hear that is really good too.<br><br>I like two of the drinks:  the well mannered dirty martini with extra olives (they&#39;re huge and stuffed with bleu cheese) and the candy apple martini (very girly and with red sugar on the rim).  My only issue is that I always get extra olives with the dirty martini and the last time the bartender wanted to CHARGE for them .... WTF?  BTW, I asked about buying a bottle and the waitress told me that the CF workers stuff the olives themselves.<br><br>The atmosphere is loud and noisy in the bar area but I like the place.  It&#39;s the perfect end to a hectic shopping day.
We received our bread and it was hard as a rock. The chicken dish I ordered tasted like old chicken with no flavor. Had to ask for water refills. Never going to this location.

Came here with a friend and we both enjoyed it. At first it look like a long wait but once we got in we were actually seated. The bread they bring out is good. We had ordered the calamari to start with which was really good. Then i had chicken tacos which were delicious. My friend had ordered a pasta with chicken (forgot the name) which i tried that taste good as well. Our waiter was also very nice and made sure we were satisfied with our food. And I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan but they had other options so i took home a slice of chocolate fudge cake which was great!

A place like this is good to come to every once and a while. Whether it&#39;s with just another person, or a group of 4, this place has you covered.<br>The food isn&#39;t bad, the portions are pretty big, the only flaw that I experienced, was that they get busy, so the waiters tend to pass by every once and a while. We were flagging waiters down left and right before ours finally came back to our table. We went in for a quick lunch, place wasn&#39;t too crowded, and we still got stuck there.

I love this location! it is At the Shops at Riverside so you get less high school kids lurking around!<br>(I have tried the Menlo Park location but it is absolutely horrible - food and service)<br>The food is always fresh and the staff is very pleasant!! not a long wait unless you go on a saturday!<br>The food options are plentyful and portions definitely allow you to take out so it is value for money with great taste!
Fabulous restaurant! <br><br>Great food (large portions), great service!

I usually love the CF, but this location (Hackensack, NJ) NEVER has what we want! We have been to this location about 3 times in the past two months and every time my husband and I go he ordered the turkey club sandwich. And every time they tell us they are out of it. How difficult is it to keep those ingredients in stock? He&#39;s a simple guy and that&#39;s all he wanted, yet you can&#39;t carry lettuce, tomato, bacon, turkey and bread? When I know most of those ingredients are on other dishes. I understand places get busy and may run out of something. But not three different visits in a two month span. So this location gets a bad review from us not because of service, but because we can&#39;t get the food you offer on your menu.

I&#39;ve been to this place at least twenty times. I never thought anything of it, it was just on of those chain restaurants that I would go to if I happened to be around, hungry and nothing better came to my mind. However, after what happened last night, I will never ever go back there again. Ever!<br>So there were 10 or 12 of us. Sure enough they don&#39;t take reservations. We got there before 7pm and were asked to wait so we ended up at the bar. We were all starving so after getting a few drinks some of us got a little drunk and one person was louder than he should have been. One of the custumers at the bar commented in a rude manner asking for us to keep it down. The drunk one out of us decided it was a good idea to become louder. I get it, he was wrong! As a result another guy at the bar started a verbal fight with him. The manager showed up asked if our group  could leave. We were there for almost two hours waiting for a table!!!!! All we needed was to get sited and get food! One person in our group was pregnant, another one was a nurse after a long shift at the hospital and overall we were a normal group of  people of our age. We just needed to get some food into the system. DO NOT go there with big groups. Terrible management!! They ruined my night!

This place is always crowded from like 6-9pm. They dont take reservations. The food portions are huge and very yummy! I like the Chicken Pot Stickers, Spinach Dip, Tex Mex Eggrolls, Chicken Madiera and for dessert.............Tiramisu, Strawberry Shortcake, Brownie Sundae..........or you can choose from like 30 different types of Cheesecakes! Service is good. The glasses for the soda are BIG. My favorite alcoholic drink is the Georgia Peach (ice blend, peach and raspberry flavors)<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thecheesecakefactory.com%2F&amp;s=0b467d6e6b241cd6852de828d75278ff3fb437ee52cacf35dbf31b0ef919f149" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.com</a>

The Cheesecake Factory restaurant-chain has one of the best interiors of any restaurants I&#39;ve ever eaten at. The murals on the ceiling are beautiful combined with the sand-colored tone throughout the place conjures up a feeling of being transported to a des(s)ert oasis - but with lots of cheesecakes! <br><br>Food-wise, I ordered the lunch carbonara but it didn&#39;t quite do it for me. I kept thinking about the pasta carbonara I had at another restaurant in Central NJ the whole entire time and how I wish I were eating that one instead. It might be because the carbonara at the other restaurant was made with prosciutto which made it more tasty but here at the Cheesecake Factory they just use tiny bacon flakes. I would skip this next time and suggest to the restaurant to consider putting prosciutto in their carbonara dishes because it would be a wonderful improvement. The peppery-ness of the lunch carbonara here was good though, keep that.<br><br>I&#39;m giving this review 4 stars despite so-so carbonara because of the service I received from my waiter today. Super attentive and was able to handle all the constant little requests my party and I had today. Overall, I had a good time and will come back again!

The cheese cake factory is a pretty classy joint. Always a wait, but that&#39;s a sign of a good restaurant.  The place is a tad high but the level of service and quality food make it worth it.<br>The bread is great! I really enjoy all the baked goods too! Must try for any one in the area! The price keeps it from 5

I&#39;m not really a fan.i went here a couple of times and had bad experiences both times. The first time the food gave me a tummy ache and the second time, they got my order wrong and didn&#39;t even budge to fix it. I just had to take what I got. I won&#39;t be going back

I usually go to the Cheesecake Factory in the Willowbrook Mall and I think the food and service is much better in Willowbrook. I ordered a dish from the skinnylicious menu (something with beef medallions) that came out dry and charred bc I wanted the well done. I ended up sending it back at the suggestion of the waitress. The manager suggested I order another dish bc the remake would come out the same. I ordered a cheesesteak sandwich. My main complaint is that I was there for almost 2 hours without ordering an appetizer or dessert. The service at Willowbrook is faster and the food is better.  I wouldn&#39;t be surprised if they spit in my food bc I have a sore throat today.
HORRIBLE SERVICE- waiter was terrible! Super slow and couldnt answer simple question!

Should be 4.5 stars<br>Considering that Cheesecake Factory is a chain, I was pleasantly surprised. We came there for lunch. Excellent service, got very good recommendations. Luau salad was outstanding, with very delicious dressing. Chicken Chili was also very tasty. <br>Will definitely come back.
It worth trying it ! We went two times and tried the pastas. The food quality and portions are good. The Chipotle pasta has a very rich spices and you may not be able to finish your dish.

Worst service ever. It took 30 minutes to get appetizers then they gave me my sandwich with no sauce. The person I was with never got a hamburger that he ordered. Manager was apologizing to everyone all night and forgot about us. Pathetic service! 2nd time this happened to me at this Cheesecake Factory and I will never go back. The funny part is the food is actually pretty good.

I am not discouraging people from coming here but just know that you must come with lots of patience for the shortcomings of the staff. However if you speak Spanish then just ask the bus boy or girl for spoons, napkins basic cutlery to eat and that way you won&#39;t be so upset on having to wait for the waiter to figure it out. Food is okay and plentiful. Very relaxed atmosphere.

I love this place. They have the best salads and appies!!! Best bread too. However, the take out here is disastrous. I&#39;ve been working in the mall almost a year and 9/10 time I&#39;ve taken out from The Cheesecake Factory, there&#39;s been an issue. The portions are always off, they always forget things that you&#39;ve ordered, and it takes a really long time. Service when you&#39;re planning on sitting down isn&#39;t bad, but just warning you from Thursday-Sunday night, expect to wait 45 minutes or more.

Very crowded, loud and besides a booth not enough space between tables.<br>The service is rude and underwhelming. <br><br>Try Houstons nearby much better.<br><br>Will not repeat and the cheesecake sucks or any cake for that matter coming out of this place.

Came to have lunch with my wife and daughter.. went to check in and the host with the piercing through her lip was fooling around while the other host was being serious. We sat down to find a very friendly waitress Kendal. We ordered our drinks and my 1 year olds food. Spaghetti and meatball. <br><br>Her food came right out. I tasted her food as always. Restaurants tend to undercooked pasta for children just to get it out. Anyways when I tasted it it was beyond salty and still kinda raw. The server was very sweet and took it back to the kitchen. She totally understood. She came back very upset stating that the manager couldn&#39;t remake the pasta without salt. This raised several questions to myself. A restaurant this large with so many locations, who claim to make everything here. They don&#39;t have a pot to boil water and make pasta? Well I asked to speak to a manager. A sloppy looking manager with his shirt untucked and stains under his armpits came to the table. Very offensive told us he can not do it. Every time I asked him if they had a pot to boil water he would respond, the pot we use has salt. When I asked if I looked at the kitchen would I find a pot, cause I would cook I if they don&#39;t want to. At this point he told me they would do it but would take a long time. As if he was trying to selling me out of buying the pasta. Needless to say my daughter loves pasta.<br><br>About 15 mins later Kendal returned with a huge smile with the pasta. Again I tasted it the pasta was still undercooked and still salty. Looks like they used pre cooked pasta and tried to wash the salt off. COME ON... the server felt so bad telling us she wanted to cool it right for us but she isn&#39;t a cook. <br><br>the 3rd time it came out I thought for sure the manager would stop by the table. Nope it was the server. Pasta still had salt on it but st this point I was tired of waiting <br><br>I got the Shepard pie which was average<br>My wife got the grilled salmon with mash and asparagus. She asked for it cooked med and it was charred on one end <br><br>We asked them to hold the food until my daughter food came out. It appeared that the food was made and it just sat. Mine was cold and my wife&#39;s was at room temp at best.<br><br>So no one really ate since my daughter takes naps at 12 and started to get cranky. She always naps after lunch today she didn&#39;t eat lunch. Thank Cheesecake Factory <br><br>So when the check came out I thought I would see the manager maybe get an apology from him for my kids food. Nope<br><br>We were charged full price even though my daughters pasta took a 35mins to be cooked right! <br><br>When we left I asked the host the managers name and her response was &#34;he doesn&#39;t like us to tell people his name&#34;. Agains thanks for a $70 lunch that no one ate.

Ok so the foods good. The service is shotty. Theres always a wait and I would rather go to the Grand luxe cafe. I have never tried the cheesecakes. But I have tried their very watered down cocktails- not a fan. The food tastes great but leaves a bloated feeling almost always, even if you have a salad.... Not sure if I am such a fan these days....

My two favorites of Cheesecake Factory (other than the cheesecakes, duh) are their Mexican offerings...<br><br>The Grande Burrito is MASSIVE.  Big enough (seriously) to share or if you plan to do dinner and then a lunch.  I can&#39;t imagine people having it all in one sitting, if you&#39;ve done so, God Bless.<br><br>The other is the chicken stuffed enchiladas.  Again, enough to share but great flavor and those tamale cakes are fantastic.<br><br>Favorite cheesecake is White Chocolate Raspberry.<br><br>Service was particularly good during this visit, waitress was very friendly.<br><br>Side note, whoever designed that hallway to the bathrooms is an idiot.

TCF had moved to a bigger location at riverside sq mall but it seems that they did not hire additional chef to pick up the workload.  We had ordered our food 30 minutes ago and still waiting.  We ordered salad and pasta, how difficult this is that it had to take more than 30min and counting for our food?  Never again!

I do love this place but my experience coming here was a lil different from the last time. The server wasn&#39;t attentive and was pretty rude to me and my group. The food came out good but I was stunned at the lack of service we had there. I used to be a waitress when I was younger and no matter the situation, a smile is a must and patience is a virtue. I normally don&#39;t say bad things but it was a must. I won&#39;t be back at this location anymore.

This is such nice restaurant the setting and the lighting is cozy. Their crispy chicken costelleta (not sure if I spelt that right) is out of this world. The lemon sauce that is drizzled over it adds to the flavor . The Nutella and Godiva cheesecake after dinner is also a plus. Definitely craving that cheesecake now!
Great food and good service! Love their Cheesecakes and lotsa other entrees on the menu!

I came here yesterday around 7:30 pm with my parents and sister . I ordered a veggie burger with no cheese (I&#39;m highly allergic to cheese) of course my burger comes out with cheese. I send it back and they brought me a &#34;recook&#34; only problem was it wasn&#39;t a recook . It was the same burger they just ripped off the cheese . How do I know ? Because there was still some cheese left on it . I was so angry ! People are really so careless that they would really give a person who&#39;s allergic to cheese a burger with cheese ! I wish I ate it though because They would of had the biggest lawsuit they have ever seen on there hands ! This place is dangerous . If you have allergies don&#39;t trust this place they clearly don&#39;t care .

Food is excellent here and staff is friendly and on point. There is nice outdoor seating in the summer. Great cheesecakes! Very popular place so only downside is sometimes the wait time can be pretty crazy like one hour or more!

YES! My cheeseburger tasted like it was cooked 2 nights ago. I will save the time and read to get to the point. My lunch was salty and ugly, and pasta taste so salty we couldn&#39;t even finish 1/4 of it. #struggleisreal and #nogreatcomebackhere.

I personally am a fan of Cheesecake Factory but this was my first time at this location. Of course all the same decor. The staff was really nice. Came here with my boyfriend and his parents. His father was not a fan of their food but he enjoyed his jambalaya. My friend ordered Alfredo sauce with pasta and chicken and he did not enjoy what the waiter recommended. He said it was bland and dry. His mother ordered a sandwich which she said was tough. I ordered the farfalle pasta with chicken onions mushroom and peas and it was delicious. That&#39;s usually what I order from Cheesecake Factory and I usually  enjoy it. It was extra saucy which I loved even more. I would definitely come back as for the people I&#39;m with I don&#39;t think so

I have yet to meet a cheesecake I didn&#39;t like. The salted caramel is my favorite by far. Chicken costeletta, bang bang chicken, miso salmon, are some of my favorites. Their fruit drinks are also delicious! Try a peach Bellini or the pomegranate mojito! Will always come again and again.
The waiters were very attentive and caring and always asked if I was OK,they recommended me salmon and a nice red wine. This place is definitely a must to be at.

Love the food here in general. The decor is fantastic and the waiters try their best but service can vary. It&#39;s a classy place and prices are fair for the portions you get. It&#39;s definitely a great go-to when you want good food and can&#39;t think of anything. Definitely recommend.

Too commercial, the food is already pre prepared, it&#39;s not made to order, no changes are allowed.  This is a sign that the food is bad.  Neither the manager nor the servers  are capable of running this place.  Cheesecake Factory is the third franchise restaurant that&#39;s off my list.  Not worth waisting my money on commercial restaurants.  They should close down these franchises... not healthy...

I love the Cheesecake Factory.  For a chain restaurant, this place is awesome.   I absolutely love the bread they serve, especially the whole wheat.  The menu is endless (sometimes overwhelming) but offers something for everyone.  I&#39;ve tried a lot of dishes in the past few years and I&#39;ve never had anything I didn&#39;t like.  Service is always great at this location and mixed drinks are good as well.  Desserts are also amazing, if I make it to that point!  The one downside is the wait is always crazy long if you come at busy hours ie weekend dinner-time and they don&#39;t take reservations but it&#39;s right in the mall so you can shop or go for a walk while waiting!  If you haven&#39;t been to the cheesecake factory yet, I highly recommend giving it a try!
I usually get there pastas, Fried Mac cheese Burger , Factory Burger, and etc.. Always good. Most of the time their customer service is good. I love their drinks!

Standard cheesecake factory food, so-so service<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this particular cheesecake factory a couple of times. You know what to expect when you visit one. On my last visit I had the veggie burger with a side salad which was excellent. I had this based off of another visit in which someone else had ordered it. I would never typically order a veggie burger but this is the best that they come. I actually didn&#39;t get dessert on this occasion but I think that speaks for itself.<br><br>The service was a little slow and it took about 10 minutes to get our check at the end of the meal. Also, my water glass sat empty for quite a while. <br><br>Overall, if you like cheesecake factory, this one will do just fine.

I am surprised that people actually think this place is in anyway shape or form good / fresh food!!! I haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner in years but recently went for a friends birthday.  First thing I noticed that the menu was 14 pages long, 14! How can freshness be a priority when you have that many items on your menu?<br> I ordered a spicy pineapple margarita.. Aweful.. So bad that I didn&#39;t drink it and our waitress kindly took it off our bill and said yeah, I don&#39;t know why they keep it on the menu everyone hates it.  I ordered from the lighter side of the menu and got the ahi tuna salad. What a disappointment. The tuna slices were sad looking, and the vinaigrette on the salad was a little over powering.  Bad food seemed to be the theme of the evening.  The table to my left sent back their appetizers, and the table to the side of us sent back one of their entrees.. No one seemed happy with their food!!The only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because I tried a couple spoonfuls of my friends cheesecake and it was very good.  I highly doubt I&#39;ll go back..
a verry good place for family hang out, everything was supper tasty and the service was really quick ! highly recommended

UNbelievable!  I&#39;ve generally disliked this place every time I&#39;ve gone, for years, and haven&#39;t been there for a couple of years as a consequence.  And then, this evening, my mother-in-law chose it, so my husband &amp; I took her there for dinner.  And amazingly, we had a pretty good meal!  We live in NYC and we&#39;re accustomed to very good food, and we never ever go to chain restaurants in the City - but tonight we were very pleasantly surprised.<br>I ordered a small Greek salad and the soft shrimp tacos.  There was more feta on the salad than I&#39;d gotten at a diner for lunch a couple of weeks ago.  And the tacos were surprisingly tasty; a bit of a kick, served with lime wedges and a decent (tho&#39; not fresh) salsa.  The ersatz Mexican rice had peas &amp; corn in it, not great but passable.  Can&#39;t complain, for the price($12.95)!<br>My mother-in-law didn&#39;t like any of the menu options, so we asked the server if she could have just plain grilled shrimp with some sides.  She was very agreeable, saying that their menu is so vast that they can meet almost any special request.  So Mom received 4 (5?) grilled shrimp, with a large portion of mashed potatoes that she loved, and a good-sized portion of steamed fresh broccoli.<br>My husband enjoyed his grilled fish tacos, served with a side of rice and black beans.<br>Did I mention that each of the tacos had a slice of avocado on it also?<br><br>Funny, there was an article in The New Yorker a few weeks ago talking about how Cheesecake Factory strives for uniformity and quality while being profitable.  I guess they must be doing something right.

What can I say. It&#39;s &#34; The Cheesecake Factory&#34;. Eat slowly, and carefully. Why?? The desserts!! Many types of cakes and of course, Cheesecake!! I like the Pit Beef Dip sandwich. My wife either the chicken picata, or the bang bang chicken and shrimp. The ice tea is phenomenal. Parking can be difficult, but worth it.

This place was so dirty I did not even get to eat what I ordered. We walked in and the podium the hostesses stand behind was covered in straws and straw wrappers, cups and lids. Between the 7 of them behind there no one could pick this stuff up? We proceeded anyway... They sat us at one of those annoying, small, totally not intimate tables where you&#39;re right on top of your stranger neighbors and have to smell their cheap cologne and whisper if you want to have a conversation that you don&#39;t want others to be a part of. We proceeded anyway. As I was trying to squeeze into the booth end of this table without crushing the shopping mall bags of my stranger neighbors, I slipped on something. I&#39;m going to say it was baby food? I really don&#39;t want to say it was vomit, because I&#39;d lose my shit if it was, so we&#39;ll go with baby food. We proceeded anyway. Slipping in the &#34;baby food&#34; prompted me to peek under the table and the tables of my stranger neighbors. COVERED in garbage and brown bread crumbs and, mine, that peculiar slime. No one had swept or mopped in days. I looked up and the &#34;mural&#34; on the ceiling is COVERED in flies. I gagged, but proceeded anyway. The waitress took our order. My boyfriends salad comes out first. The plate has lipstick smeared all over it. At that point we finally got up, apologized to the waitress, told her how disgustingly dirty that place was and left. I will never set foot into a Cheesecake Factory, ANY Cheesecake Factory, ever again. I&#39;ve eaten in dive bars that were cleaner. Gross!

My family went this Sunday evening for a birthday dinner. Food was okay and about $3 / dish overpriced. Service was mediocre. Our waitstaff served everyone from one end of the table rather than starting from one end and then going to the other. There was definitely enough room to do so and we would have been spared having to pass a cup of hot tea to the other end of the table as well as large glasses filled with soda. We also had to ask for our bread dishes and empty cups/glasses to be removed from the table before dessert was served. When a bill comes to close to $260 for 5, I would hope for better service. Note - fried calamari was excellent - stay away from strawberry shortcake dessert (doughy, heavy, strawberries in a layer on the side rather than between the biscuits) - stick with the cheesecake. Also give yourself 3 hours+ to get from start to finish. No one in our party ordered anything exotic enough to warrant such a long wait. I just read several of the most recent reviews and have seen management&#39;s notes- rather than apologizing over and over again, I would suggest fixing issues that are coming up.

Never had a bad meal here. I love the jambalaya and fish n chips. The breads in the basket are tasty. I recently had the lemon herb chicken. Very tasty and moist. The cheesecake..take your pick, and warm apple crisp are delicious. The only caveat is..u should get there during off hours. Big crowds waiting, but I guess they&#39;re there for a reason. Good service as well.

Went on Saturday night and it was just amazing.  The wait was 10 minutes but worth it.  The Steak Diane was to die for.  My husband loved the shrimp scampi.  Only issue was the lady next to me had 3 kids  under the age of 3 crying.  Wow that was annoying since I left my rugrats at home to enjoy a semi quiet meal lol.  After my first drink I zoned the kids out and had a blast.

I ordered food to pick up at 9:30 and I was told that it will take 20 minutes. It is now 10:09 and I&#39;m still waiting on line for the cashier to pick up my order.she went inside the kitchen and have not come back

Eating here is like driving into NYC and eating at TGIF in Times Square. <br><br>Service is short-handed and getting there is hell thanks to NJ traffic.  Parking lot is almost always full.  Their cheesecake is nothing special and the food is over-loaded with fat(butter/oil), sugar and salt... but this place is bursting at the seams at all times.  <br><br>This place makes me lose faith in humanity.

Horrible service. They made us sit in the corner where I was getting some weird smell. Later my friend realized there was some sticky liquid on the floor maybe cold drink and his shoes got spoiled. It&#39;s pretty expensive for the service we got but the pasta was not bad.

Great cheesecake, scrap the rest.<br><br>Lines are huge here to be seated and eat.  (Waited 3 hours once)  <br><br>Ate many of their salads and entrees.  The steaks are salty and tough, even when ordering their Filet Mignon rare as possible.  (Which came out medium rare and had me asking if what came out really was Filet Mignon.) The salads look green and fresh, but comes out warm, which is unappetizing.  Their sister branch chain Grande Lux Cafe is far better.<br><br>Their cheese cakes are wonderful when looking for variety and for heavy New York Styled cheesecakes.<br><br>Entrees: 1 star.  Desserts:  4 stars.  Hence bottom line 2 1/2 stars.
Garbage!  How does a place voted most unhealthiest restaurant in the country stay in business.  I had bugs in my drink and vegetables so overlooked and processed then should be locked up
First time in a long time at this location. Food is good. Beverages kind of weak. I had the shrimp scampi. Yummy!!

well, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. it&#39;s that diabetes-inducing, heart-clogging wonderland of America. and I love every minute of their food. cheesecake is my reason for living.<br>but the service... my Gd. I couldn&#39;t believe it. my friend and I ordered a ton of food, as all sane people would, and the server actually called us fat. now, I don&#39;t know if he was just straight up trying to get fired, but my friend and I just sat there, too stunned to say anything.

Extremely overpriced; I bought a piece of the chocolate truffle cake in the To-Go section, and they gave a FOURTH of what they serve in the restaurant.<br><br>I pointed this out to the server slicing the cake, and he apologized and handed me another piece that was still about the same size.<br><br>Do not waste your money here; the quality is poor, and you certainly do not get even a fourth of what you paid for.

The food is okay, but definitely not worth the typically long wait and price. On the weekend you need a reservation unless you plan on waiting several hours for a seat.<br><br>I normally go for the cheesecake, which doesn&#39;t require sitting down and doesn&#39;t have as long a wait. The 30th anniversary cheesecake is my favorite. However, as the desserts are fairly expensive I don&#39;t make a habit of coming here. Overall the place isn&#39;t worth the time you spend trying to eat there, but every once in a while it&#39;s fine.

Tuna tartar was flavorful, small, quality.  Lettuce wraps with chicken and mushrooms delicious.  <br><br>Of course, wings, pepperoni pizza and nachos are huge portions and go down easy. Loud but lively at 3pm on a Sunday afternoon.

Love that place! I have been there 4 or 5 times and not once I have been disappointed. Food is always delicious and service is great. The only con is that is extremely loud,the clattering is a bit annoying,but as soon as I take a bite of their avocado eggrolls or a sip of their delicious strawberry lemonade,everything is fine by me.
Always reliable.  Great food, love the pasta and fish.  Love the cheesecake.  Thank you
Not sure how guacamole ended up brown on my take out order ...not the first time I had a bad order here

Celebrated my birthday here and went off with a bang. Didnt have a long wait,sat next to the bar and ordered a few appetizers. The Fried Calamari was pretty good. Not rubbery or too chewy and served with the standard cocktail marinara and the oh so good Garlic Dip which is a twist. The Crab Cakes were so-so, not too deep baked and not too burnt,served on top of crispy noodles.I then went out my comfort zone and ordered the Warm Crab and Artichoke Dip with several grilled slices of bread. The dip was good however i tasted more artichoke and cheese with a hint of crab. Next were the main courses. The Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon was juicy soaked in lemon sauce with 3-4 pieces of asparagus and a big heaping of mashed potatoes and with a side of shrimp scamipi, if you pick the combo for an extra dollar. The mrs had Steak Diane. I also ordered the Filet Mignon. It came out not as fancy as the other two entrees. came in a single dish, just the steak sitting in its juices with a side of fries and two pieces of onion rings. Cutting into it was smooth and the tasted is soft and juicy. Not too tough and ended it with a slice of original Cheese cake. A perfect way to end my birthday.

If I could put 2.5 stars I would because 3 is generous for the experience I had this evening. My friend and I first arrived to a fully packed waiting area which we expected for a saturday night. We were told our wait would be 15 minutes to be seated, which wasn&#39;t bad. However once we were seated everything went downhill. Our waitress was nowhere to be found once we were ready to place our order. 30 mins later we&#39;re finally able to track her down and order. After placing our order we wait almost an hour for our food to finally be delievered. Upon receiving our food we noticed the silverware was missing from the table and asked a nearby waiter for utensils. The first waiter we asked disappeared after we asked him. We waited before asking another nearby waiter who also managed to disappear along with our request. Finally after 30 mins we received our silverware to start eating our now cold food. Honestly, take it to go next time you think Cheesecake Factory.

Long wait to get a table. It is a very noisy place and parking is impossible. Large menu and food is fresh and big portions but quality was average. Drinks are pricey. For the money and cost. there are lots of better places to dine in.

I have been going to cheesecake for years. Its a great date spot but lately it has gone down hill. Past 3 times i went my food was badly burned, they seeved me raw chicken and the waitress denied it was raw, and tha last time i ordered fried zucchini and they were burned n inside were brown. Some hostess dont know anytging about tha menu. On a brighter note the cheesecakes are crazy good! I probably tried atleast everyone and simce have not had any bad ones. My opinion dont sit down and eat take order out cheesecake its much better.
Always a long wait nut well worth it. Had the chicken and biscuits today. It was fantastic. A must very

Been her a few times &amp; I am never disappointed. Love the food &amp; environment. Weekends get crowded so I have my personal assistant always make my reservation. Want a free personal assistant? Reach out <a href="mailto:gr8feeling@aol.com">gr8feeling@aol.com</a>
Great service and food every time I come here.  Can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory :)

Love their cheesecake and mixed drinks... Especially the tropical martini. YUMMM. I was really disappointed when they got rid of the tres leches cheesecake.<br><br>Their menu is large and food is tasty. However the service is lacking here sometimes and if you come on a weekend evening prepare to wait up to two hours even if they tell you 45 minutes

Lost my credit card ther recently. Called immediately and no one got back to me.  Now I have a fraudualnt charge posted and had to cancel the card and put in a claim.  Have called twice and no one has taken the time to call me back.  Very poor customer service.

I had my first yummy experience at The Cheesecake Factory about three months ago and was pleased. :) The portions were huge and the prices were fair for what you get.<br>As for the cheesecake, it&#39;s darn good!  My birthday is in a couple of months so guess where I want to go? :)

It is a very nice restaurant but the food was ok. Appetizer was good we had cheese sticks. I usually get chicken Madeira which was good a little . My husband ordered pasta with sausage and it was salty and my sons grilled chicken was very dry. The mac and cheese had no flavor so I packed jt to go. Heated it up today (next day) and I kid you not it was bathed in mean bathed!!!! In oil I couldn&#39;t heed that to my kid. Other than the bread I give it a two star.
I love the Cheese Cake Factory! Very nice and clean atmosphere. Great customer service and you truly get your money worth. I can&#39;t leave without purchasing two slices of cheese cake.

The first glass of water we received had a fruitfly in it.   We then received  a dirty glass.  The last thing we got was a piece of cheesecake with paper in it. I would never recommend this restaurant go to willow brook

Big fan of cheesecake factory . Make sure to come to this location we have been to the one at willobrooke  mall 2 and had some terrible service and bad food. The avocado egg rolls alone are worth the trip. We have had everything from cobb and bbq chicken salads which are huge portions and always great. Burgers are awesome the mushroom swiss is always a good choice and when you order it rare they actually cook it that way ! My wife loves the farfalle pasta with chicken and garlic. Cuban sandwich the list goes on and on and the Oreo cheese cake and the Adams cheese cake have been my faves lately . If your in there area and want a good meal a good drink and good service stop in. They do get crazy busy most night especially weekends  but its worth the wait

I like this place a lot . The only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the feeling I get after eating here .. It&#39;s the feeling of dying great food and great environment .Love the place though , just needs work on the wait time .

Don&#39;t waste your time here!!!! I have been to multiple Cheesecake Factory locations this location by far is the worse. It is Easter Sunday and I wasn&#39;t in the mood to cook so I figured I would go out to eat I thought it was perfect that they were open but I have to say the service and the food was horrible. My nearest Cheesecake Factory is the Newport Mall location which is normally very busy and a little annoying crowd wise so I figured I would try this location because it was only 30 minutes away from me. The wait time was not bad however the waiter I had was not good at all. It took 10 minutes before someone came to wait in my table I was with my son and my husband, when my waiter (Samir) arrived to my table he introduced himself and asked  to take our drink order since we knew what we wanted we ordered an appetizer and our entrees together. The drinks came very late we got our appetizer before our drinks when our drinks arrived our food took another 20 minutes. I have to say I am very disappointed by the quality of the food at the Riverside Mall location I ordered a grilled salmon with sautéed spinach and asparagus it was literally only cooked not seasoned at all not even a pinch of seasoning. I have had the same entree at other locations and it was amazing this time I was beyond disappointed. I told Samir that I was not satisfied with my food and the reason why I was unpleased and he seem to make me out to be crazy by looking at me with a confused look as if he did not understand my issue. He went to the kitchen and brought back a new plate of sides exactly the same as the original with no flavor what a ever. My husband ordered fried catfish which he said was also cooked poorly. Samir did not take any responsibility for his job he did not show any concern or made any attempt to try to satisfy us in anyway. I didn&#39;t even bother to ask for a manger because I felt like it would be a complete waste of time I got so upset I left my husband to wait for the check after waiting an additional 20 minutes for Samir to return with it. Samir just took our order brought us our food and drinks and never returned to ask if we were ok I think that if you care about service and good food when you want to go out to have dinner you should stay far away from the Cheesecake Factory at the Riverside Mall because they are HORRIBLE at everything!!!

My usual is the Teriyaki Chicken and it&#39;s okay. I am not a big cheese cake fan so my only reason coming to this restaurant is for the AMAZING, and I can&#39;t stress this enough - AMAZING sweet corn tamale cakes. I absolutely love them and they take me back to my country.

Visited the Hackensack CheeseCakeFactory for my birthday, and unfortunately my worse experience of all CheeseCakeFactory I&#39;ve ever been too! Gave us a wait time of 1-1:30 hours, and we&#39;re seated after a 2:15-2:20 min wait! Well after the horrible wait time we had all the time to look through the menu, so we all already knew what we were all gonna order. We all got our meals but my wife who ordered a Salad! Ok, apology accepted, it was on the house. Well to my surprise, I ordered the Chicken Marsala and started chewing on what I thought was hard dry pasta. Well ended up being a strip of plastic! That was a wrap! <br><br>Can&#39;t say that all are bad, but this one is probably one that I&#39;ll never return to again!

The service is good and the food is better.  I usually get a seat, but I sat at the bar today. The popcorn shrimp is in a beer type batter which was awesome. Mini corn dogs were a little oily but delicious. Nachos were okay since the chicken was almost non existant.  Stella on tap is a plus. Turkey club was good, but they use the thicker turkey slices which i don&#39;t care for too much, but the bacon was semi crisp.  The bill was a lot more than what I expected though so expect to pay some hard earned cash in here.
Always packed but that is because the food is always good. The cheesecake is fabulous. It is their specialty. Was that hard to figure out?! Lol

A place I used to call my favorite when I was younger has turned into a place I will never go to again. Not only did I give this Cheesecake a second chance after a terrible experience with undercooked filet mignon 2 years ago BUT I absolutely blame the restaurant for ruining a surprise birthday dinner I planned for my boyfriend. Let&#39;s start with the fact that this crazy busy joint on a Wednesday night in the middle of the summer does NOT take reservations. So going in there 2 weeks early in the blistering heat and finding out they don&#39;t take reservations was disappointing enough. I had to carry on and plan for my party of 12 to arrive an HOUR early (7PM) and get a table. Well, simple tasks just aren&#39;t simple. As I have someone from my party arrive early , the host tells her the table will take an hour to get. &#34;Perfect,&#34; I thought. Wrong. Not only did I have to stall my boyfriend until 815 PM but my surprise did not go as planned. Since a party of 12 adults for a birthday was not the restaurants top priority (and 3 parties of 4 is) we show up at 830 and the host says another 20 minutes (after telling my friend 10 more minutes when I was on the way). Well of course we had to ask for a manager and OF COURSE that is when magically an open table for 12 appeared. To compensate for the ruined surprised we got FREE NACHOS (yay [NOT] )! The service was nothing to brag about. The food and the drinks were probably the only thing I was satisfied about. To add to my disappointment, I asked the host who should I speak to about sending a cheesecake to the table for the birthday boy. Not only did I tell the host &#34;a whole cheesecake&#34; and that my boyfriend does not like chocolate &amp; to make it a cherry cheesecake, BUT when its time to sing happy birthday, they brought one peice of cake and it was chocolate. One last thing: my friend who came in early, as well as myself, and another person from the party requested seperate checks (to the host, manager, and server). Once that time came our server Shey acted as if it was the end of his cheesecakefactory career to split the checks. Now, I have served tables for over 6 years, I get it, it sucks and its a lot of trouble to do, BUT we were are party of 12 from the ages of 23-30!! We all have jobs and proper morale to know how to TIP SUFFICIENTLY if that&#39;s what the server was worried about. Well anyway to wrap it up, this cheesecake (and most likely others) have lost a customer due to terrible service, lack of priority, and because they disregarded each request I had. For a place that you can easily spend 500$ on a full course meal, I suggest going to a mom and pop bar before experience this mess of a business. Good luck
Awesome food. Great service. Have to wait about 15 mins for seating and bit expensive but worth it.

The Cheesecake is truly the highlight of the Cheesecake Factory. The food, not as worthy of five stars but the cheesecake truly makes the experience worth while. Service varies from time to time, yet nothing too bad that would be worth noting. Would also walk in just to get cheesecake alone and take it to go. The wait varies as well, but every time I go there has always been a wait. Sometimes they tel you the wait is really long but it will actually be way shorter which is great! I guess they give you the extreme to prepare for. Overall, 4 stars because I don&#39;t think the food is always the greatest, but great for the price point.
Food is always delicious. Service was slower than most cheesecake factories I&#39;ve visited.

Good comfort food and great cheesecake. They used to have a good pesto dish some years ago, am bummed that it&#39;s no longer offered on the menu. At least their cheesecake has always been consistently good every time I&#39;ve had it.

Where&#39;s the service?? I came yesterday and waited 12minutes for a juice, pasta was dry and cold!!! Today my nephew wanted their pizza so I came back, the soup was ice cold by the time I received it!!! Wtf?? This place is empty why can&#39;t I get my food while it&#39;s still warm??? Seriously get it together Cheesecake Factory

OVERRATED!<br><br>The lines in this place are way too long and not worth it just to have cheesecake. Its pretty good, but I have had better elsewhere. <br><br>The service is also very sloppy and organized. They are very busy but the service people don&#39;t seem able to handle the large amount of customers.<br><br>You can find better elsewhere

Came here for an anniversary and break from a low carb diet (which ruined it indefinitely).. I always love the food here! Had some small plates with my bf.. Hummus was amazing and so were the corn fritters....they were all really good (although we could only eat a few bites from each). Finished the meal with some champagne and cookie dough cheesecake (Yummm).. Fruity drinks during the meal were delicious as well! (peach belini was great)<br><br>Waiter was alright, didn&#39;t have much of a personality. The wait was around an hour, but we came around 8 pm on a Friday night.

We had a horrific experience last night at this location . We asked for a steak with no sauce no seasonings for my 2 kids and it came with sauce. Sent it back and it came back with cracked black pepper. Sent it back and asked for cheeseburgers which came out so late that we asked for them to wrap it up. My shrimp dish and my husbands tuna dish both were saturated in black pepper. They used to be so much better and we were so disappointed mostly for the kids that they didn&#39;t get to enjoy their dinner. I hope you guys pull yourselves together .

I love Cheesecake Factory they have good food, good service a lot of option in the bar and the best dish is the hibachi steak. I&#39;m not a big meat fan but this steak is just art. Our waiter today was very courteous and nice, gave us bread 3 times and the food came fresh like always! A+

Yum yum yum. Everything I&#39;ve ever tried from their insanely extensive menu has been delicious. The pasta dishes are my favorite. You must get the fried Mac &amp; Cheese appetizer; I get this every single time I go. The prices are good and the portions are huge (enough to share with someone else). Not to mention, the cheesecake is one of a kind.

Definitely try the seafood/chicken gumbo if you&#39;re not afraid of spicy food! The calamari appetizer is surprisingly very fresh. Of all the pastas on the menu, our top pick is the Garlic Noodles because it&#39;s the least heavy. Our favorite dessert is the Godiva cheesecake.

It took 15 minutes to get through to place an order, was put on hold for 10 minutes and had to call back several times. Then when arrived could not get through main line and  when called curb side pick up line. 201 488 7835 nobody answered. Called again and when about to be placed on hold again asked  for manager. He said curb side pick up phone line does not exist. When I asked why it&#39;s on their website he said it&#39;s not up to him and that he will call General Manager. To me at that point I  did not want to come back and if I did not have a gift certificate from my son, I would turn away during my one hour adventure many times. That&#39;s ridiculous that such a big famous brand chain has this low level of customer service, miscommunications, no focus on how to deliver a smooth order and purchase transactions.
Pasta Davinci is glorious. Horrible wait on busy nights, but well worth it :)

Don&#39;t bother. 1 hour for fish tacos &amp; kale salad. No explanation or comp until asked.  Yes I know it&#39;s not fine dining but half hearted mea culpa while asking for something to ease their error is unacceptable. The management should be let go. As it their responsibility to train staff how to handle kitchen miscues.
Wooow its been 1 hour we still waiting for food and not even the salad is here!!!! This is ridicilous. The waiter is absolutely mean and terrible server!! Will never ever sit on her table again!!!

I love it here!  The food is great, the service is awesome and the cleanliness is appreciated.  My only wish was that the bar area was bigger.  There is almost always a wait, so it would be beneficial to have a large bar area where customers can sit and have a drink while they wait.  Other than that, I enjoy coming here.

Not a huge fan of the place but like someone else said, it&#39;s an ok option when at the mall.  Although I&#39;d rather pick Houston&#39;s in heartbeat.  <br><br>The menu is way too large that it&#39;s obvious they can&#39;t do all those dishes well.  If it was paired back, it&#39;d be much better.  <br><br>I&#39;ve been ordering from the &#39;healthier&#39; menu lately since I think Cheesecake is always rated in the worst category in terms of healthy choices.  <br><br>Service has usually been decent, although it ALWAYS takes forever when asking for something extra like ketchup or dressing.  <br><br>Obviously the cheesecake is pretty damn good though.  I&#39;ll splurge and split a slice with a few friends every once in awhile!

It just keeps getting worse. And i cant tell if my tolerance for mediocre food is just lower or the quality is just going down. Which is wierd b/c its in a snazzy mall. Pasta alfredo was so salty. Spaghetti was bland. Chicken fingers were fine but nothing special. Buffalo wings were actually decent. Not worth the price.

Took my mother here for the first time. Our waiter was fantastic! We ordered the dynamite shrimp and firecracker salmon appetizers. Everything was delicious and our waiter made every effort to make sure my mom had a great experience.  We had the red velvet cheesecske for dessert and as usual, it never disappoints. Great experience,  will definitely be back.

Our waitress seemed to care more about her phone than us. It was my boyfriends first time here and now it will be the last (i love cheesecake factory so this is very disappointing) I said 3 times i would like a hibiscus lemonade and was brought a regular one. Our appetizers took 30 minutes to come out and by the time our food was brought out we had to leave. We couldn&#39;t find our waitress the whole time we were here! We ended up eating our food then we asked for boxes and to-go cake which also took way too much time. I asked the waitress to split the bill and she made it seem like a problem. Don&#39;t waste your money here. If you get sat with a waitress named alexis, request for a different waitress quick!

What we ordered:<br>- Dynamite shrimp, yum! (especially the chipotle sauce)<br>- Fried calamari, yum!<br>- Pasta Da Vinci, ok (two of us liked it, the other two of us were meh about the sauce)<br>- Crispy chicken costoletta, yum!<br>- Grilled mahi mahi special, BIG FAT NO...<br>- Key lime cheesecake, yum!<br>- Oreo dream extreme cheesecake, yum!<br><br>Food: 3/4 stars<br>Everything was pretty tasty. The appetizers and cheesecakes in particular are delicious. Our main complaint was the &#34;grilled mahi mahi special.&#34; The dish came with two small pieces of fish, while the other 2/3 of our $21.95 plate was mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli (most which were yellowing and looked unfresh). The fish tasted OK, and was only slightly better after slathered with lemon sauce. Do not recommend this dish in particular.<br><br>Value: 2 stars<br>Portions are large, but still way overpriced. Definitely unhappy about how much we paid for the mahi mahi.<br><br>Service: 3 stars<br>The wait to get a table is way too long (especially on weekends! We came Saturday at 2:30 and had a ~30 minute wait for a party of 4), and the waiting area is crowded and has limited seating. Parking is also a pain in the butt. However, our waiter was great- informative, attentive and not too overbearing. The food also came out pretty quickly. <br><br>Ambiance: 3 stars<br>Clean, well-lighted, pretty average décor.<br><br>Not one of our favorite restaurants (especially because of the crowds and long wait times), but often a last resort when we can&#39;t think of where else to go.
My husband and I had our wedding anniversary dinner here. It was a fun experience. The food was plentiful and we didn&#39;t have to wait for a table thanks to their special seating area.

Disappointed<br>Good: We were seated immediately since it was just me and my wife<br><br>BAD: The Server definitely does not like his JOB and should probably not be in the service industry, it&#39;s not for everyone, I get it. I go to this specific Cheesecake fairly often and have always had a great experience but not Today, NO SIR. The Server comes to our table does not tell us about the Specials, does not care to ask us about beverages and walks away taking our order as a favor to us. He comes back a few minutes later with 2 glasses of water and say &#34;Did you say you wanted water&#34; No Sherlock I wanted a drink but you did not ask. <br>My Wife wanted mash potatoes as a side order which never showed, the Alvarado Egg rolls seemed like they had been kept on the side for a while before it made it to our table, they were skinny and soggy. The rest of the dinner was ok, cause the Chicken did not show up to work and definitely was missing in my dish, but by then my wife and I just wanted to eat and get out. <br>We asked for a take out box which showed up after a wait and without a bag. All in all I don&#39;t think the Server deserved a tip but we still left one. <br>Cheesecake of Hackensack, I will give you one more chance to Wow me after which you&#39;re off the list permanently.

I give this place a 4 stars just because I like their Cajun Jambalaya Pasta.. Awesome dish.. could never go wrong on that one.. They have nice shrimp appetizers.. I think Bang Bang shrimp or Dynamite Shrimp... The cocktails are pretty nice and they have lots of variety.. I dont like parking in this mall... Unless you go after 10pm you are bound to be out of luck for parking..
Great restaurant in town. Excellent food and service. My favorite dish is Crusted chicken Romano and for dessert fresh strawberries cheesecake.

*Must Try: Chicken Piccata (Sautéed Chicken Breast with Lemon Sauce, Mushrooms, and Capers. Served with Angel Hair Pasta.) And Chicken and Biscuits (Sauteed Chicken Breasts Covered with Gravy. Comes with Mashed Potatoes, Vegetables, and Buttermilk Biscuits.)<br>*Dessert: Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake. Tiramisu. (Not the cheesecake, this one was under &#39;Specialty Desserts&#39;.) Can&#39;t go wrong with their dessert here.<br>*you can&#39;t compare Junior&#39;s to Cheesecake Factory. Both are amazing. But can we please bring a CF closer to NYC?

Oh my god, spare me the snotty elitist attitude about popular chain restaurants.  I love it when people have to hate the big guy when all he is is big.  I will grant you, Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t a fine dining restaurant, but there is nothing wrong with it--it is a lot of fun, the food is decent, and you wind up with leftovers.  And excuse me--you think you can get a better meal at Houston&#39;s than you can at Cheesecake Factory?  Please.  It&#39;s practically the same menu--steaks, salads, cheesy goopy appetizers.  <br><br>I keep saying this--it&#39;s all about managing expectations.  It isn&#39;t McCormick and Schmick.  It&#39;s a loud, fun, busy, tasty place.  That&#39;s it.  If you don&#39;t want to wait, there are a number of other restaurants now at the Shops at Riverside, a new addition to the mall with Maggiano&#39;s Little Italy, PF Chang&#39;s Bistro, Rosa Mexicano and other similar high-quality chains.  If you do want to wait--and you will--they hand out beepers, so you can head into the Barnes and Noble next door, or head into Bloomingdales, also next door.  <br><br>I have come to this location of CF at least ten times since it opened about ten years ago, with crowds, with family, and alone, and it never fails to satisfy.  If you like bargains, this is the place for you.  If you like abundance, this is the place for you.  If you like variety, this is the place for you.  I didn&#39;t realize that tourists patronized Riverside Square Mall, but I guess if you live in Nyack, you could be considered a tourist, if you come to avoid sales tax on clothes and stop off for a salad before heading back to the Palisades Parkway.<br><br>I will say the cocktails are pretty bad.  As did other Yelpers, I also ordered a strawberry martini.  It&#39;s vile.  Don&#39;t do it.  <br><br>The latest thing they offer is small plates of some of their most popular dishes at the bar from 4-6 PM at reduced prices.  Caesar salad was substantial, garlicky and $2.95.  Three sizeable balls of fried mac and cheese on a bed of pink sauce was $3.95.  Ahi tuna tempura roll was tasty, light and yet filling, and was $4.95.  A reasonable way to try a number of dishes and not get enormously stuffed.  Also, no leftovers.  <br><br>Personally, I think while $6.50 for the 6-carb cheesecake is a little steep, when you throw in a slice of carrot cake so big and dense and intimidating you need to invite people to eat it with you for $6.50, it all evens out.<br><br>Yes, it&#39;s a chain.  So is everything else these days.  The thing about Cheesecake Factory is that the food tastes like it has a point of view.  I don&#39;t feel like I am going to hell for eating there.   Everything doesn&#39;t have to be a new culinary adventure and a flirtation with a violent bout of food poisoning to keep me feeling vibrant and alive.

WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY EVER!!!! We went there on a Saturday night hoping to enjoy some good food. They told us that we would wait for 15-20 mins. And we waited. In 15 mins they called us and showed us our table. When we sat at our table our waiter came and took brought us our drinks. Just when we thought that the service was great, our waiter disappeared and didn&#39;t come back for 30 mins!!!! We didn&#39;t want to wait for 30 mins so we talked to the host saying that nobody took our orders. She called her manager and when the manager came he said that he was talking to our waiter, since there was a problem with him. We didn&#39;t like the manager&#39;s attitude, since he looked like he didn&#39;t care. We asked to be seated at another table. Our second table was a disaster, too. Our waitress took our orders, and brought our food just on time. I ordered pasta, and I asked if she could bring some parmesan with the pasta. While she was putting the parmesan on the pasta, her hand slipped and parmesan got all over me!!!! She started laughing like it was funny. All in all waiters in this place are rude, and food is the worst of all the cheesecake factories in U.S.  DO NOT GO THERE!!!

Cheesecake Factory is a chain restaurant that is most popular for certain thing they are good at and that is their cheesecake of course. I definitely recommend the Brownies Sundae, but the food is just ok as I have the Glam Burger and I really couldn&#39;t taste anything but grease in every bite.. It supposely came with fried Mac and Cheese but i could see it but there was no taste..<br><br>I will consider just coming here for dessert rather than the food.

I can actually say I have never been to a cheesecake factory where I&#39;ve actually been disappointed and this place holds true to that rule. The parking can be a little difficult at times but this place is always booming with a nice mixed crowd. Food is consistent. Service is as well.
Went here a while back. Ordered a salad, don&#39;t recall the shard of metal in it being on the menu, though. 0/10 wouldn&#39;t recommend.

One of a few good reasons I now live out in the &#39;burbs: Nothing beats the cheesecakes here! I have yet tried half of the cheesecakes on their menu but I always look forward to trying a different one each time. <br><br>Their food reflects a wide range of cuisines, big portions, decent prices, &amp; we&#39;ve not had anything bad here yet. The service here can be a bit spotty &amp; the wait during peak hours are notoriously long (at least 15 mins but we&#39;ve waited over 30 mins sometimes). <br><br>Still, I always look toward the end of the meal where I get cheesecake! (Sorry, Junior&#39;s, I don&#39;t think your&#39;s is as good...)

Not the biggest fan of Cheesecake Factory, but this one ain&#39;t so bad.<br><br>I&#39;ve enjoyed their Sunday brunch specials.  They have delicious french toast.<br><br>This trip, I noticed they had a brand new page of snacks and small plates, which was just perfect for me.  They offered fire roasted artichokes, sausage and cheese stuffed olives, stuffed dates, and other interesting sounding small plates.   Sure beats the typical sliders, spinach/artichoke dip or any other deep fried fare you&#39;d normally get.. <br><br>Since I wasn&#39;t really hungry, I tried to be somewhat healthy and opted for the fire roasted artichoke w/two dipping sauces - garlic aioli and some spicy vinegarette.  The artichoke was ok.. there wasn&#39;t really enough plant meat on it for it to be worth getting.. one thing I learned though you can dip a shoe in garlic aioli and it&#39;ll taste delicious.<br><br>My friend and I shared a caesar salad (good) and the spinach artichoke dip, also good - not very saucy, but tasted fresh and not greasy.<br><br>The topper was the red velvet cheesecake they offered.. <br><br>RED VELVET CHEESECAKE<br><br>it&#39;s a cheesecake . w/red velvet cake and frosting..!!!! It tastes as decadent as it sounds =) <br><br>Yum<br><br>bill for small plates and a slice was $30 somehow..<br><br>and really good service, our waitress was super nice and attentive
Thai lettuce wraps, but the waaaaaiiiiiiiiiiittt like everyone I&#39;ve been to, from RI to FL.

The menu is so big! Sometimes that is a problem when you&#39;re hungry because you cannot decide what you want. Some of the things I have enjoyed here are the pretzel encrusted chicken, polenta fries, chicken samosas, and Asian chicken salad (one of my all time favorites). I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake but their pumpkin cheesecake is amazing!

I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m actually writing a review on a popular chain mall destination restaurant but... I can&#39;t help myself damnit! This place is Awesome!<br><br> Rarely do I (Miss NY City Girl) get the treat of eating at &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; being that there are none in the city of New York and to visit one you must have car which I don&#39;t have. Or you have to drive, and I don&#39;t know how to that yet either (yes, i&#39;m 25 and can&#39;t drive). So when I do have the pleasure of being in a car and i&#39;m in the New Jersey or Long Island area or shopping at the MALL...it&#39;s CHEESECAKE FACTORY TIME BABY! ;o)<br><br> I am a super pig when it comes to their fresh free bread baskets. The bread is really good! Almost all their dishes are my favorite, I honestly can&#39;t pick one out that I like better than the other. The dishes are HUGE, I always have enough to take home with me and eat for dinner almost the next two days after.<br><br>The drink selection here is surprisingly good also. Really good mixed drinks and of course you can&#39;t leave with sharing or taking home a piece of cheesecake. That is after  you take 3 hours to decide after looking through their 500 diff types of cheesecakes lol. <br>My advice.... go for the Adams Cheesecake. It&#39;s a done deal! ;o)
SO .... The servers were annoying and truly wanted to be someplace else.  THe food was ok.  But I was more annoyed with the attitude of the servers.  just lazy.

To be honest, I&#39;m not really a huge fan of Cheesecake but it&#39;s a decent option when at a mall.  <br><br>The good thing about Cheesecake is their selection is huge.  There&#39;s something for everybody.  For apps, we had the nachos and fried artichoke hearts.  The nachos were very good and the artichoke hearts were okay.  <br><br>For entree, I had the shrimp pasta special.  The portions on this was huge.    But flavor is lacking.  <br><br>Hubbie got the tacos.  The portions on this was not as good.  <br><br>One of our friends had the shepherd&#39;s pie.  Worst looking shepherd&#39;s pie ever.  The meat itself wasn&#39;t right.  It looked like salisbury steak.  Then it was covered with a little bit of mashed potatoes.  The potatoes looked hard and not that appetizing.  <br><br>The service was  good though.

I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over the place. I have to say that the Hackensack location is definitely one of the most disappointing. <br><br>The food here is continually mis-executed. I had the Hibachi steak the other day and my steak was not cooked right and my mashed potatoes were very old. Other meals I&#39;ve had here in the past were not at the same level as other locations. The service at this location is inconsistent too. <br><br>Its not a bad option if you&#39;re stuck in the mall, but don&#39;t expect it to be as good as other locations.

Sitting outside on a gorgeous night as the ambulances, police card and fire engines  are screaming by on route 4. The service was attentive, the salad satisfying and the pumpkin cheesecake was orgasmic!  Thank you Cheesecake Factory!

Every once in a while, I like to indulge in a day of suburbia and drive across the GWB to Route 4, which is the highway of supermalls and big box stores. <br><br>I love their huge salads. BBQ chicken and Luau are especially good. Their burgers are great too if you want to eat yourself silly. You could easily put together a 2000 calorie meal with an entree and a dessert. <br>It&#39;s also fun to see the ridiculous amounts of food that people get... and gawk at their huge plates of pasta and chicken. <br><br>This CF is in a huge mall with high end stores like Ferragamo, Louis Vuitton, Cartier... Kind of funny that the people who shop at these stores eat at Cheesecake Factory and McCormicks and Scmicks... but I guess that&#39;s life outside NY. To further extend a day of suburbia, you can drive down to the Bergen Commons mall a mile or so west on Route 4 and shop at the new Target, Whole Foods, and Nordstrom Rack.

I&#39;m not into chain restaurants, but the Cheescake Factory is pretty damn good.  This is the only location I&#39;ve tried, and everything went pretty well the few times I&#39;ve visited.<br><br>Clean, bright, and inviting atmosphere.  Extremely lengthy and varied menu with quite a few vegetarian options.  This is always very nice.  So, yeah, the food is pretty decent; however, I&#39;m not a huge fan of the cheesecake.  It&#39;s ok, but I&#39;ve certainly had better.<br><br>I imagine all of their locations are busy, but each time I&#39;ve been to this Hackensack location at Riverside Square*, I&#39;ve had to wait an hour plus for a seat.<br><br>*check out the Shops at Riverside or Riverside Sq Mall (whatever you wanna call it) (see review)
Food is good, hostesses are rude though and the restaurant is drafty in the winter the temp of the place is not well maintained. Servers are friendly and courteous.

I&#39;m convinced this must be Bergen County late teens/early 20s mecca.<br><br>Have passed by considering stopping there to eat, only to be shocked by the massive line and giant crowd, vibrating buzzers clutched firmly in hand, outside.<br><br>I did eat here for lunch awhile back, and was pleasantly surprised by the price/portions of the salads ratio. The taste was fine.<br><br>As for the cheesecake, I had a bite. It&#39;s okay. I&#39;m spoiled by New York and real bakeries.<br><br>I guess that about sums it up really. Why stand in line for Cheesecake Factory when a 20 minute drive could put you at a great New York restaurant with no wait?<br><br>Hm.
The food is great lots of variety I&#39;m not a fan of the seating you&#39;re so close to people unless you get a booth

So-so food, crappy music and  watery mixed drinks. This place is a haven for tourists from bum-fuck nowhere, bearded men in their 40&#39;s who are on vacation with their wives with their badly sun bleached super frizzy hair. <br><br>&#34;Honey I got the tickets to San Francisco, city of love! &#34; *Shaking tickets to his wife in her herb garden.<br><br>&#34;Oh Lester..&#34; *putting spade up to shield the sun from her eyes. &#34;I love you so much, it&#39;s like a second honey-moon. Remember the 60&#39;s?&#34;<br><br>*Lester peers into the mountains from his porch, hearing gunfire in his head and the sound of people screaming...............<br><br>Omg, I blacked out. What was I writing. Whatever, I&#39;ve never gotten the Cheesecake. Even if it was made of gold and diamonds and cocane it would only bump this joint up to 3 stars.

I took my mom here for dinner last night, since neither of us had been to a CF in years. We used to go to the one in White Flint Mall, in the Washington, DC area.<br><br>Anyways, some of the tried and true dishes are still on their varied and long menu, including the Tex-Mex Egg Rolls, which were as good as both of us remember.<br><br>I had a Santa Fe salad, which was as yummy and huge (I only was able to finish half of it) as I remember it being from years past, and my mom had some shrimp pasta dish which I think she enjoyed, since there was none left on her plate.<br><br>She tried to get me to order a slice of cheesecake so that she could have a &#34;bite&#34; but I&#39;m not a cheesecake fan at all, so we just had some coffee.<br><br>This place is huge, but it still gets busy and while the waitstaff pays attention to detail, they aren&#39;t always around. One big advantage is that if this place is too crowded, there are 6 other restaurants in the mall to go choose from.

Sunday lunch-Crispy Cuban Rolls, very good as always- the server who we&#39;ve had previously, very nice. Margherita pizza and interaction with the manager, not great. The pizza was dry and tasteless, if you want similar ingredients order the Flat Bread with cheese, tomato and basil-very tasty. We ordered Ultimate Margaritas not too much ice (hate when drinks get watery), these are normally delicious. Drinks arrived in the smallest daiquiri glasses we&#39;ve ever seen so we asked the server if this was the correct drink and she stated we ordered regular, not Ultimate Margaritas as we have in the past. She offered to exchange the drinks. The manager then came to our table to ask what the problem was. He proceeded to explain that when you order a drink with less ice, you get a glass that is not filled, just as ordering a soda with less ice you will get less soda. We were shocked he came over as this was already resolved. We explained that we know what to expect when limiting ice as we always order drinks this way so they don&#39;t get watery and we ordered this very drink a week prior at Cheescake. We further explained that the issue was a regular not an Ultimate was ordered. He said okay and again mentioned the glasses would not be filled. Ultimately, the Ultimate Margaritas arrived with not limited ice but only 2 ice cubes and warm...SMH. So, not only were the pizza and drinks unenjoyable but that interaction made us uncomfortable.

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory.  Obviously one location of a large restaurant chain.  If you&#39;ve been to one, you&#39;ve been to them all.  However, this is one of the smaller restaurants.  It&#39;s standard middle of the road restaurant fare.  What&#39;s nice is the incredibly huge menu selection - definitely something that everyone would like here.  I would recommend the very spicy Jamaican shrimp which is served with rice and beans and a mango salsa, or the tuna tataki salad which is light yet filling.  Those are my two favorites.  <br><br>The portions are obscenely huge.  Always bring enough home for another meal or two.  The atmosphere is nice - casual, relaxed, fun.  It&#39;s great to go with a group of friends.  <br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at this one several times.  On two separate occasions, they have screwed up my order.  Once was a problem with strange ingredients in my Caesar salad, and the other time was a similar problem with a pasta dish.  Perhaps the kitchen is so busy that they get sloppy.  Both times my meal was comped.  <br><br>Of course, the cheesecake is the real star of the show.  Go in November or December and order the pumpkin cheesecake - it is their absolute best!

So I went here 3 days ago on a Saturday for my birthday with a party of 5 total. The wait time alone was 75 minutes. We stood in the vestibule all that time. Mind you, im not a fan of chain restaurants, but Ive heard a lot about the CF and decided to give it a whirl for my special occasion. The good: cheesecake in all varieties. I had the tiramisu cheesecake and it was a generous slice of deliciousness! The menu items are reasonably priced between $9-30.<br>The bad (brace yourself): The food! I had the steak Diane &amp; Salmon combo. My steak was overcooked for being medium well. Both meats were bland. The mashed potatoes and asparagus were the only tasty items on my plate. My sister&#39;s Bang Bang chicken looked and tasted  like regurgitated indian food. Yuck! The plates are huge, the tables are small. Thats a recipe for an accident. My mom spilled her larger than life glass of coke and it shattered all over the floor. Another  table, 2 booths away also smashed glass like they were at a Greek wedding. The frozen drinks come non-alcoholic yet were tasty. All in all, the food was not worth the time nor money spent. I advise you try the Houston&#39;s restaurant 2 doors down.

Weate at the cheesecake factory last night. Patria sat us at a table and she was very pleasant to us but we saw she was pleasant to everyone she sat. Our waiter Mike was terrific. With a big crowd our service was great.

PARENTS STAY AWAY!!  I give these guys one star because I have no choice. Rude staff, lack of proper management and nonexistent customer service. After waiting an hour for a table, which is common here, we waited an additional twenty minutes after our buzzer went off. Typically if the place is packed this is understandable, but when they start sitting groups (of the same number of people) that came in after us there is a problem. Our extra wait was due to having small children with us. In my opinion this is unacceptable. My children are very well behaved, even with a hour and a half of wait. But the staff there simply continued to sit others. When we approached the hostess, she was very dismissive and extremely rude. They just don&#39;t really care!! I recommend you take your business and your money somewhere else , we definitely did!!

I&#39;m definitely a fan of the cheesecake factory. The appetizers and entrees are definitely very yummy, and if I gain a few pounds from the huge portions... well it&#39;s worth it!<br><br>Appetizers: I like the Ahi Tuna and the pot stickers. Since the entrees are so large, I generally do not get an appetizer.<br><br>Entrees: I generally get the beef ribs. The ribs are huge (they are beef, after all) and the meat is so tender that it falls right off the bone. The BBQ flavor tastes like it&#39;s been slowly cooked in, and I only wish I had enough room left over for the sides that come w/ the dish.<br><br>The burger is also a must try. They put hand battered onion rings into the burger so you get a bit of a crunchy texture as you bite in. The burger is also quite large such that it is usually pretty difficult to finish everything. <br><br>The hibachi steak is usually very tender with a light sauce. Not my favorite, but still very enjoyable. <br><br>Desserts: I ALWAYS get the chocolate cake with ice cream. The cake is fantastic, very moist with 4 or 5 layers of very rich chocolate icing. You get this HUGE slice, and with the ice cream and whipped cream, it is decadent. That being said, I&#39;ve tried their cheesecake and was not very impressed.<br><br>The price is quite reasonable given the large portions and the tasty food. Also, as an &#34;up scale restaurant&#34; an entree that runs you $15 to $30 is really not that bad.<br><br>My only issue is that they do not take reservations, which means that you will be waiting at least an hour (if not longer) to be seated on a Friday or Saturday night. At least it&#39;s located as part of the riverside mall so you do have the option of browsing the surrounding shops (not that many) while waiting.

Always a super long wait time and extremely chaotic inside. Even after the buzzer goes off to tell you that your seat is ready, there was another 10+ mins wait until we were finally seated. Our water took forever to arrive. Took a long time for the waiter to come around to get drink orders. When we finally got to place our order which included a turkey burger, we were told that they were out of turkey.
