With a menu that extensive, running out of anything was a complete surprise and a total disappointment. Service was meh which is consistent with my experiences at this location. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired.

Good for a chain resturaunt. The wait can get long around peak hours, especially since it&#39;s in a mall, but if you can get there early and brave the eardrum assault, it&#39;s worth it. There&#39;s plenty of good food, the staff is friendly, and it offers an all-around good experience. Oh, and leave room for dessert. It&#39;s hard, but it&#39;s worth it<br><br>The menu is massive, if you&#39;ve never been to a Cheesecake Factory before. There&#39;s room for full-page ads on it. It&#39;s a book of food selection, totalling at around 15 pages.<br><br>My Smokehouse BBQ Burger was above average. Not bad at all, but not absolutely amazing. It was a solid burger, though. The fries came in a little can, which was cute. Another person ordered the pizza, and was left a little disappointed due to its sogginess and the incredibly thin (and soggy) crust.<br><br>The Godiva Chocolate Brownie Sundae was heavenly, but I could only finish half of it lest I burst in an explosion of calories and sugar. The other people at my table ordered the Hershey&#39;s cheesecake and the Strawberry Shortcake. They enjoyed their desserts as well.<br><br>Oh, and the parking can get crazy. We had to park a ways away, but again, it&#39;s in a mall, so that&#39;s forgivable.<br><br>All in all, would go again, but not after 5; The wait gets crazy past then!
The service is super slow... If you decide to come here and get stressed over the slow service, I&#39;d recommend ordering the Thai Lettuce wrap..

I love Cheesecake Factory because there&#39;s soo much to choose from and they give you big portions for a good price. I&#39;ve been here twice and it&#39;s been nothing but great customer service and great good. I wish there were more locations so I don&#39;t have to drive an hour but it&#39;s so worth it.

Hmm... This menu is far too big. I come here semi-frequently and try something new everytime. I have been here like 20 times and don&#39;t have a go to dish yet because nothing is THAT GOOD. I&#39;d pass unless your shopping in the mall.

Great food! Everything from the menu is delicious! You just can&#39;t go wrong.<br><br>You are seated right away. The menu is vast and at decent prices. The service is fast. The servings are huge. You get tons of food. Two people can share an entree.<br><br>The cheesecake is to die for! Junior&#39;s in NYC is no match for these guys!<br><br>I always have a pleasant experience whenever I go. <br><br>Highly recommended.

Last year, I reedemed my rewards from AMEX with a bunch of Cheesecake factory giftcards and since then we have been frequenting this place. <br><br>I like Cheesecake factory in general. One thing that I don&#39;t like about Cheesecake factory is that I feel like there is too much pressure in terms of turning the tables. Almost every single time we went there, we are in-and-out in one hour and first half hour is spent in the waiting area. So the average dining duration is only half an hour and I hate that. It truly is a factory that takes you in and fixes your stomach and kicks you out. When I go out, I would like to enjoy the ambiance and the company of my friends. It is not just merely about the taste of the food. If it was only the taste and quality of the food, I would rather stay at home, since both me and my husband can cook spectacular dishes.

I have been @ cheesecake factory over 100 times and really enjoy the food, the decoration of the restaurant. My wife and I find this exceptional. However we have an experience yesterday that we didn&#39;t like. we arrive at the restaurant just after opening hour 11Am and my wife ask the host if we can be seated next to the window, there were only 3 other table occupied at that time. The host explain to us,nicely that those table are for more than 2 person.That&#39;s fine if is a general police of the restaurant. However what I find insulting is that the same host seated 4 different couples in the tables by the windows. If there is a rule I understand but if is apply to all costumers, no only for the ones that fell like. everybody is there to enjoy good food and have a good time.  I drove from NYC to enjoy one of my favorite place. Its only fare to say t to be that I only want treated the same as any other pay costumer. We never ask for anything else. <br>if anybody wish to contact me
Great food. Love the appetizers!! Calamari is amazing. Over all great food, big menu, big portions and reasonable prices.
Most of the menu will satisfy your taste buds.  Portions are enough to take home no matter what type of eater you are.  Mixed and specialty drinks are quite tasty too.

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory?  This restaurant really has it going on.  From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave, you have an amazing time and experience.  The atmosphere is great, the servers really know their stuff and the food (especially the cheesecake) is to die for!

The biggest worry when going to ANY Cheesecake Factory is the amount of waiting time. I went there with a date last weekend (on a Saturday night) and we only had about a 20 minute wait.<br><br>Upon getting seated, I was worried we&#39;d be waiting FOREVER for the waiter and food for the dinner. However, everything was the COMPLETE opposite. Even with the place packed with people, the service was prompt and extremely efficient with our orders.
We love this place and always have a great meal..Drinks are also great. Could be a little cheaper....

Good chain. I like their service. I wish that they&#39;d let you know that the chicken piccata was more of a creamy base, more like a francaise.<br>How can you expect to get a perfect cheesecake when you offer dozens of them? Obviously they&#39;re frozen and mass produced. <br>Damn, get with the program people! Be a little bit more insightful and realize the sub-categories of dining establishments and rate accordingly.

I went here recently and even though I have gone to several other in various cities this one was pretty GOOD. The service at the bar (where I sat because it was packed) was impeccable. I absolutely LOVED my bartender! He was so attentive, friendly and helpful. <br>My only faux-paw with my overall experience is fairly similar at all chain restaurants I go to... over doing portion control! As a patron and bartender I feel bartenders should be able to free pour... <br><br>But otherwise a Nice place!
A little on the pricey side, too long of a wait, but you get what you expect. Good service, nice staff, clean bathrooms and good food.

I will never go back to the Cheesecake Factory at The River Side Square mall in Hackensack again after witnessing the bartender sticking his finger in a customers drink to serve to a customer that sent back her drink it. A few servers watched and laughed. When I reported the incident management on all levels they where condescending to me and blew off the incident. It&#39;s a shame it was on of my favorite places. I will now give Houston&#39;s my business.

See a lot of reviews saying the wait is too long. They must be doing something right, I know when I go there plan on waiting a half hour. The food selection is great and the prices fair. They seem to have plenty of staff to keep things moving as quickly as possible. I never had a bad meal there.
Food is great, portions are big...I love the cheesecake. <br>There is a couple of things i dont like: <br>1. Too expensive<br>2. Very loud

One of the only food chains that I have enjoyed for a long time now. They have pretty much anything your stomach wants. The one in Hackensack is almost always packed but if your only a table of two you will be seated quickly. Staff have always been professional and polite. I have enjoyed the Kobe Beef Burgers, tempura fish tacos and the usual advocado eggrolls and sweetend green tea with free refills.

I&#39;ve eaten here way too many times. I still like it once a month now. I have been weaned off my edible crack, however I can and will have that relapse. I suggest the Orange Chicken. <br><br>The specials never change. I never order them.<br><br>I will eat at least 2 baskets of their wheat bread. <br><br>Corporate food, me encanta tu!

If you&#39;re looking for great food, you have to check this place out at least once. Situated in the Riverside Square Mall, this restaurant has great food with huge portions (not for the faint of heart). My personal favorite is the Steak Diane - great mashed potatoes. They have a nice beer menu, one of the few restaurants I know of that serves Sierra Nevada.<br><br>If you&#39;re a health nut or on weight watchers, you probably will want to steer clear of this place - it&#39;s not exactly the healthiest. For the few of us with great metabolisms, you&#39;ll leave VERY full. This is not a place for those with tight budgets - I&#39;ve easily spent over $100 for two, many times (not that there&#39;s anything wrong with that, but it will hurt if you&#39;re college age).<br><br>As the name suggests, this place is famous for serving two menu pages worth of cheesecake slices; it would be sacrilege not to order something from it before you leave. <br><br>As for the negative: parking for Cheesecake Factory in Riverside Square sucks, for lack of a better term. Don&#39;t even think of getting a spot outside of the restaurant (unless you want to battle maniacs who are willing to sit around for 30 minutes and wait for spots to free up), but look toward the parking lot around the corner. For some reason, there is a never ending amount of people coming to Riverside Square for reasons I can&#39;t explain.<br><br>You&#39;ll probably want to order some kind of appetizer right off the bat, since the food can take awhile to be prepared - I don&#39;t blame the cooks, it&#39;s mostly because this place is swamped with customers on a regular basis. There&#39;s also a full bar near the entrance.<br><br>The wait time at Cheesecake Factory is usually long. Expect a good half hour or more on average, far more than that on a Saturday night - or simply don&#39;t bother on a Saturday night.<br><br>In short - great but pricey food, bad parking, long wait time. I weigh my ratings on the food above all else, but keep it all in mind!
Wish this place had more of a variety. Also not the cleanest - much rather Grand Lux - but aren&#39;t they the same? Haha I enjoy coming here with my family

T went there and had a cheeseburger with fries n a coke. Cost me 17.00 without the tip. Dont get me wrong it was delish, but i think overpriced. And their cheesecske forget about it. I personally dont think its all that the slice is so small  and too too expensive. You want good cheescake for less than 5.00 a slice and their slices are BIG and delish. Go to the Scotchwood dinner on route 22 in scotch plains. You wont be sorry

Oh.My.God.Where do I even start?<br>This place is just so amazing.Once you walk in it`s like you`re in a giant castle or something because of the decorations.The decorations were beautiful and the place was HUGE!<br>Since this place is known for their delish cheesecakes there are a lot of people who come here everyday so you`re gonna have to wait a while before you are seated down.Also,they serve you bread you can eat while you wait for the food and man are those breads good.There`s one dark bread that tastes just like chocolate and the white bread sort of tastes like lemon-or white bread with a hint of lemon rather.Over all,this place did not disappoint by any means and therefore I think this place deserves five stars (:

I have to admit - I &#34;use&#34; to come to CF a lot (keyword: USE to)...Chicago, Balitmore and now Hackensack.  CF seems to be my last resort on dining only because it&#39;s located next to my town and there&#39;s not a lot of good places to eat in Bergen County - why??!!!<br><br>I have stopped coming here - just thinking about the huge portions makes me want to gag. No wonder America is so fat. The oily pasta makes me want to go on a diet and the entree&#39;s started to have a similar taste?!  I have tried the meatloaf, sheperd&#39;s pie, steak diane, roasted chicken, chicken marsala, chicken picatta, louisiana pasta, chicken romano, nachos, taquitos, salads, sandwiches, cheesecake, etc.!!! God, thinking about it makes me wanna puke!!!<br><br>The dessert counter in front of the restaurant is evil.  You pack on 10lbs just starting into the hypnotizing glass of cheesecakes.  I don&#39;t care for them, actually.  They are too sweet and the only one I usually order is the Keylime or regular cheesecake with strawberries.<br><br>The restaurant is so dark it makes me wonder what it would look like with the lights on?!  Probably sticky tables and floors *quivers*<br><br>This place is packed on the weekends so if you have at least and hour to kill - by all means, wait otherwise I don&#39;t know what else to tell ya!

Another dreaded chain restaurant.... the food here isn&#39;t bad but it isn&#39;t great. It seems that they load all their entrees with butter which makes most of their dishes very heavy. <br><br>I don&#39;t go there often but once in a blue moon i will and i usually order the pasta de vinci or the bang bang chicken and shrimp :P one of the few times you will catch me ordering something kind of asian at an american restaurant :P

Been coming here for quite a few years now, nothing disappointing but nothing that impressive either. Being the Cheesecake factory and all, they do have some damn good desserts and cheesecakes to go. I usually pick some up before meeting up with friends or some sort of gatherings. <br><br>Nothing terribly bad about this place, and always has consistent food. They do some things phenomenally well though, like the Avocado spring rolls which I personally rave about. <br><br>The menu is ENORMOUS. They have almost every conceivable dish on the menu ranging from various cuisine, some of them pretty good. Burgers from what I remember are pretty good if you order the right one. Salads are great here, some of my favorite including the Asian salad, and the Cobb. Cant say I remember much else about the monster of a menu, though a few things are a bit too salty and just not suited for my taste. <br><br>Get the dessert!

We stopped at the restaurant on a busy Saturday afternoon. Restaurant was packed. We were seated outside (it was too noisy inside). Our waiter was friendly. There were two menus to look at-the regular one and the light one. I ordered french country salad and crab cakes appetizer plus side of mashed potatoes and my friend ordered tuna appetizer. Waiter suggested another tuna dish and after that another tuna dish with the explanation that my friend&#39;s choice was too small. Somehow it turned out into  a longer discussion and my friend ordered original dish anyway. <br>Salad arrived with a long hair in it. We pulled it out and showed it to the waiter. His reply was that his manager will stop to say &#34;Hello&#34;... It never happened. My crab cakes were undercooked. Bommer! Mashed potatoes were cold. Another bommer! It took forever to get refill of an iced tea. While waiting to be seated I noticed a lavish display of desserts which had a separate counter. I chose a carrot cake in attempt to soften traumatizing experience of being deprived of attention and not satisfactory meal. Carrot cake was stale. At this point we stopped counting bommers and left.

I&#39;ve been going to the CheeseCake factory for several years but just two nights ago my boyfriend and I decided we&#39;d go for dinner at the Hackensack location. The waiter was extremely accommodating. We weren&#39;t sure what to get so he brought out samples of recommendations he had made. We ended up getting the Ahi Tuna and Crispy Honey Asian Chicken along with a bowl of their New England Clam Chowder. Everything was great but I must say what made it really amazing was the great wait staff! Oh and the slice of cheesecake topped it all off.

Been to CF too many times to count. I won&#39;t be suprised it it&#39;s over 100. When they first came to NJ I was very impressed with the food. They had alot of good stuff to try. But as time went by the food seemed very simple. It&#39;s just dressed up better. If I have to pick CF or Houstons. Houstons anyday. But if it was about desserts CF will win that battle. <br><br>Maybe i&#39;m just grumpy they took out my favorite meal many ages ago. I do miss my Chino Latino Steak. Oh well maybe I will find another love, maybe.

I honestly loveee Cheesecake Factory.  I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever tried a meal that I did not like.  My friends and I always order the Luau Chicken salad, lemon herb roasted chicken, tomato-basil pasta and most importantly tuxedo cheesecake to top everything off almost everytime.  Yes, they&#39;re to die for.  I&#39;ve also tried their other pastas and they were pretty good as well.  Their service is usually pretty decent too.

Eat in: Noisy, long wait times, hideous decor, and service that is only so-so.<br>Take out: Reasonable wait for most orders, and they do curbside delivery which is a bit awkward given the layout of the parking lot. It&#39;s better to just run in and grab it yourself.<br>The food: I love their turkey club sandwich. It&#39;s gigantic and tasty. The fries are better than most, but not as good as some. All of the cheesecakes I&#39;ve tried were spot on. Their stone ground whole wheat bread is amazing and I wish I could buy a hundred loaves of it.<br><br>I give them three stars because of the less than pleasant in-house dining experience, and the quality/cost ratio makes this an occasional dinner option rather than the goto spot.
Pretty good food. The menu is a bit overwhelming. A few too many choices. Ok decor and ambiance. Service is up to chain restaurant corporate standards.
Food is god. This store seemed really noisy. Maybe the clientele here is the problem. Usual food but the server w a s lackluster. Like most the store was busy at lunch

On par with all the other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s I&#39;ve been to.  The pizzette were relatively new, and we ordered couple.  They were great tasting AND very well priced!  I ordered a peach smoothie, and found that it tastes almost exactly like their Georgia Peach, sans alcohol.  My friends ordered a glass of sangria each, 1 white and 1 red.  The taste was great, but it was a bit steep at almost $10 a glass!  For my meal, I ordered the lemon-herb chicken.  The meat was a little dry, but the skin was crisp and well seasoned.  The mashed potatoes and vegetables were fresh and very flavorful.<br>Generally a run-of-the-mill Cheesecake Factory... no real surprises here.<br>Try the pizzettes!

I&#39;ve been going to this Cheesecake Factory for years now. It&#39;s always crowded and the waiting area to get seated is kind of a hot mess, but the servers are generally friendly and capable (I don&#39;t ever think I&#39;ve had an incompetent or rude server here ever) and the food is good (generous portions).

There are way too many dishes on the menu. We ordered 4 different dishes and nothing was good. I usually avoid going to restaurant that have more than one cuisine on the menu. Pasta was just about ok. But definitely do NOT order any Asian dishes. I&#39;m not going back to any Cheesecake factory restaurant.
Food was fabulous. Timing was great. Appetizers were a great start to the meal. Main meal tasted great. Are waiter was very nice and filled up drinks every time we needed one.

Hit or miss. I&#39;ve had good experiences at the bar. Tonight, however, I chose to be seated. It took 15 minutes to receive water. My caesar salad consisted of iceberg lettuce (a la Wendy&#39;s), 4 small, cold pieces of chicken, and thinly grated Parmesan, which tasted like it was grated off of my grandpa&#39;s crusty feet. The bread was good, until a fruit fly large enough to terrorize Tokyo landed on it. Server was nice, but definitely had too much on his plate (as did I, when I left).

like the food, avoid on Fri, Sat evenings - it&#39;s packed. Stuff is friendly and helpful. Food is tasty (whatever i tried), deserts are huge .... Best lemonade (not some chemical watered down drink, rather nice tasting real thing)

Just left this place and I had to make a review. This is the second time I&#39;ve ate here and I cannot believe how horrible the food and drinks were. Me and my boyfriend arrived here around 8:30 and were seated immediately. We ordered our drinks and apps within the first 10 minutes of sitting down and thought that was a good sign. WRONG. My first shot of patron came out, it was small but I didn&#39;t mind and drank it anyway. The first app came out, it was just ok not very hot but we didn&#39;t complain, it took 45 minutes for the second app to arrive and it came out cold!!! We asked our server (who was so sweet) to send it back and he did with no issue. I then ordered a second shot of patron, do you know this shot came out in a dirty glass?! I did not complain, I simply poured it into the first glass I had and took the shot, to my surprise, it was WATER!!!! Now I am livid, I called over a random server and told her about my drink and she didn&#39;t seem surprised at all. She took it away and our original sever came back with a new drink. How is this normal?? What if I didn&#39;t notice?! What if I poured it into my juice on the side?! I was still going to be charged 11 dollars for liquor that was not even there smh!!! Our dinner came out a little while later,which was extremely mediocre. I will never be going back to this place. 109 dollars down the drain, I am so disappointed in this establishment
Everytime I visit this place it never fails me...from customer service to its food..I don&#39;t ever visit any other location...and its never crowded on Friday evenings around 6pm

Great service and great food.  One of the best restaurants in the area.  I&#39;m not going to apologize for it being a chain.  It&#39;s a great chain restaurant.  Favorites are the BBQ chicken salad, Asian chicken salad, herb-encrusted salmon, and the warm whole wheat bread.

Food was good but not great and the portion was small. Customer service was poor, waiter lost my credit card and wasn&#39;t very helpful. Neither the manager/supervisor apologized -- or offered any help or compensation.
I was last night having dinner with my son. We had chicken somosas, cesar salad and tostada salad. We both are sick vomiting and competing for the restroom all night!!!!!

I am not a big fan of Cheesecake Factory but they should be commended for recently adding  a low calorie menu.  The grilled chicken, ordered with sauce on the side, was very good and was not greasy at all.  The menu does not mention fat or sugar calories, so beware of overly sweet sauces.
Never understood the hype. The cheesecake isn&#39;t even that good not too mention the food itself.

The food is quite tasty here and the prices are reasonable.  There are negatives-<br><br>-impossible to find parking at night;<br>-the restaurant is warm.  The air conditioning is barely on, presumably to save $;<br>-the waitress could not remember who ordered which entree, which is bad form.<br><br>Recommended dish - Chicken Romano<br>Recommended dessert - carrot cake

The older I get, the less I enjoy Cheesecake Factory. Although they have me hooked on their fluffy cheesecake, I usually take it to go after a visit to the mall. It just seems like the entrees are cliché and not as flavorful as they used to be. Maybe a little salty. And the waits are too much when I have such a large selections of alterior restaurants at the same location. I have been very happy with the service, though.
Great food, great dessert, great drinks. Overall a great place to hang out with friends.

I&#39;ve been going to this place since 2006. Their crab cakes are amazing (better than any crab cakes that I&#39;ve tried in the Maryland/DC area), their cheeseburgers are incredible, and so is the cheesecake of course. The food isn&#39;t exactly cheap, but it&#39;s well worth it. Service is typically pretty good, too. <br><br>Easily my favorite restaurant.

One of the worst restaurant experiences I&#39;ve ever had. Large party 12 + infant), was given 50 min wait time to which I replied &#34;ok&#34;. After about 45 min, went to check on status and were told we weren&#39;t on the list because the hostess asked my name and I didn&#39;t answer. WHAT?! I was standing right in front of the hostess desk with my party for 45 min., and no one ever approached us for a name. Unbelievably rude hostess when the mistake was realized. Finally were seated, but by then I lost my appetite. No compensation whatsoever was offered when we asked to speak with manager. Will never eat here again.
I went for a drink at the bar prior to dinner at another place.  I thought the long island ice tea I got was overpriced and didn&#39;t have the alcoholic punch I was looking for.

Yes, we drove all the way to Hackensack because this is my friend&#39;s favorite restaurant. In fact, he couldn&#39;t believe I never went to the CF on Michigan Avenue back home. <br><br>I realize this is a chain, but I like it and can always expect consistent quality of food.<br><br>I love the brown bread. It is my absolute favorite. I can eat a whole roll by myself. Steve thought I was a weirdo when I  kept asking for the brown bread. I can&#39;t help it. I am obsessed. <br><br>I had the lunch size portion of their cobb salad. It was HUGE and I only finished a third of the salad. It was seriously one of the best cobb salads I&#39;ve ever had.<br><br>Steve had the Chicken Picada. He ate the whole thing and loved it. The mashed potatoes at CH are pretty special. I&#39;m sure they use half a stick of butter in them, but they are so deliciously whippy, chunky and good. <br><br>Yay Jersey!
Phenomenaly good chicken madeira.  Mediocre salmon from the SkinnyLicious menu. Way overpriced $11 skinny sangria in a wine glass.

For a chain restaurant it&#39;s good! Lunch size portions are just right. Dinner size portions are large enough for left overs. Dessert... Well they don&#39;t call it the cheesecake factory for nothing &amp; you can&#39;t leave without trying it!

I absolutely love happy hour at The Cheesecake Factory. The $5 price is a real deal for the appetizers. They serve a large amount of food. Also, the Long Island ice tea is flavorful. I would definitely rate them higher, however, the bathroom is always gross. Also, it is hit or miss with the managerial staff. Depending on the day, you will have an amazing, helpful and professional manager.

This is the first time that I dine in this place, I usually come here to buy cheesecakes, can you say Godiva chocolate cheesecake. OK about the dining experience, I was here with the fam having Sunday brunch, I ordered the French Toast Napoleon. It was real good, I love the pecans and the strawberries and the Chantilly sauce,with eggs were ok and bacon needed to be more crispy. The waiter was real friendly and attentive. I must say that the food isn&#39;t all of that, but its edible. Their cheesecakes are real sweet and hey who don&#39;t like a Godiva chocolate cheesecake? Some of the other reviews are just hating. This place is chill.

Hear Ye all who are poor and hungry, they&#39;ve opened a new Cheesecake Factory in Wayne but this location in Hackensack is convenient for those in the northern NJ area who can drive. There&#39;s parking but of course there&#39;s so many people wanting to chow down that the line is a little long. Just hang out next door at the Barnes &amp; Noble while waiting. They&#39;ve got average priced food but they feed you a LOT! Sometimes I don&#39;t even get the appetizer because I&#39;d be too full to finish the main dish. But I still like the one in Union Square San Francisco better.

Honestly, i want to hate this place because its a chain restaurant, but its definitely not bad at all. Large portions, good cheesecake, Above average food...its nothing to cry home about but definitely a &#34;yes&#34; if anyone suggests going here. I dont feel like adding to what other people are saying or even take away, because i agree with the haters and the lovers alike, but its still overall...a great chain restaurant. You will never hear me say that again.

The Cheesecake Factory, Inc., has a fabulous menu and I enjoy their selection. Tho it could be healthier, they even have brown rice now. And by all means, eat there, but know how they conduct business.<br><br>A friend who works there informs me that longterm staff with health insurance and higher hourly wages at her location are being frozen out with reduced hours, or baited so they&#39;ll quit or get themselves fired. She says the general manager has frequently talked openly about the fact that he will not keep people on staff who make a higher wage, and people who work at other locations say the same thing goes on there.<br><br>By the way, at this location, hosts and cooks receive a regular hourly wage, but servers, bussers, and bartenders basically work for tips, because by law the Cheesecake Factory only has to pay them $2.15 an hour as long as that plus their tips adds up to $7.95, or minimum wage...but if their tips don&#39;t make minimum wage (if for example they work slow shifts and don&#39;t get seated) the Cheesecake Factory forces them to declare, and therefore pay taxes on, more tips than they made. <br><br>Just an FYI.

What I like most abt Cheesecake Factory is it&#39;s consistent. The bread is fresh out the oven, the small bite appetizers are tasty and quite the variety.. and despite having such a large menu, I haven&#39;t been disappointed.   Although I&#39;m loyal to the Bow tie pasta w/ sun dried tmto n mushrooms, red peppers &amp; chicken in cream sauce... heavenly!!

It&#39;s the cheesecake factory, need I say more? The cons are always the long waiting period but I guess that is due to the fact is is part of a high-end shopping mall. Our waiter was very polite and extremely helping in choosing food from the insanely large menu. I love their new lower calorie menu. The Skinny Sangria was amazing!

I have been going to Cheesecake for years. I&#39;ve been to the Hackensack, Edison, Freehold, Cherry Hill, and King of Prussia locations. Everytime you go expect a wait, expecially during peak hours. The shortest amount of time i waited was 10 mins and the longest was over 3hrs. Luckily it was in a mall so I shopped while i waited. The portions are huge so be prepaired to take home leftovers. The options for food is endless. The menu is a book, literally. The deserts are never a let down and again they are big. I love the decor of the place, very tuscan-ish like. It&#39;s very warm and inviting. So for food and atmosphere alone it&#39;s a 4, for wait time it&#39;s a 2. Waiting can definatly suck, but the food is worth the wait.

we had dinner and lunch here many times... i&#39;ve written about CF in other reviews and b/c it&#39;s a chain i won&#39;t add another substantive review here.<br><br>however, i will add my 2 cents to combat bob p.&#39;s review below.  he signed up here to lower the rating?  what a riot.  what kind of business meeting is it when a &#34;rich guy&#34; and his wife takes him out to dinner to discuss business?  perhaps bob p. was on a prepubescent pornography interview where he does the &#34;rich guy&#34; and his wife after the cheesecake.<br><br>but bob p. mentions that he didn&#39;t have the cheesecake.  perhaps the &#34;rich guy&#34; and his wife were so repulsed and saw right through bob p.&#39;s pretentious attitude there was no boinking afterwards.<br><br>thanks bob p.  we will hold our breath and look for you starring in upcoming XXX features.

I&#39;ve never had a problem w/Cheesecake Factory.  The food is good, and they have nice specialty drinks.  It gets packed and LOUD in here, so be prepared to yell at the person sitting across from you. Of course the cheesecake is tops, but I&#39;m always annoyed by the advertisements plastered all over the menus.

I love this place and never get sick of going there, even though I always order the same things!  The Grilled Portobello on a Bun is awesome, though a bit messy to eat.  All of the desserts I&#39;ve had were delicious and pretty darn big (as are the food portions in general here).  I was disappointed with the fish and chips when I had them and will stick to my mushroom sandwich though!  Also, it gets really crowded and if you&#39;re there on a weekend, you will be waiting for an insane amount of time.  Otherwise, it&#39;s great!

Beautifully decorated and lively environment, although the staff could use a jolt of life! I had the grilled portabella burger (that&#39;s how they spelled it on the menu) and a side salad which was very tasty and extremely filling!! I didn&#39;t finish either but would come gain just because it&#39;s such a cute and spacious place. Service ok and the bathrooms are super clean.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! you can never go wrong here when it comes to food. Great portions, great prices, and it&#39;s SO F&#39;N YUMMY!!!.. any chance i get, I&#39;d go to this place whether it&#39;s on a date, birthday, etc. I especially love the cheesecake.. anything you pick, you&#39;d love.. and did i mention the drinks?! they are well mixed and fantastic!!

Cheesecake Factory remains a reliable, if calorie-disastrous, chain. Sweet corn tamale cakes are still delicious, and their pastas and burgers, while always a bit too heavy, are always well done. Everything about this restaurant, from the wait, to the service, to the food - is unbelievably consistent. A well-known surgeon commented that hospitals should run like a Cheesecake Factory does. To have such a wide selection of items that consistently taste good is quite an accomplishment. It&#39;s no wonder the wait is always so long.

Ugh. I just discovered the fried macaroni and cheese burger which is absolutely mouth watering but, I will NEVER return here again. I came here with my mom and grandma and a hate for cilantro runs in our family. We ordered our food and asked our waiter to make sure there was no cilantro in anything. A few minutes later, he came back and told us that the fish tacos that my mom had ordered has cilantro in the salsa. So, without any problems, we told him we&#39;ll just take the salsa on the side. When the tacos came out, we noticed that there was cilantro not only inside but sprinkled on top. We asked the waiter to take it back so, he did. Then, he came back with the same plate (although it looked like the cilantro was picked off a little bit) and said that it was parsley. No. It was still cilantro. A lot of it. We didn&#39;t even bother sending it back because the kitchen staff refused to take responsibility. This is nothing on the waiter - he was very nice... well, maybe it&#39;s on him a little but, mostly the kitchen staff. Their attitude towards this problem really ruined the entire meal and my entire feeling towards this place... so much that I&#39;m giving up my fried mac and cheese.

My rule of thumb applies specifically to this place. Rule of thumb states that if a place is packed at lunch or diner than they are doing something right. If you don&#39;t want to wait and hour to sit down and eat than quit squawking and go somewhere<br>else, i mean really its that simple. <br>.         <br>My favorites are the kobe burger the navajo sandwich and just about any salad on the menu they are large very large. Stay away from there steaks they are a bit pricey and a little small for the coin your shelling out for them not to mention they just aren&#39;t that good. The selection of cheesecakes to choose from is quite nice and the portion is quite nice also. If your a fan of carrot cake or strawberry shortcake i would recommend them also the the slices are huge.<br>   <br>I have never had a problem with the service here it has always been excellent the place gets really really busy so if your waiter isn&#39;t back in 2 shakes of a lambs tail with drink refills or something extra take it easy and enjoy the scenery.Come to this place early for lunch on the weekend 11:30 to 1 if you dont want to wait to long.If your gonna get your panties in an uproar b/c you don&#39;t get seated right of way at 6:00 pm on a fri sat sun than do yourself a favor and go someplace else. It cracks me up how people call this a chain restaurant your not gonna get food like this at tgi fridays or applebees so its really not fair to compare them to those types of low standard eateries. I come to this cheesecake factory since it has opened and highly recommend it, always consistent.

Went here for a early dinner today. On a sat night around 5 pm a 25 minute is wait is not bad at all. However the parking is just ridiculous due to the mall and like 6 other restaurants. There&#39;s only 6 parking spots! (exaggerating) but I did have to park pretty far. So we were seated and greeted. The waitress was very pleasant and attentive, no problems with her or any staff at all. Ordered the calamari app and it was great, lightly fried to perfection although to me it seemed like the portion had gotten smaller since I was there last. I had the Steak Diane and the ever so popular Chicken Madeira combination. To be honest I didn&#39;t like either all that much, the steak was definitely not seasoned, it was obvious they just cooked it and poured the sauce over top. Ive had this steak here before and it wasn&#39;t nearly as bad. Now the chicken I didn&#39;t like all that much either but I think that was due to preference bc the gf loved it. It was just to sweet for me. She had the Chicken Castelleta and that was better than both my chicken and steak. It was lightly breaded and cooked well. Actually despite the taste (of my dish) everything was cooked perfectly. The strawberry lemonade is goooood too. And finally, you need the Red Velvet Cheesecake in your life... WoW, I don&#39;t even know anyone else who even makes this, but they DO, and they do very well. Get it to go like I did and enjoy it at 1am.

I&#39;ve been here several times, the food is good. But the service is terrible. I think this particular branch has the worst service of all, nothing is done efficiently. They take forever to bring you even your drinks and bread. Waited twenty minutes for a cup of tea and left because I did not want to wait any longer. Not worth the wait at all.

My family very bad experienced on earth day. We had dinner celebration, Tuesday April 22, 2014. The entire family was happy because Cheese Cake Factory has Skinnylicious menu. Everyone enjoyed the dinner, not until we&#39;re almost done when one of the family member touched something WET on the table when he moved the glass to the left side. The area was wiped with cloth napkin and was positive of blood and was confirmed by its strong bloody smell like menstruation. At First I thought it was the sauce from the steak that might spilled from the plate until it was smelled. When the waitress came back to our table, I asked her if she is bleeding and she admitted that she has nosebleed and most often. I cannot explain my feeling how angry and scared. My family was exposed to body fluids!!!!  Another lady came, she didn&#39;t even introduce herself but I assumed she was a manager or assistant manager. She.was very defensive, stated that the waitress has nose bleed and cannot do anything about it. She further stated that as soon as the waitress noticed that she&#39;s bleeding she  went to the rest room until the bleeding stops. The waitress had nosebleed and she acknowledged that she&#39;s bleeding most often and STILL SERVING FOOD? The manager handled this situation poorly. I am thinking  should I report  this to NJ Health Department? Cheese Cake Factory in Riverside Hackensack management put the customers health at risk. The restaurant should have/must have the protocol as to what to do in case this situation arise. The waitress attitude is unacceptable. She didn&#39;t apologies as to what happened! She has the nerve to look angry at us. She doesn&#39;t deserved a tip even a dime.
The food at this place is great!  The menu can be a little overwhelming, they offer a plethora of choices.  The wait can be long at peak times but it&#39;s worth the wait!

I&#39;m usually not a huge fan of Cheesecake factory food, but my sister wanted to come here for lunch so I came with here. We both ordered lunch specials; I got the BBQ Pizza/Salad and my sis&#39; got the Shrimp with Angel Hair. First off my salad, was just horrible, i don&#39;t know if it was the dressing, veggies, or both but i took one bite and just but that aside. Then came my pizza, it really greasy and really salty. I was pretty disappointed. My sister&#39;s shrimp with angel hair was a fail too. She said it just did not taste good, and she ended up leaving most of it too. <br>And our server took forever to come around with our check and refills and such. It was a busy because of it being lunch time, but the quality of food and slow service, makes me not want to come back. I want to like cheesecake factory, i really do, but I always choose the wrong item and end up being really disappointed. The only thing that redeems Cheesecake factory is their cheesecake, my recent favorite is the Red Velvet Cheesecake. Its Cheesecake and red velvet cake in one. I took it home, but I enjoyed it with a nice glass of milk. It hit the spot. <br>Maybe I should just come here for the cheesecake cause the food has disappointed me one too many times.

My friend and i went here New years Eve and had a great time. The wait was 40 mins which wasn&#39;t bad for nye. they give you one of those vibrator things to hold onto so u dont have to worry about hearing ur name shouted out. we pushed through the crowd and found our way to the very clean restroom and then the bar, which had a corner seat open. so we were comfy for the wait. the waiter was very nice and attentive. huge menu with something for everyone. i had the steak diane which was perfectly cooked and then decided on the tiramisu cheesecake, which was DIVINE. There are so many cheesecake options it is nearly impossibble to make a decision so you might just want to close your eyes and point. One missing star is only because it is a long wait, and crowded and a bit pricey.

Had never been to a cheesecake location till this one and have now been several times. -Even though I am not a big cheesecake fan, the menu for this location and the assortment of other foods other than cheesecake is very impressive. The nice thing is that with the current economic situation the once 2 hour line is now 5 mins. Excellent servers and good food.

You just can&#39;t go wrong at the Cheesecake Factory:-) There is something for everyone in the family. Portions are generous and food is good. If your lucky and there is no long wait then you only need to enjoy the food! Staff is very friendly and nice.
I ate here like 4 years ago...so I cant remember what I ordered...I did eat at the location somewhere in california tho.

10 seconds ago this was my favorite restaurant... not anymore. The food and service is always remarkable and I&#39;ve come here numerous times. Today, I decided to come here with a couple of friends of mine. Usually, were used to crappy service.. sadly most restaurants will treat us like crap due to our age because they&#39;ll assume that we&#39;ll give them a horrible tip due to being teenagers. This service was beyond horrible. We started out our stay with a waiter who told us that she&#39;d be starting us out but they were under shift changes so our new waiter would be taking our order afterwards. After thirty or so minutes we finally got fed up and had to ask someone to bring us a waiter. She brought us our food but didn&#39;t come back until another thirty or so minutes to check on us and at that point we hadn&#39;t even ordered our dinner yet. We were fed up and eventually got to order our food and eat.   Once we were done we paid for our check and waited to get my friend&#39;s card back, but we never did. We had to speak to the manager to actually get anything done. Afterwards our previous waiter gave us attitude and a dirty look on our way out.

We waited 45 minutes for a table for 7 at the bar at the  restaurant in Hackensack Riverside Mall. . I had to request the bar tender&#39;s attention  after waiting a few minutes as she was in a conversation about her vacation with a server  When given a booth for six and a chair placed in the busy aisle we requested a round table that the waitress shared would be vacated in less than ten minutes.  The asst manager than told us that we had to wait in reception and could not wait at the table we were seated at.  We explained that our 92 yo mother could not stand waiting and we had already spent much $$$ drinking seated at the bar. We then asked  nicely to see a manager and were told there was no manager working. One of us than spoke to a second asst manager. Both were rude and arrogant. Then 2 mall security officers came to our table and told us that we would not be served and we were asked to leave.  They stated if we did not leave they would call the police.  We left, spoke with  the mall manager who was very apologetic. Other people at surrounding tables could not believe how we were treated.   We will never go back!

They have an excellent assortment of cakes. My favorite is the Tiramisu cheesecake. For every festive occasion I buy a cake from their menu.I would recommend them to all who appreciate good taste.<br> Sincerely, <br>Margareta B. Stanojevic

Horrible. We went during the day at around noon on a weekday. Hardly peak hours, not all the tables were full. I was expecting good service and food that was given care when prepared. We didn&#39;t receive either. We didn&#39;t get a bread basket, we didn&#39;t get drinks until we hammered passerby waiters for one. We waited 30 minutes for tacos in a lettuce leaf. Horrible, will not be returning.
The food is not bad, but I feel they can do better!!! The dessert is awesome!!! They are all good!! Any dessert you try you will fall in love with it, trust me you will not be disappointed!!

Faaabulous lighting, but almost undrinkable cocktails. My strawberry martini tasted like fucking rubbing alcohol and my cousin refused to let me order another one, especially since we dodged a bullet when they didn&#39;t card us and, as  another yelper noted, I have &#34;good genes&#34; and look like I am 15, and I forgot my ID at my parent&#39;s house. Two apps were more than enough food for two hungry ladies, but as expected, I was less than impressed with either of them. The buffalo blasts were basically fried dough with a little bit of chicken and the egg rolls were supposed to have this avo cream salsa with them that basically tasted like green mayo. Speaking of the egg rolls, they were like all onions. It&#39;s just like... is this really the best the suburbs have to offer? They also insist on playing music even though the place is so loud you can hardly hear the Blues Traveler &amp; Matchbox 20. Of course I was able to pick them out since that is the fine music of my fine generation. Anyway, for your money, if you&#39;re gonna be dining at the Riverside Mall, I think you could probably do better at Houston&#39;s or Morton&#39;s.  Or the Coach House &amp; Hooters across the road.

They have pretty decent food here considering the menu is ridiculously large!  They almost make a diner appear to have no options.  I, by no means have tried everything on the menu, but what I have tried has been tasty.  It is a chain, indeed, but they pride themselves on good service and consistent quality.  Without needing to be said, but I will say it anyways, the cheesecake factory has excellent desserts and they pride themselves on their vast number of different types of cheesecakes which are top notch.  I&#39;ll go here sometimes just to take out a piece of their cheesecake to eat later on, yea, it&#39;s like that!

It&#39;s a four star restaurant on a three star budget --making it five stars overall!  But I give it four stars because if I give it five stars, then it makes it seem as if it&#39;s better than Chakra, for example, which I gave four stars.  Chakra is clearly a better restaurant.  But Cheesecake Factory is half the price and it&#39;s a five star diner whereas Chakra is a four star fine dining establishment.  This is why a simple star or number rating fails to really capture the essence of the restaurant.  I mean, have you guys checked out Yelp&#39;s list of best restaurants in the country?  Not one single temple of gastronomy.  Just barbecue pits in the mid-west.  Why?  Cause you go to a BBQ pit and you eat decent BBQ and it&#39;s not overpriced, you give it 5 stars for a place where you eat on butcher paper and you get your own paper napkins.  You go to Per Se and you thought the waiter was 5 seconds slow in refilling your water glass or one of the 20+ courses simply didn&#39;t make you want to die from joy, you give it 4 stars.  <br><br>I mean how can any serious restaurant reviewer give Per Se 1 star?  Some disgruntled guy complained about Per Se&#39;s reservation cancellation policy -even though he didn&#39;t cancel it.  He was complaining about things that he didn&#39;t experience nor was relevant in any way to his dining experience.  He just wanted to hate Per Se.  Haters gonna hate.  But should you choose your restaurant based on that kind of review?  Meanwhile someone gave TKB Bakery -the third BEST restaurant in the US according to Yelp, five stars because they have the largest TV in a sandwich shop and the owner&#39;s father is &#34;a hoot&#34;.<br><br>This is why you should ignore the star ratings and read the narrative to see if there are any real dining experiences that are relevant to your needs.  (and if you don&#39;t have time to read and you just want stars or numbers ratings, go with the MIchelin Guide or NY Times or your local equivalent of a serious food review)<br><br>So, as to the Cheesecake Factory:  <br><br>Love the food.  Love the decor.  Service is always great.  I go there religiously but I have yet to try their cheesecake because I get full from just the appetizer.  Now I skip the appetizers and I still can&#39;t get to desert.  The portions are huge --which is great if you want to take leftovers to work for lunch next day but not so great if you&#39;re trying to lose weight like I am.  The one time I did get to dessert, I had the strawberry shortcake which is obscenely decadent --and delicious!  <br><br>The only thing I don&#39;t like is the wait for a table.  I have only avoided a long wait once --when I went five minutes before they opened for lunch.  Other times, including at 10pm, I had to wait.  On the other hand, I guess it just means that a LOT of people agree with me that the Cheesecake Factory is a great dining establishment.  So I bought Cheesecake Factory stocks.  I made a lot of money.  Thank you Cheesecake Factory for fattening my tummy and my wallet.
love this place...veggie burger is the best. sometimes it gets extremely busy ( weekends). Best bet is to go between 3 - 6.
good portions!...yummy stuff!!...i love anythin creamy..or cheesy haha..and obv the cheesecake is good...fun times after shopping
order the Mai Tai and the Wasabi Ahi Tuna! a mini vacation as far as im concerned!

We had the grilled salmon with mashed potatoes. I loved it. I ve been there 9-10 times and everytime i had a good experience with delicious foods. You must try the strawberry cheesecake, it is yumy, yumy and yumy.

I literally just walked out of Cheesecake Factory without ordering anything. My girlfriend and I were seated right away as it was not busy whatsoever. However, no one came to our table. We didn&#39;t get water, bread - nothing. We just sat like a couple of idiots. I finally was able to get the attention of a busboy and he alerted a nearby waitress and she looked at us, walked away towards a table with a newly seated couple that literally sat right behind us and she didn&#39;t even acknowledge us. Fine. I can wait 10-15 minutes but today was ridiculous. We waited literally! 30 minutes for anyone to even look our direction. My girlfriend even saw more customers being seated around us and they got their bread and menus right away. When the waitress didn&#39;t show up, we decided to leave this place. Forget talking to the manager...I&#39;m not coming back here ever again. I&#39;ll simply go to another restaurant. Sometimes the big chain restaurants forget their customers and lose their customer service. Peace out I&#39;m going to Maggiano&#39;s next door. FYI this waitress was tall, medium tan skin probably Hispanic with a dark black long ponytail. Thanks a lot.

love this cheesecake factory location -- right on rt 4, in the riverside sq mall -- HOWEVER, don&#39;t come here on a friday or saturday.  i have waited on line for 2 hours.  other than that, consistent good food and good service.

I have been here a few times and honestly, I have no good reason why. I mostly come for big lunches or dinners that other people have planned. The only thing that makes up for the food are the sizes of the portions but who wants to eat a huge plate of overpriced diner food? Not to mention, I have always been treated with atrocious service at this place--something ALWAYS goes wrong. Recently, I had to wait 40 minutes and was given a pager and was not told that I couldn&#39;t leave the restaurant. I went to the Barnes and Noble which was literally next door, came back after 40 minutes demanding that I be seated only to be told that I was called long ago and that they can&#39;t guarantee that the pager functions outside of the restaurant.  I was LIVID. What is the purpose of a pager if I have to stay within an arms reach anyway? The cashier didn&#39;t even apologize for failing to mention this vital detail. I demanded to speak to the supervisor who patronized me with a measly appetizer to shut me and my family up. He and the cashier were even whispering to each other and smirking right in front of us. We finally left after being seated--the idea of paying for such horrendous service disgusted me.

I went to cheezecake factory on saturday placed an order to go and noticed the fridge in back of the cashier where all the cheezecakes are kepted, with all the delicious tasting strawberries they have right? WRONGGGG, there is a bin at the bottom of the fridge where all the strawberries are kept inbetween a soaked up rag of strawberry juice. The bin looks old and dirty and who know how long that soaked up rag of straberry juice has been in the bin. I asked the cashier when a customer orders a fresh bowl of strawberries is that where it comes from, she made a disgusted face and said yes. So before you think about ordering a strawberry cheezecake take a look at that bin.
Love it. When ever i am away and theres one eat there. Not everything i have eaten there is good. But over all i really enjoy it and its consistant with the best desserts and drinks.
